loans.name: Ma'zoza

texts.en:
Ma'zoza is 39, married, and has six sons.  Her husband has a business raising chickens for sale, which he wants to expand by purchasing a large numbers of chickens. Ma'zoza wants to help her husband to get the necessary money, so she is taking a loan from FATEN. The new chickens will increase her husband’s income and improve the family’s living conditions. Ma'zoza is a conservative woman, so her husband is seen in the picture.


About this loan product:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see includes both the loan principal and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase a large numbers of chickens for sale.

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
Sabah is a 40-year-old woman from Baqa'a, Jordan and a mother of four children. 

Sabah makes accessories from her home and she is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase materials needed for her business such as beads.

Sabah is looking to expand her business by adding more lines such as doing embroidery so that she can increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for making accessories.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 40 years old and married with 2 adult children. Rosalina is from Capucao, Ozamis City. 

To make a living, Rosalina operates a charcoal-making business. She's been in this business for 15 years and she earns 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rosalina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

Rosalina is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase charcoal equipment. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Rosalina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with this loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal equipment

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 23 years old with one child aged 3. She sells shoes in a store she runs. The loan will be used to buy more shoes to increase her inventory. Any profits will be used to renovate her house. She would like to one day be a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara, a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school, lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

For the past two years, Sara has operated a business selling tea leaves to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the challenge of high transportation costs, and her dream is to establish a retail shop to sell her products in the future. With the loan of Kshs 20,000, Sara wants to purchase more packets of tea leaves to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase packets of tea leaves to sell.

loans.name: María Domitila

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco comunal Mira, vive por la parroquia de Zhidmad en Cuenca, caracterizándose por la belleza de la naturaleza, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, mucha de su población en especial la joven labora en la ciudad en diferentes actividades económicas.

Doña María tiene 62 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 8 hijos, todos son mayores de edad, casados y siete de ellos viven independientes, una de sus hijas vive en su casa y comparten los gastos del hogar. Su esposo se dedica a  la agricultura, la casa que vive es de su propiedad.

La Señora. María se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de quesillo, actividad que la realiza hace 5 años y vende su producto solo en días de feria. En su casa cría ganado, cerdos y borregos, también trabaja en la agricultura y lo que produce es solo para su consumo.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su nuera, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y abono para mejorar sus potreros.
 
Su meta es tener mejores potreros.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Mira communal bank.  She lives in Zhidmad parish in Cuenca, which is noted for its natural beauty.  The people there raise animals and work in agriculture and much of the population, especially the young people, work in different businesses in the city. 

 María is 62, married and in a common-law-marriage that has produced 8 children.  All are adults, married, and seven of them live on their own.  One of her daughters lives in her house and shares the household expenses.   María's husband is a farmer and they own their own house. María has bought and sold "quesillo" fresh cheese for the past 5 years and she sells it only on market days.  She raises cows, pigs and sheep and also farms but what she produces is only for the family.
Her daughter-in-law invited her to join the bank, and this is her first loan with them.  She will use the money to buy chickens and fertilizer to improve the fields.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and chickens.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: El señor Víctor continua con la principal actividad en la agricultura, el socio también siembra papas, maiz, quinua y tarwi, el socio tambien es peón en una bloqueteria, el socio en esta ocasión desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de semillas para sembrar quinua, tarwi y papa, el socio desea poder ayudar a sus hijos con sus estudios superiores y continuar con su negocio de manera exitosa.
texts.en: Víctor continues with his main activity in farming.  He grows potatoes, corn, quinoa and tarwi [lupine].  He also works as a laborer in a brick factory.  On this occasion he wants to use the loan to buy seeds to plant quinoa, tarwi and potatoes.  He wants to help his children with their higher education and to continue with his business successfully.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant quinoa, tarwi and potatoes.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Luisa de 45 años de edad, es comerciante y su marido es el señor Sergio de 44 años de edad, quien es chofer de una empresa de ventas de materiales de construcción. El matrimonio cuenta con tres hijos, los cuales aun dependen de ellos.
La señora Luisa empezó gracias al apoyo que le dio su marido gracias al sueldo que gana. Ella actualmente cuenta con una despensa bien surtida de productos alimenticios y de primera necesidad de la familia como harina, fideos, enlatados, panificados y productos de limpieza.
Agradece a la fundación paraguaya por el apoyo y dice que el préstamo lo solicita para la compra de productos de primera necesidad  como ser azúcar, fideos, arroz, enlatados, carnes y demás, con lo que podrá abastecerse y tener mayor variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luisa, who is 45 years old, is a merchant and her husband, Sergio who is 44 years old, is a driver for a company that sells construction materials. From this union they have three children who still rely on them.

Luisa started her business thanks to her husband's support through his wage. She now has a wide range of food products in her storeroom, including staple foods for families such as flour, noodles, tinned foods, baked goods and cleaning products.

She appreciates the support of Fundación Paraguaya and says that she is requesting this loan to buy staple products like sugar, noodles, rice, tinned foods, meats and others. With this she will be able to cater well for and offer a wider variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy sugar, noodles, rice, tinned foods, meats and other items.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Mariée, Akouvi est une femme de 31 ans qui vit avec ses trois enfants à charge à Adidogomè. Pour vivre et venir en aide aux besoins de ses enfants, Alouvi est une revendeuse du bois de chauffe et du charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile puis réalise une bonne marge bénéficiaire grâce ce commerce. Akouvi désire ce crédit pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois en vue de mieux revendre afin de maximiser son profit et aider son mari à bien s’occuper de leurs enfants et favoriser ainsi leur éducation scolaire.

loans.use: Acheter 14 sacs de charbon de bois.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Leah would like to buy 3 more steers

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is married and has a 16 year old daughter and a 11 year old son. Her husband operates heavy machinery in Sabinas Hidalgo, Nuevo León, where both come from. Household expenses started to rise because the children began to attend school, and the salary Delia's husband was getting was not enough to cover for all these expenses. This is why six years ago, Delia started to sell jewelry with the help of a relative. As her business started to grow, she decided to become independent. Now she has a successful business selling jewelry, and she works alone because she wants her children to dedicate their time solely to their studies.

To keep pace with the growing demand, Delia needs a $375 loan to buy merchandise and make her business grow. You can be an important part of this growth, Delia is thankful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Delia es casada y tiene una hija de 16 años y un hijo de 11, su esposo trabaja como operador de maquinaria pesada en la localidad de Sabinas Hidalgo, del estado de Nuevo León, de donde ambos son originarios. Los gastos en el hogar empezaron a incrementarse por motivo de los estudios de sus hijos y el salario de su esposo se volvió insuficiente, fue así como hace seis años Delia comenzó con la venta de joyería, ayudándole a una familiar, pero después comenzó a tener más clientes y decidió independizarse. Ahora ella vende sus propios productos y tiene un negocio que ha sacado adelante durante este tiempo, en el cual trabaja ella sola porque quiere que sus hijos se dediquen por completo a sus estudios.

Para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes Delia necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 375 dólares que empleara en la compra de mercancía, y para poder crecer con su negocio. Tú puedes ser parte importante en este crecimiento, Delia agradece tu apoyo y cariño.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Lesvia Maluc

texts.en:
My name is Lesvia R. and I sell women's cosmetics. I started this business three years ago. I sell my products in different public buildings and in the capital city's centre. My goal is to buy more products so I can sell more. With the extra earnings I will be able to feed my two year old son.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre esd Lesvia R. me dedico a la venta de cosmeticos para dama, tengo mi negocio hace unos 3 años, mi producto lo vendo en diferentes empresas publicas en el centro de nuestra ciudad capital, mi meta es tener mas productos para tener mayores ventas, y con las ganancias que obtenga poder aliementar a mi pequeño hijo que solo tiene 2 añitos de vida.

loans.use: To buy creams, deoderants, perfumes, nail polish, lipstick/Compra de cremas, desodorantes, perfumes, esmaltes de uñas, lipsticks.

loans.name: Beatrice Lum

texts.en:
Beatrice Lum was born in 1964 and is the mother of seven children. She was abandoned by her husband so she sought for a loan from GHAPE to help her invest in business so she can provide basic needs to her children. Since 2001, she has successfully invested, managed and repaid six loans up to about $800. With these loans, she was able to raise money to educate her children and provide food for her family.

Given a new loan of $1000, she plans to cultivate yams, cassava, and maize, carry out poultry and pig farming and raise money to save and construct her house. She plans to repay the loan in 24 months and the first installment of repayment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Beatrice would like to purchase chicks, piglets and seeds and till the soil of her farm.

loans.name: Imran

texts.en: Imran S. (his wife is pictured) and his wife own and operate a market in the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Devechi. Imran and his wife have two children and have been working with this business for the last 10 years. They have successfully re-paid two prior loans with Norwegian Microcredit proving that they are trust-worthy customers. They are currently looking to get funding in the amount of $1,200 so that they can increase and diversify their inventory.

loans.use: Imran would like to increase and diversify their product inventory.

loans.name: Mutiato

texts.en: Mutiato A. is a 45 years old married mother with 4 children. She lives in Lagos State Nigeria. She sells provision and food and has been into this business since the year 1997.  She needs a loan $400 to buy more provisions and food for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provision & foodstuff  for sale

loans.name: Lima

texts.en: Lima is a 53 year-old widow and a very hard working mother of three. Her husband was always very supportive and he always put his family first. Lima and her family lived on fishing as their main source of income. Unfortunately her husband died six months ago so her younger brother is now helping her. She really had a hard time especially when her husband died. She heard of SPBD so she was very happy to get such a great opportunity so she can develop her family business and change it into a better one.

loans.use: Lima would like to buy new fishing gear for her family's business.

loans.name: Kamuli B4(Iii) Group

texts.en:
This group has been togehter for one year. Sarah is 27 years old and married with two children. She has a salon business.She wants to pay school fees for the children with the extra profits. Barbara sells used clothes and wants to add in stock with the loan. Night has a poultry business and wants to construct more poultry houses with the loan. Margret has a canteen business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a hair dryer, to add stock of used clothes, to construct more poultry houses and expand a canteen business.

loans.name: Máximo

texts.es:
Maximo is a very hard-working person that has always wanted the best for his family. He is from Raquina and decided to work his own farm lands as a good way to provide for his family. He dedicates himself to growing alfalfa, lettuce, chinese onions, peas, and corn. He also raises guinea pigs. Proudly he tells us that he just harvested his pea crop and sold it in the city center with the help of his dear wife. Unfortunately the low price on his products has led his wife to find work in the city of Lima and her departure has brought much sadness. He still wishes to continue dedicating himself to his noble work in hopes of soon being together with his partner again. With the desire to improve the quality of his products, he's been attending agriculture courses and buys guides on raising guinea pigs. To put into practice what he has learned, he asks for a loan to start his next planting. Support this humble farmer, a hard-worker and family man.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

Máximo, es una persona muy trabajadora, que siempre ha luchado por otorgarle lo mejor a su familia. Él es natural de Raquina y decidió trabajar sus propios campos de cultivo como una buena opción de desarrollo para los suyos es por esa razón que se dedica al cultivo de la alfalfa, lechuga, cebollitas chinas, arveja y maíz; también se dedica a la crianza de cuyes. Muy satisfecho nos cuenta que acaba de recoger su cosecha de arveja que los llevó a comercializar al centro de su ciudad con la ayuda de su querida esposa. El bajo precio de sus productos han obligado el desplazamiento de su querida esposa a la ciudad de Lima y su partida lo ha sumergido en mucha tristeza; sin embargo está deseoso de seguir dedicándose a su noble labor para pronto poder estar junto a su compañera. Así mismo con el afán de mejorar la calidad de sus productos ha estado asistiendo a cursos de capacitación agrícola y compra boletines acerca de la crianza de cuyes.Con el deseo de poner en práctica lo aprendido solicita un préstamo para iniciar su próxima siembra.Apoya a este humilde agricultor esforzado y buen padre de familia.

loans.use: Injection of capital to buy better seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita G. lives in Thecho, Lalitpur. She lives with her mother-in-law, her husband and a daughter. Her daughter is in primary school. Her husband's name is Radesh G. and he opened his computer institute 6 years ago, where he teaches basic computer and graphic design courses. He has four computers at his institute, but that is not enough to meet the demands of the students. He wants to buy another computer, but due to lack of funds he cannot afford it. So, his wife is requesting her fourth loan to buy another computer to help her husband. This will also help to provide a better income for her family, and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy another computer

loans.name: Francisco Martín

texts.es:
The gentleman Francisco R., from the Somotillose neighborhood, has a jewelry business with his own shop in a bedroom in his house. He is visited by clients who request services such as jewelry repair, polishing, and assembly.

Francisco is a married man with the responsibility to care for his two school-aged children. He will always be found working in his shop, and for this reason he has succeeded in improving, thanks to his hard work. We also must not forget the support that Ceprodel has given him, which has helped him buy his work materials. Today he once again is requesting a loan in order to buy these work materials, trusting that this will be awarded without any problem.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

El caballero Francisco Rios originario del municipio de Somotillose dedica al negocio de joyería teniendo su propio establecimiento en su casa de habtacion donde es visitado por sus clientes para obtener los servicios de reparacion, pulido y armado de las joyas.

Francisco es un caballero casado y con la responsabilidad de mantener a sus dos hijos en edad escolar. Siempre se encuentra trabajando en su negocio y es por esto que lo ha logrado mejorar gracias a su esfuerzo y sin olvidar a los apoyos que Ceprodel le ah brindado el cual le han servido para la compra de sus enseres de trabajo. Hoy en dia una vez mas solicita el crédito para la compra de estos enseres confiando en que le será otorgado sin ningún problema.

loans.use: Purchase work materials

loans.name: Julia Maria

texts.es:
Julia lives in the suburbs of La Paz. For a couple of years, she has been running a business selling sweaters. She had to send her children away for some time because of a personal situation she encountered, but she has hopes that soon she will be able to offer them better conditions to live and be reunited with her children again. She works with this loan to increase her merchandise and improve her income. She has excellent credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora julia vive en una zona peri urbana D. la ciudad D. la Paz tiene un negocio D. venta D. chompas hace un par D. años tuvo que mandar a sus hijos al extranjero por la cituacion en la que se encontraban, por un tiempo pero guarda la esperanza que pronto pueda ofrecerles mejores condiciones D. vida y recuperar a sus hijos, trabaja con credito para incrementar su mercaderia y mejorar sus ingresos teniendo un exelente historial crediticio

loans.use: to buy sweaters and increase her inventory

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị T. is 29 this year. She has a family with four school-aged children. Before joining the TYM Fund, her family experienced many hardships because of her large family. Their income from raising livestock and cultivating plants was not enough to pay for their living.

In 2002, Chị T. joined the fund and her first loan request was for 3,000,000 VND to put more money into raising livestock for an income of 2,000,000 VND. Yet, she saw that raising livestock only helped to relieve some of her family’s hardships and couldn’t help them escape poverty. Therefore, after becoming more familiar with the fund’s lending process, she and her husband requested a larger loan to buy a tractor pulled plough and grain harvesting machine. They rent out the equipment according to the seasons.

Outside of their rental business, her husband is a construction worker and she continues to raise livestock and cultivate plants. Their family’s financial situation continues to improve because of their business-mindedness. They have a monthly income of about 4,000,000 VND. Chị T. and her husband have been able to purchase personal items for their family and put money towards raising their children and helping them get an education.

They currently want to raise another 12,000,000 VND to invest in raising their livestock and to purchase engine oil for the upcoming harvesting season.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị T. năm nay 29 tuổi, hiện gia đình chị có 4 con đang tuổi đi học. Trước khi tham gia vào quỹ gia đình chị gặp rất nhiều khó khăn do đông con, T. nhập từ chăn nuôi trồng trọt không đủ để trang trải chi phí trong gia đình. Năm 2002 Chị T. đã tham gia vào Quỹ tình Thương ,vòng vốn đầu chị T. xin vay mức vốn 3.000.000 đ để đầu tư thêm vào chăn nuôi cho T. nhập 2.000.000đ. Tuy vậy chị nhận thấy công việc chăn nuôi chỉ giúp cho gia đình chị bớt khó khăn hơn chứ không thể giúp gia đình chị thoát nghèo. Vì thế sau khi đã quen với việc sử dụng vốn và hoàn trả của Quỹ, chị đã bàn với chồng vay mức vốn lớn hơn để mua máy cày, máy tuốt lúa. Vào vụ mùa anh chị tập trung cho việc cày T.ê, tuốt lúa T.ê. Hết vụ chồng chị lại đi làm nghề xây dựng còn chị lại tập trung chăn nuôi, trồng trọt. Vì biết cách tính toán làm ăn và phân bổ thời gian công việc hợp lý nên T. nhập của gia đình chị ngày càng ổn định hơn.Với T. nhập khoảng 4.000.000đ/ tháng kinh tế gia đình chị đã ngày càng phát triển. Anh chị đã mua thêm đồ dùng trong gia đình, đầu tư cho con cái ăn học. Hiện nay anh chị muốn vay thêm 12.000.000đ để đầu tư cho chăn nuôi mua thêm dầu máy dự trữ để phục vụ cho vụ mùa sắp tới.

loans.use: To put towards raising livestock and purchasing supplies for farm equipment rental business.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.fr:
Born around 1966, Ms. Fatima O. sells ready-to-eat meals (rice mixed with some beans, called "atassi” locally).  She is married and the mother of four.  Two of her children are in school, and the other two are in apprenticeships to learn a trade.  She is on her third loan and does make her payments.  For this loan, she is requesting 150,000 francs CFA, which will enable her to be consistently supplied with inventory in order to cover a big part of her orders, which are continuously growing.  Also, she would like to improve her sales outlet by building a shack to attract more customers.  Ms. Fatima O.’s sales outlet is located in the Saint Martin district, near her home.  Her daily turnover can be assessed at about 8,000 francs CFA.  

 Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer


Née vers 1966, dame O.  Fatima vend du repas prêt à manger (riz mélangé à du haricot localement appelé "atassi" ). Mariée, elle est mère de quatre enfants. Deux de ses enfants sont scolarisés et les deux autres sont à l'apprentissage d'un métier. Elle est à son troisième prêt et rembourse bien. Pour ce prêt, elle sollicite 150 000F CFA qui lui permettront de s'approvisionner de façon conséquente pour pouvoir couvrir une grande partie de sa demande qui ne cesse de s'accroître. Aussi, voudrait elle améliorer son lieu de vente par la construction d'une baraque pour attirer plus de clients. Dame O. Fatima a son lieu d'activité situé au quartier Saint Martin à proximité de son domicile. Son chiffre d'affaire journalier peut être évalué à environ 8 000F CFA.

loans.use: To buy a sack of rice, two boxes of pasta (macaroni), ten liters of peanut oil, and various condiments

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is an entrepreneur from Kherson where she sells clothing items in the central market. She has been in business for about 6 years. Presently, Dina has about $8000 invested in her business.

Dina is a disciplined and responsible entrepreneur who likes accuracy in her work with clients and order in all business procedures. Dina is very consistent and thorough and handles challenging situations with stunning determination and stamina. She is requesting a 5000 Grivna loan to increase her turnover capital. Dina admits she needs financial support as her business continues to grow and develop. She is hoping to increase assorted inventory and her proceeds as a result. We believe her communication and managing skills will help this client achieve stability and success in business as well as financial independence.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of inventory

loans.name: Amparo

texts.es:
Amparo inició el negocio para obtener ingresos que le permitieran sacar a sus hijos adelante porque tenia 5 hijos a los cuales alimentar y el dinero no alcanzaba para la comida. Su principal motivación fue la situación precaria en que vivían y tuvo que sacar adelante a mis hijos ella sola. La situación era desgastante porque no había trabajo y por eso se decidió a vender por su cuenta y le dio resultados. Comenzó hace ya muchos años vendiendo en su propia casa de todo lo que pudiera, y poco a poco conforme sus hijos fueron creciendo empezó a salir a la calle a ofrecer la mercancía que tenia, incluso en ocasiones ellos también le ayudaban porque sabían que de allí tenían que sacar para la escuela y los gastos de la casa. En el 2003, consiguió un triciclo y de casa en casa se iba vendiendo y le ayudo mucho porque sus clientes se empezaron a incrementar y así podía colocar mas mercancía.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $150 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y poder continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Amparo began her business in order to obtain an income that would allow her to improve her children’s lives, because she had 5 children to feed but not the money for their food. Her principal motivation was the precarious situation in which they lived; she had to improve her children’s lives by herself. The situation was difficult because she didn’t have work and because of this she decided to sell things in her own business, and she got results. She began selling many years ago now, selling in her own home as best she could. Little by little, as soon as her children were older, she began to go out to the street and offer the merchandise that she had, sometimes with the children also helping because they knew that they had to do it in order to be able to go to school and for the household expenses. In 2003, she acquired a tricycle and went selling from house to house. This helped quite a bit because her clients began to buy more and now she is able to invest in more merchandise. She needs a loan of US$150 that she will repay in 6 months in order to buy merchandise and to be able to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To invest in cosmetics and hair products for her salon.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose A. is 52 years old and married with six children. She lives in Benin City in Edo State, Nigeria, where she sells clothes. She is happy because the festive season is fast approaching and the demand for her clothes will be high.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of N52,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María Elena forma parte del Banco Comunal “Palatinas Al Progreso”, del distrito de Tarica, provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Tiene 26 años de edad y dos hijos que viven junto a su conviviente que es obrero. Menciona que aún no tiene problemas difíciles y que afortunadamente todo está tranquilo. Considera haber tenido éxito en su vida personal porque actualmente está estudiando tejidos en el centro ocupacional de Monterrey en Huaraz. Su actividad económica en la actualidad es la venta de animales menores los cuales compra en este centro poblado y el Callejón de Huaylas y la venta de bebidas en el kiosco (lugar de venta transitoria) de su hermana donde a veces también expende chocho (comida típica de la región). Comenta que ha crecido regularmente porque empezó su negocio con S/.200 y ahora tiene invertido cerca de S/.1,800 en su negocio, tanto en la venta de animales menores como en la venta de bebidas y de chocho en el kiosco de su hermana.
 
Con este préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, invertirá en la compra de cuyes, gallinas y chancho para abastecerse y venderlos en Huaraz para las fiestas navideñas.
 
María Elena desea crecer y pronto tener su propio kiosco.
texts.en:
She is 26 years old and has 2 children and lives with her partner who is a construction worker. She feels successful on her personal life, because she is currently studying clothes at the occupational center of Monterrey en Huaraz. She sells small animals she buys in the town and she also sells beverages and food at her sister’s kiosk. She has grown regularly, she started her business with S/.200 and now she has about S/.1,800 invested on her business. With the loan of S/.1,000 which will be paid on 6 quotes, she will buy cuyes, chicken and pigs to increase her inventory trying to be ready for the holiday season. Maria Elena wants to grow and soon have her own kiosk.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy cuyes,, chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Marcelina Amerita

texts.es:
La señora Marcelina es socia del Banco Comunal “Dante Nava” del distrito, provincia, y departamento de Puno. Tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y madre de 4 hijos. 
Con su primer préstamo de S/. 300 compró diversos productos para venderlos en su tienda. Tiene casi 3 años trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que recientemente perdió a una hija después de un largo tratamiento.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará mayor mercadería para venderla en su tienda. 
Marcelina desea continuar trabajando para apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Marcelina is a member of the “Dante Nava” Communal Bank located in the district, province and state of Puno. She is 45 years old, married, and has 4 children. With her first loan for S/ 300 she bought various products to sell in her store. She has been working with the Communal Bank for almost 3 years and she tells us that recently she lost a daughter after a long illness. With his loan for S/. 1,500, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy a large amount of merchandise to sell in her store. Marcelina wishes to continue working to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Herdolfo

texts.es: Herdolfo tiene 62 años de edad, es casado hace 32 años, de los cuales tiene 6 hijos, actualmente vive con 3 de ellos en su casa propia. Durante toda su vida ha sido comerciante, ha realizado varios negocios, siempre cambiando de acuerdo a las temporadas y novedades, hace 4 años alquiló un local para instalar una tienda de juguetes donde se pueden encontrar de los más variados artículos, y aproximadamente hace 4 meses comenzó a vender también colchones, edredones y sabanas. Desde las 6am el negocio de Herdolfo esta listo para atender al público, al día saca gana cerca de 80 soles. Y como el paso de los años ha mellado en este hombre trabajador, ha empezado a sentir dolencias en los pies y no puede movilizarse con rapidez y mucho menos cargar peso; debido a ello sus hijos están a cargo del negocio bajo su supervisión. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, generalmente no puede asistir a las reuniones del grupo, pero es muy puntual en sus pagos, y está muy agradecido por la facilidad que le brinda la institución. Con el dinero solicitado comprará 6 colchones de buena marca para que le sirvan de capital y los exhiba en su local para atraer la atención.
texts.en:
Herdolfo is 62 years old, has been married for 32 years and has six children. Currently, three of them live with him in his own house. His whole life, he has been a merchant having undertaken several businesses, changing in step with the season. Four years ago, he rented a site to open a toy store where one can find a variety of items. Approximately four months ago, he also started selling mattresses, comforters and sheets. Herdolfo’s business is ready to serve customers starting at 6 am and, each day, he earns about 80.00 Peruvian soles. The passage of time has chipped away at this hard-working man, and he is starting to suffer from pain in his feet causing him to be unable to move quickly or carry heavy loads. Due to this, his children tend to the business under his supervision. This is his second loan with MFP and, generally, he cannot attend the group’s meetings but he is very punctual with his loan payments. He is very thankful for the support provided to him by the institution. With the funds requested, he will purchase 6 brand name mattresses which he will exhibit at his location to attract attention.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase some brand-name mattresses.

loans.name: Ekow

texts.en: Ekow, as he is popularly called by his numerous customers, is 41 year-old, local restaurant operator. He is married and blessed with 2 children. All his children are currently in school. In his restaurant, he prepares and sells rice dishes like jollof, waakye, fried rice, rice balls and "banku. Banku is prepared from milled maize grain and is taken with hot pepper or soup either in the morning, evening and afternoon. His food is very delicious and tasty and a lot of people buy from his stand. Ekow says that the prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and he needs the support of a loan to enable him meet his production expenditures. He wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials, like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood. Ekow belongs to a village bank called Believers of hope. He hopes to receive GH¢800 to make the business grow by restocking his inventory.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials, like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood.

loans.name: Um

texts.en: Mrs. Um I. was born in 1948 and she lives in Angk village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn her livI.. She now faces an obstacle because her field is infertile which badly affects her crop. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and to hire laborers to work on the field. Mrs. Um I. is a widow with a child who is employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to hire laborers to work on her field.

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es: El Cliente Juan A. tiene 60 años de edad. El es casado y residente en la ciudad de San Ignacio. Vive en domicilio propio con su familia--el es padre de 3 hijos mayores de edad. El Señor es propietario de una despensa, ubicado en la compañía San Geronimo de la ciudad de Santa Maria, con una antigüedad de mas de 7 años en el ramo. El destino de los fondos de esta operación de préstamo realizada en nuestra institución fue para compra de mercaderías(útiles escolares) para la despensa debido a que en esta temporada empiezan las actividades en las escuelas y colegios, de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Juan A. is 60-years old. He is married and lives in the city of San Ignacio. He lives in his own house with his family - he is father of three grown children. For more than seven years he has owned a store, located inside a company called San Geronimo in Santa Maria city. The purpose of this loan from our institution was to buy merchandise (school supplies) for Juan's store, since classes are beginning. In this way Juan will be able to increase his family's income.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for the store (school supplies)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock up on rice

loans.name: Kamolchon

texts.ru:
Камолчон Гозиев 1980 года рождения,женат, проживает в Шахристанском районе. Основное его занятие это животноводство. Откоромом и перепродажей скота он занимается около 10 лет.
 Хочет получить займ в размере 1000 сомпони сроком на 6 месяцев, для того чтобы закупить корм для своего скота.
  Дополнительно в его семью приносит доход выращивание сельхозкультур и переработка молока. В этом ему помгает его жена Фарида Гозиева.
texts.en:
Kamolchon G. was born in 1980. He is married and lives in the Shahristan region. His main employment is raising livestock. He has raised and resold cattle for nearly ten years. He wants to take out a six-month loan to the tune of 1000 somoni in order to purchase feed for his cattle. Raising crops and selling dairy products brings extra income into his family, and his wife, Farida Gozieva, assists him in these endeavors.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising cattle

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda tiene 43 años, vive en su casa propia con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Desde hace 4 años, su tarea principal, muy temprano por las mañanas, es la limpieza de su granja y alimentación de sus animales, cría pollos y cuyes, lo cuales vende todos los fines de semana desde su casa, y en algunas ocasiones en la feria ganadera de su localidad. Con la experiencia adquirida, Hilda sabe que en los primeros meses del año las ventas decrecen y los demás meses hay mayor demanda, esto le genera las ganancias que necesita para su hogar, por ello, desea incrementar su capital para aprovechar la buena temporada que se acerca para su negocio. Es la primera vez tiene un préstamo con MFP, y su primera experiencia en un banco comunal, para ella es un gran reto, porque ha escuchado que el trabajo solidario se expresa con el trabajo en equipo. El dinero que solicita es para comprar más pollos y cuyes para abastecer a sus clientes durante los próximos meses.
texts.en:
Hilda is 43 years old, and lives in her own home with her husband and two children. For the last four years, her main task, very early in the morning, is to clean her farm and feed her animals. She raises chickens and guinea pigs, which she sells on the weekends from her home. Sometimes she sells at livestock markets near her home. With the experience she has acquired, Hilda knows that in the first months of the year, sales decrease, and in later months there is greater demand. This is when she generates the income she needs for her home. Therefore, she would like to supplement her capital to take advantage of the busy season that is approaching for her business. This is Hilda's first loan with MFP, and her first experience with a community bank. For Hilda, it is a challenge, because she has heard that solitary work is expressed in the work of the group. The money she is requesting is to buy more chickens and guinea pigs to fatten for her customers during the coming months.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens and guinea pigs

loans.name: Gune

texts.en: Gune S. is currently in the business of selling clothes and is requesting a loan to stock more clothes to sell. Gune is 43 years old and is married. Her husband is a teacher. She has 2 children and they both go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To build a shop for clothing business.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor de Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Luz Divina.
Flor de Maria es separada, tiene 50 años y 4 hijos, natural de la ciudad de Ica, de profesión enfermera y trabaja en el hospital de la ciudad, Flor de Maria vende vinos y pecanas que adquiere en la ciudad de Ica, sus ventas los realiza a los trabajadores de diferentes instituciones.
Flor de Maria necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de vinos y pecanas.
Los sueños de Flor de Maria son ampliar su negocio, tener su pecanal y vender al extranjero.
texts.en:
Flor de Maria is a member of the community bank “Luz Divina”. She is 50 years old, divorce and has 4 children; Flor was born in the city of Ica and works as a nurse at the City Hospital. Flor de Maria sells pecans and wine to employees of various institutions. She is asking for a loan of $675 that will be invested in the purchase of wines and pecans. Flor dreams are to expand her business, to have a pecan’s crop and export them.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wine and pecans

loans.name: Look To Me Group

texts.en:
These people are Isatu A. K., Rugiatu K., and Makiya B.. They named their group "Look To Me". They are all local entrepreneurs based in Waterloo, a small town about twenty-two miles from Freetown. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Shine on Sierra Leone. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make better profit and consequently improve their standard of living.

Isatu A. K. (middle) is the leader of the group. Isatu is now age forty-one. She was born in Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a businessman and they have four children. Three are in secondary school and one is still not of school-going age. Isatu sells pepper, foofoo (a staple food made out of cassava), palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil) and other market food in Waterloo. She has been a businesswoman for more than twelve years.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Petita Jacoba

texts.es:
Sra. Petita tiene 39 años, es casada, y tiene 3 hijos pequeños de 8 y 5 años más un bebé de 2 meses. Ella trabaja como comerciante, vendiendo artículos para el hogar a crédito de casa en casa. Por ejemplo, vende sábanas, plásticos, y cubrecamas. Lleva ya 10 años con este trabajo, su esposo ya trabajaba en eso cuando se conocieron, entonces ella decidió acompañarle con su trabajo. Ellos viajan dentro de la región de Manabí para hacer sus ventas, por lo general venden en lugares que quedan a una hora de Jipijapa como Portoviejo y Manta. Venden más que nada a gente conocida; sus clientes pagan cuotas semanales. 

Sra. Petita está pidiendo un crédito para poder comprar más mercadería surtida al por mayor. Dice que para el futuro le gustaría tener una buena situación económica y un carrito, pero lo ve algo difícil con la situación actual de la economía mundial. Han bajado sus ventas en este último tiempo. Ella está pensando en cambiar de negocio en algún momento en el futuro. Su esposo también es ebanista, entonces a ella le gustaría poner un negocio de carpintería. Piensa que este negocio sería más estable, y además le daría la oportunidad de estar más cerca de sus hijos (actualmente una prima les cuida cuando ella sale a vender). 

La señora es socia del Banco Comunal Nuevos Horizontes, el cual se reúne cada 2 semanas en Jipijapa, Manabí, cerca de la costa ecuatoriana. Es un grupo grande que ya tiene bastante tiempo trabajando con la fundación, las socias se llevan muy bien entre ellas. Sra. Petita lleva 3 años trabajando con su banco comunal, y dice que le gusta porque hay pocos lugares que dan dinero con la misma facilidad, sin pedir muchas garantías ni muchos papeles. Lo importante es ser responsable, dice ella.
texts.en:
Señora Petita is 39 years old. She is married, and has 3 small children, an 8-year-old, a 5-year-old, and a 2-month-old baby. She works as a salesperson, selling items for the home on credit from door to door. For example, she sells sheets, bedspreads and plastic bed covers. She has been doing this job for 10 years. Her husband already was in this line of work when they met, and she decided to accompany him on his job. They travel within the Manabí region to make their sales, generally selling in places that lie about one hour from Jipijapa, such as Portoviejo and Manta. Most of the time, they sell their items to familiar customers, and their customers pay them for the goods in weekly installments. Señora Petita is requesting a loan in order to be able to buy a variety of more merchandise at wholesale. She says that for the future she would like to have a good economic foundation and a little car, although she does see the difficulty of achieving success within the world's current economic situation. Her sales have dropped recently, and she is considering changing her business sometime in the near future. Her husband is also a cabinet-maker, and she would like run a carpentry business with him. She thinks that such a business would be more stable, and would give them the chance to remain closer to their children as well (a cousin watches over them when she and her husband go out to sell). Señora Petita is a member of the Banco Comunal Nuevos Horizontes, which meets every 2 weeks in Jipijapa, Manabí, near the Ecuadorian coast. Her bank is a large group that has worked many times with Fundación ESPOIR, and whose members support each other very well. Señora Petita has spent 3 years working with her communal bank, and says that she likes it because ther are few places that are able to provide her with money so easily, without demanding excessive guarantees or paperwork. The important thing, Señora Petita says, is to be responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar más mercadería surtida al por mayor

loans.name: Beatrice N.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania. This is 50-year-old Beatrice M. from Mbeya. She is married with three children, between the ages of 15 and 22.

Beatrice has been running a used shoe business since 2003. Second-hand shoes journey across the oceans from America and Europe, and are then washed, and sold in bulk by wholesalers in Tanzania to retailers who then re-wash them for sale on the streets and in the surrounding towns and villages. These shoes are becoming increasingly popular, especially amongst the younger generation, because of their low cost, and the general appeal of anything modern.

Beatrice works at the business for 13 hours per day, 6 days per week. Beatrice currently earns about 80 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to buy more shoes in bulk. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Beatrice thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more shoes in bulk.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita Y. is Johnny’s 38-year-old wife. She is a mother of two children who range in age from one to nine. She is a member of ASHI since 2004 and has been running a variety store for a business seven years now. Years before she has an access to credit through ASHI, growing a business is yet a vision for Nenita. She has no sources for business capital then to be able to sustain the business together with the expenses her family incurs everyday. Her husband’s income being a laborer is sporadic thus Nenita’s profit and some portion of business capital were used for family expenses. Thereafter, through a loan Nenita had from ASHI, she has had grow her business making it to profit bigger. From a variety store business, Nenita has able to put up another business which is mini restaurant and videoke (video with karaoke sing a-long) bar in their village out of her profits. Her costumers in the restaurant and videoke bar are also her costumers in her variety store. Her videoke bar and restaurant are people means of relaxation and family bonding. In here, family members sing together and eat together.
Nenita is requesting for a larger amount of loan to improve her variety store business to be able to meet the demands of her costumers.  She wants to make sure that once her costumers are inside the premises of her business, their needs are met.

loans.use: Will be used for an additional capital for growing her variety store business.

loans.name: Jesus De Los Milagros

texts.es:
Jesús tiene una bodega donde vende bebidas en su casa, ella trabaja de lunes a jueves hasta la 1 de la madrugada y viernes, sábados y domingos las 24 horas del día, ha contratado una persona para que le ayude.
Jesús reconoce que es un negocio riesgoso porque a veces se presentan dificultades con los clientes, pero continua con el negocio porque está separada de su pareja y tiene que mantener a sus tres hijas. 
Necesita un préstamo de 2600 soles, para la compra de bebidas (gaseosas de todas las marcas y tamaños)al por mayor y gaseosas, le está yendo muy bien en el negocio.
El sueño de Jesús es emprender otro negocio, aun está evaluando posibilidades y nos manifiesta que sería bueno poner una carpintería.

loans.use: compra de bebidas al por mayor

loans.name: Latifa Group

texts.en:
Latifa is the group leader of this group. There are four members in this group. Each of them wants to take out a loan for expanding his/her business and making it larger. So they have requested a group loan of 56,000 Afghani. 

Latifa wants to take a loan for the business of tailoring. Abdul Wakail wants to take a loan for the business of fruit selling. Bibi Assell wants to take a loan for her curtain sewing shop. Khiber wants to take a loan for his taxi. So they are very happy with this process of small loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: For business progress

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es una madre de familia de 46 años, vive con su esposo (Roberto), de 48 años; con él tiene 4 jóvenes hijos; Cristopher de 21, Ylene de 19, Gianfranco de 17 y Gabriela de 14 años, todos ellos son el orgullo de sus padres.
Ella es una mujer emprendedora que no le tiene miedo a los retos, es por eso que desde hace 6 años empezó con la venta de gas (balones) en su casa. Al principio trabajaba como distribuidora para otra persona, pero desde hace un año ella es la dueña de su negocio; ya tiene dos locales y trabaja con dos jóvenes que la ayudan en las labores del reparto de los balones. 
En este negocio también la apoyan sus hijos y esto la hace muy feliz porque el negocio ha crecido en poco tiempo y es muy rentable. A Victoria le gusta su trabajo porque no es pesado y  ella sólo lo administra, trabaja directamente con una empresa de gas reconocida en el Perú que brinda garantía, pues Victoria dice que no importa que gane menos lo importante es brindar seguridad a los clientes que le compran el gas mensualmente, y ya se ha ganado la confianza de ellos. Para el futuro piensa tener sus propios locales ya que los actuales son alquilados y sueña con tener también sus propios camiones distribuidores de gas.

Este es su noveno préstamo con MFP, promete ser responsable como en los anteriores créditos. Además, sus compañeras de banco comunal también están muy comprometidas con cada uno de los créditos y ya conoce con quiénes trabaja. Como a Victoria le sobran las ganas de salir adelante, piensa invertir el dinero que ahora solicita en la compra de mercadería, más balones de gas, y así lograr conseguir la meta que se ha propuesto en la vida.
texts.en:
Victoria is a mother. She is 46 years old, lives with her husband (Roberto), and they have 4 young children: Cristopher, 21, Ylene, 19, Gianfranco, 17, and Gabriela, 14. All of them are the pride of their parents.

She is an enterprising lady who is not afraid of challenges and therefore she started selling gas (cylinders) 6 years ago at her house. In the beginning she worked as a distributor for another individual, but for the last year she has been the owner of her business. She has two premises and works with two young men who help her with the distribution of the cylinders.

She is also supported by her children and she is very happy as business has grown rapidly and is very profitable. Victoria likes her job as it is not a heavy one as she only administers. She works directly with a recognized gas company in Peru which gives warranty, and Victoria says it is not important that she earns less, the important thing is to offer security to the customers who buy gas on a monthly basis, and have confidence in her. For the future she plans to buy her own premises as the ones she uses now are rented and she dreams of having her own trucks for the distribution of gas.

This is her ninth loan with MFP, and she assures to be responsable as with her prior loans. Besides her partners at the community bank are also engaged with each of the loans and know the people she works with. As Victoria is very keen on getting ahead, she plans to invest the money requested in buying merchandise, more gas cylinders, and thus reach her life goal.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Po

texts.en: Po S. is a 29-year-old farmer who lives in Kampong Chhnang Province. Po S. is married to Koung Noeun, age 30. This couple work together in the farming business, and have been married for many years, but do not yet have children. Due to the coming rice farming season, Po S. wants to purchase a rice cultivating machine which she will use to improve the farming business. As she is not enough money to buy one, Po S. has decided to request a loan of USD$500 to add along with her savings to buy a machine. She proposes to rent the new machine out to other farmers to earn rental fees.

loans.use: To purchase a rice cultivating machine

loans.name: Mr. Yoen Yen Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mr. Yoen Y. repairs motorbikes and owns a store. Since his business is doing wE., he wants to expand it by purchasing motorcycle supplies to sE. to earn more income. His wife, Mrs. Haem Korn, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Mr. Yoen Y. is 55 years old and the father of three children: one is a track driver and the others help with their parents' work. Mr. Yoen Y. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. This village bank loan is for 17 people who all live in Barkou village in Takeo province.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle supplies to sell

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe E. is from the village of Binuangan,  Misamis Oriental. She is 56 years old. Fe is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Fe makes and sell food, primarily snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Fe earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and give her the ability to engage in business activities. Fe is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Fe from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Fhe

texts.en:
Fhe M. S., 33, was born on June 4, 1976 and is a native of Leyte, a province South of Manila. She is married to Isagani R. S. and together they have two children. Their eldest is now in elementary school, while the youngest is still too young to study. They currently live at Silang Cavite, which is a two hour drive from Manila. Their main source of income is selling livestock feed and gas for cooking.

Fhe has been a member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than a year now and has received a loan from CCT five times already. She is a regular partner who always pays her dues on time. Aside from the loans she received, CCT also offers bible studies in weekly fellowships so that they can learn and live the teachings of God written in His Word. Now she is more open and curious about studying the bible than ever before. Their fellowship group meets every Thursday at 10-11:30 am.

She is currently applying for a loan worth PHP 15,000 for the expansion of her business. She believes that with this amount, she can buy additional stocks for her poultry feed and gas reserves for her regular clients, enabling her to increase her profits and a chance for a better living.

loans.use: To buy assorted feeds and gas.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El Sr. Luis C. N. esta casado con la Sra. Florentina Coria Guzman por 37 años, tienen 3 hijos y 1 hija. Los tres Varones son independientes y estan casados, la hija vive todavia con ellos y esta estudiando en un instituto. Viven en Mallco Chapi al oeste de la ciudad de Cochabamba a 23 kilometros de distancia en una zona agricola y lechera, tienen casa propia.

El Sr. Luis trabaja con el ganado lechero desde hace 26 años, entrega toda su produccion a una empresa que elabora toda clase de productos lacteos para el mercado de Cochabamba. Tiene tierras en las cuales produce maiz.

Requieren el prestamo para poder comprar alimento para su ganado lechero y para poder realizar la construccion de un pozo y canales de agua para riego de sus tierras agricolas. Esto incrementara sus niveles de ingresos ya que su produccion de maiz mejorara y su produccion de leche tambien.
texts.en:
Luis C. N. and Florentina Coria Guzman have been married for 37 years and have 3 sons and a daughter. Their three sons are married and fully independent; whereas their daughter still lives with them and studies in an institute. They live in a house they own in Mallco Chapi, 23 kilometers west of the city of Cochabamba, in an agricultural and dairy area.

Luis has been working with dairy cattle for 26 years. He delivers all of his milk production to a company that produces all sorts of dairy products to sell in the Cochabamba market. He also has land where he grows corn.

They are requesting this loan in order to purchase feed for their dairy cattle and to build a well and irrigation channels for their crops. This would improve their income since it would increase their corn output and also their milk production.


Translated from Spanish by Helen Huthnance, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cattle feed and build a well and irrigation channels

loans.name: Divino Niño Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal “DIVINO NIÑO” está ubicado por una avenid, todas las socias son del mismo barrio, las socias son  muy unidas, es un grupo muy organizado, es su 1º ciclo son personas dedicadas a trabajar, para engrandecer su negocio Maria Roció es la Presidenta es una persona muy responsable, Yaneth es la Secretaria, y Susana es la Tesorera. Todas las socias del Banco Comunal tienen negocio, como ser: Venta de Comida, Venta de ropa, Venta de carne, Venta de bebidas, Ventas de Yerbas Medicinales. En detalle se puede mencionar que Maria rocio (la presidenta) se dedica a la venta de licores de diferentes tipos esta actividad la realiza desde hace 6 años atrás, Ilaria se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 10 años, Lucy luciel vende carne y tiene experiencia en esta negocio de 2 años, Yaneth se dedica a la venta de yerbas medicinales y de otros tipos desde hace 4 años atrás, Edmundo	se dedica a la venta de carne desde hace 10 años atrás, Veronica vende quesillo recién desde hace 1 año, Beatriz se dedica a ofrecer a sus clientes una variedad de abarrotes desde hace 	5 años, Ana karen tiene su peluquería donde atiende esmeradamente a sus clientes desde hace 3 años, Maribel se dedica a la venta soda desde hace 1 año atrás y por último está nuestra socia Susana que se dedica a la venta de ropa importada desde hace un año. Las socias indican que si tienen mucha competencia pero que igual siguen trabajando día a día para hacer crecer sus respectivos negocios y actividades. El crédito por lo general lo utilizan como capital de operaciones para prosperar su negocio, aumentar su capital, y poder surtir más su negocio. En su mayoría trabajan con otras Instituciones financieras y nuestra Instrucción pero ellas muestran un antecedente crediticio muy bueno, además que son responsables con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Divino Niño" is located on an avenue. All of the members are from the same neighborhood, and they are very close. It is a very organized group and this is their first loan cycle. They are dedicated to working and growing their businesses. Maria Roció is the President and she is a very responsible person. Yaneth is the Secretary and Susana is the Treasurer. All of the members of the Communal Bank have a business such as: Food sales, clothing sales, meat sales, beverage sales, and herbal medicine sales. In particular, Maria Roció (the President) has been selling various types of liquors for 6 years. Ilaria has been selling meals for 10 years. Lucy sells meat and has had this business for 2 years. Yaneth has been selling herbal medicines and other herbs for 4 years. Edmundo has been selling meat for 10 years. Veronica has been selling cheese for 1 year. Beatriz has sold a variety of groceries for the past 5 years. Ana Karen has a salon where she has been enthusiastically attending to her customers for 3 years. Maribel has been selling soda for 1 year, and finally Susana has been selling imported clothing for 1 year. The members say that they have a lot of competition, but the keep working every day to grow their respective businesses and activities. The loan will be used in general as operating capital to help their businesses thrive, to increase their capital and to be able to offer more selection. Most of the members work with other financial institutions in addition to ours, but they have a very good credit history and are very responsible about making their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: United People Club Group

texts.en: Angeline F. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called United People Club. She is 35 years old and married. She has four children, who are 2 months old and 13, 16 and 19 years old. In addition to her children, Angeline also supports her grandmother. For eight years, Angeline has been selling rice and soup at the Red Light Market, which is the largest market in Liberia. She keeps her stall clean and provides good food, which keeps customers returning. Angeline plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more meat for the soup. Her goal is to grow her business and to have all of her children attend school. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Angeline is the one holding the sign. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution, with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more meat for soup

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen A. is currently in the business of selling various items in a retail shop and is requesting a loan to stock bags of sugar and rice to sell.  Hellen is 39 years old and is married with a husband that is a doctor. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a wholesale shop.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock bags of sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Reyna Francisca

texts.es:
La Señora Reyna Francisca E. R., es madre de dos hijos  y responsable de su hermano de 13 años de edad uno de sus hijos y su hermanos estan  en edad escolar, tiene un tramo ubicado en el sector verdura ya tiene ocho años de tener su negocio anteriormente ella le ayudaba a su mamá a vender y estudiaba, pero con la ayuda de su mamá empezo a poner su propio negocio  a la par del de ella.
La señora E. R. necesita su financiamiento para surtir su negocio ya que su productos es perecedero y tiene que estar comprando a cada rato a parte que ella solo trabaja con nuestra institución con créditos ya tiene cuatro años y medio de ser clienta con nosotros y manifestó que ceprodel la a ayudado a salir adelante su casa ha mejorado bastante a comprado algunos muebles con las ganancias que le han quedado. Ella se esfuerza bastante para sacar adelante a sus hijos y a su hermano diario viene al mercado a vender a su puesto de venta desde las seis de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde.
texts.en:
Mrs. Reyna Francisca E. R. is a mother of 2 and responsible for her 13 year old brother. One of her children is of school age as well as her brother. She has had her business for 8 years and has a stall in the vegetable sector. Some time ago, she helped her mother sell and was going to school and with her mother’s help she was able to set up her own business exactly like her mother.

Mrs. E. R. needs the loan to stock her business since her products are perishable and she has to buy them all the time. Besides she only works with our institution, and has done so for four and a half years and has said that ceprodel (Kiva’s field partner) has helped her improve her living conditions by buying some furniture with the profits that are left over. She works very hard to give her children a good start in life as well as her brother. Daily, Reyna goes to the market to sell from 6 in the morning until 5 at night.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables:  tomatoes, onions, carrots, cabbages, chayote (a plant from the gourd family).

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Félix, de 35 años, es un padre de familia muy trabajador y sencillo. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Dina de 35 años, quien trabaja atendiendo su tienda de abarrotes, y con sus 3 hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

Muy temprano por la mañana, Félix sale a trabajar sus tierras que se encuentran a una hora de caminata, tiene sembrado gladiolos, alverja y lechuga, cultivos que cuida con mucho cariño y esfuerzo, ya que sabe que de la buena cosecha que obtenga dependerá el sustento económico con el que cuente su familia. Paralelamente a esta actividad, su esposa tiene una tienda de abarrotes, la cual también ayuda en generar ingresos para su familia.
Lo que más le gusta a Félix de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden afectarlos, es por eso que nunca se olvidad de fumigar sus tierras. En el futuro, desea comprar un carro con el cual el mismo pueda transportar sus productos.

Este es el cuarto préstamo de Félix con MFP y no quiere dejar de pagarlo por falta de dinero, así que ya está ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas. Él es de los pocos varones de su banco comunal, motivo por el cual siempre trata de ser responsable y respetuoso con sus compañeras.

Con la mitad del dinero que solicita invertirá en la compra de abono y fertilizantes, con el resto implementará mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Félix is 35 years old and is a very hardworking and humble husband and father. He lives in his own home with his wife Dina, 35, who works in a grocery store. He also lives with his 3 children, who are the reason for all his hard work. Very early in the morning, Felix goes out to work his land that is an hour away on foot. He grows gladiolas, peas and lettuce. He attends to these crops with much affection and work. He knows that the financial support his family needs depends on getting a good harvest. While he is doing this activity, his wife has a grocery store which also helps generate income for the family. What Felix likes the most about his work is planting his fields. He has been doing this activity for 15 years. He considers the most difficult thing to be protecting his crops from the diseases that can affect them. This is why he never forgets to fumigate his land. In the future, he wants to buy a car with which he can transport his products. This is the fourth loan Felix has had with MFP. He doesn't want to stop making payments for lack of money, so he is already saving to make his payments. He is one of a few men in his communal bank, and because of this he always tries to be responsible and respectful with the female members. Half of what he is asking for he will invest in fertilizers. the rest he will use to improve their grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia Felicitas; pertenece al banco comunal “LAS AMISTOSAS”, es natural del distrito de Urcos, en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco; situado a 1 hora desde la ciudad de Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 52 años de edad, la socia está separada del marido, ella vive con su nietito de 4 años de edad y lo cuida y quiere mucho; La socia se hizo cargo de su nieto a raíz de una incompatibilidad entre los padres del menor, la socia se dedica a la venta de productos secos, ella también tiene terrenos de cultivos, los mismos que sirven para ella extraer maíz y habas, pallares y los vende al por mayor y menor en el mercado central de Urcos su tierra natal; Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar semillas y sembrar en sus terrenos.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the “Las Amistosas” (Friendly Ladies) communal bank. She is a native of the Urcos district, in the Quispicanchis province, Cusco department; located one hour from the city of Cusco. Our associate is 52 years old, is separated from her husband and lives with her four-year old grandson, whom she cares for and loves very much. She became her grandson’s caregiver because his parents were not fit. [Felicitas] sells dry goods. She also has her own farmland where she raises corn and beans and sells most of the harvest in the Urcos central market. She is requesting this loan in order to buy seeds with so that she can plant on her land. She is very grateful for this loan and promises to make her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seeds for planting

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a single lady who doesn't have any children. Sarah takes care of additional family members.  Sarah is a teacher by profession and teaches knitting and weaving of sweaters, tablemats and other clothes. She has about 10 students whom she is training how to make sweaters and other clothing designs. She gets at least five customers a day. Sarah wants to use this loan of 500,000/= to buy more threads for sweater making, pieces of cloths and needles. Besides this clothing business, Sarah has some other side businesses. She sells at wholesale and at retail and makes clothing according to someone's wish.  Her major customers are the community around her and some schools and she works seven days a week. Sarah‘s business challenges include transportation and defaulting of her would be customers. Her goals and aspirations include owning a big vocational school, acquiring more knitting machines and even opening up more branches in Bwaise and Nakulabye. Sarah joined MCDT to acquire more capital and get more clientele.

loans.use: To buy more thread, needles and pieces of cloth

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
40-year-old Lucy P. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Lucy owns & operates a business venture planting and harvesting rice for sale. She dreams to succeed in all her endeavors.

Lucy joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Lucy has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Lucy is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Lucy from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Felisa's Group

texts.en:
Felisa J. is from the village of Binuangan. She is 62 years old. Felisa is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Felisa is married. To make a living, Felisa owns and operates a Buy and Sell Ready to War (RTW) business. Felisa has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2007, Felisa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felisa has successfully repaid previous loans from PMPC. Felisa is requesting a new loan of 38,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Felisa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more Ready to Wear clothes.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine L. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 45 years old. Josephine is married to Romeo L. and has 6 children. To make a living, Josephine owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. 

In 2007, Josephine joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She also plans to buy piglets that she can raise. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Josephine from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure and piglets

loans.name: Chai-Eang

texts.en:
Mr. Chai-eang H. (pictured with his wife), is 29 years old and his wife Mrs. Yat Hun, is 31 years old. They have been married since 2008 and just have a young son. The family lives in a small village across Mekong River, about 17 Kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Chai-eang is a fisherman and farmer; he grows rice on the farmland in his village. His wife has been a silk weaver since she was young. He is applying for a loan of $600 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his rice farm and buy silk materials for his wife’s weaving business.

loans.use: To use for farming and buy silk materials for his wife’s weaving business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase twelve calves

loans.name: Sueños De Cajón Group

texts.en:
This communal bank, “Sueños de Cajón” (The Draw of Dreams), consists of sixteen associates from the city of Temuco. These individuals’ livelihoods consists of sales including artistic manufactured and handcrafted wood pieces, the installation and maintenance of stoves, heaters, etc., and the sale of Avon cosmetic catalogue items, perfumes, firewood and coal, handcrafted steel structure items, eggs, cheeses and deli-store items.
