William is the president of the group and, in the above photo, he can be found in the second row, first on the right right, wearing a red and black sport-jacket and holding Fondo Esperanza brochures in his hand.

William’s business consists of manufacturing cars (the structures of vehicles), and also masonry (construction, fences, sheds, etc.). He has two employees that he oversees and they assist him in this work. This has been his source of income and his profession for the past seven years; he took this as his calling after completing a program at a professional institute. He will use this loan to purchase a machine that can cut metal.

William’s dream is to have a professional mechanic’s shop, with all the machinery that he is still missing (which he notes is a lot). At this point he has a small space available by his house for his shop, and it’s slowly being adapted. William would also like to provide employment for more people and continue perfecting his profession.

William is grateful to Fondo Esperanza as it’s been the only place where he’s been able to obtain a loan as he has no credit history. That is to say, he has never had a credit card, which other financial institutions look at as a bad indicator, such that they neglect providing loans to those who seek to improve their business.

Temuco is the capital of Araucanía Region. It is located 670 kilometers south of Santiago (the capital of Chile) and possesses a series of lakeside spa resorts and striking native flora and fauna. This region is also noteworthy for being the region where 50% of Chile's existing indigenous Mapuche community live, some of whom are members of Fondo Esperanza communal banks.

loans.use: To buy a machine that can cut metal

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba B. is a married woman who lives in Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures, a fishing and a butchery business. Her husband Carlos is 49 years old. He earns his living working as a driver and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have six children aged 14 to 25. 

Melba joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 18 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Melba has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000, thus raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 19th loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,500 which she intends to use to buy more fish to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future and education of her children. Melba B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy frozen meat and pork for sale

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina L. is from the village of Caraniogan. She is 44 years old. Gina is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Gina offers motorcycle transport to local community members. Gina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Gina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. Gina is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Gina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Mary Otieno

texts.en:
Mary Atieno, 31,  is married and has five children. Her husband, Joshua Otieno, works as a driver to help support the family and pay school fees and rent.

Mary is a fish monger and has been in this business for the past seven years. Her business is strategically placed in the market and she has a huge clientele, including many of the hotels around. She is applying for her first loan. She intends to use the money to buy more fish and add to her stock. Mary's profits will be used to enlarge her business base so as to satisfy all her customers. Her monthly income is 10,000 KES.

Mary's hope is to have a stable business and support her family effectively.

loans.use: Buy more fish

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 21 year old single man who lives with his mother and two brothers. This young man runs a home painting business that he established in 2005. He cooperates with his brothers to meet the needs of the family after the loss of their father. This man works hard to earn a good income. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1200 from the Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional paints and scaffolding to expand his business. This man wants to be prepared for new projects and he plans to take on bigger projects in the coming year.

loans.use: to purchase additional paints and scaffolding

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “Brisas D. Rio Blanco” ubicado en el distrito D. Pilcuyo, provincia D. El Collao, departamento D. Puno, tiene 53 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada y con 5 hijos. Tiene grado D. instrucción primaria incompleta.
La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace siete meses, el primer préstamo solicitado fue D. S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, el cual lo utilizo para invertir en su negocio D. compra y venta D. animales menores. 
Ahora solicitara un nuevo préstamo D. S/ 700.00 nuevo soles, dinero que le permitirá incrementar el capital D. su negocio y poder comprar un toro y así continuar con el engorD. D. ganados.
Su sueño es  seguir adelante con su negocio. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es trabajar en grupo.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the “Brisas del Río Blanco” (White River Breezes) Communal Bank, located in the Pilcuyo district, El Collao province, department of Puno.  She is 53 years old, married, and has 5 children.  She did not finish primary school.
This lady has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for seven months.  The first loan requested was 500 new soles, which she used to invest in her business (buying and selling small animals).
She is now requesting another loan, for 700 new soles, which will allow her to increase her working capital and buy a bull, to continue to fatten her cattle.
Her dream is to continue to maintain her business.  What she likes about the communal bank is working with a group.

loans.use: To increase her working capital by buying a bull.

loans.name: Paulita

texts.en:
Paulita C. is from the village of Kinangay Norte Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old. Paulita is widowed and has 2 school-aged children. Paulita owns & operates an agricultural business, planting & harvesting corn for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Paulita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Paulita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 46 años, es una mujer trabajadora y responsable, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Desde muy temprana edad ha trabajado en diversos oficios y en la actualidad trabaja como ama  de llaves, asimismo vende productos de belleza. En su trabajo, aprovecha en ofrecer sus cosméticos a los dueños de la casa y al resto de sus  vecinas. Cuando sus familiares tienen  compromisos de cumpleaños, optan en comprarla  a ella, por la gran variedad de productos que tiene en stock. Es así que su negocio le resulta muy rentable, solo que a veces tiene inconvenientes; cuando no le pagan a tiempo. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio, es la facilidad que tiene para captar clientes, lo cual le tiene como plan ampliar su negocio y poner su stand de cosméticos en su casa para recibir más gente. Este es su 18avo crédito con MFP, y se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, como en todo este tiempo. Es muy querida y respetada en su grupo comunal, ya que es la secretaria de su banco comunal. Con el crédito que recibirá, incrementará más productos de belleza, para tener su stock, asimismo abastecer los pedidos que tiene pendiente.
texts.en:
Juana, 46, is a hard working, responsible woman living in her own house with her husband and four children.  She has worked at a variety of jobs since she was very young.  She is currently a housekeeper and also sells beauty products.  She takes advantage of her job to offer cosmetics to the home owners and to the rest of her neighbors.  When her relatives have birthday presents to buy they get them from her because of the large variety of products she stocks.  The business, then, is quite profitable.

Sometimes she does have the inconvenience caused by customers that don’t pay on time.  What she likes best about the business, though, is the ease with which she acquires customers so her plan is to expand the business and set up her cosmetics stand in her house so that she can receive more customers.

This is her 18th loan with MFP and she commits to repay on time as she has done so to date.

She is highly respected and liked by her fellow members since she’s the communal bank Secretary.

She will use the loan to increase the amount of beauty products both to have in stock and to fill pending orders.

loans.use: To increase the amount of cosmetics she has to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en:
Julienne owns a retail store  that sells a variety of items like sugar, rice, cooking oil, and many home use products.  She is 41 years old and is no longer with her husband.  She has five children who are between eight and eighteen years old.  All of her children go to school. 

Julienne has been selling items in her store for seven years.  Her loan will be used add more merchandise to sell.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a home.  She would also like to be a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: To be used to add more merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Charles Victor

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANDENES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Charles Victor; el tiene 34 años de edad y es soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, el se dedica al transporte de turismo tiene una combi que hace servicio a turistas a las diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cusco, el trabaja en forma independiente, el socio quiere mejorar el servicio que presta a los turistas. El  socio solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “Los Andenes” which is located in the District of Cuzco, in the Province and Department of Cuzco.

The member’s name is Charles Victor; he is 34 years old and single. The member works in transport, dedicating himself to tourism transport; he has a combi van which he uses to provide service to tourists headed to different places in the city of Cuzco. He works independently and wants to improve the service he provides tourists. 

The member requests this loan for the maintenance of his vehicle. 

The member is happy to receive this loan, and commits to making her loan payments.

loans.use: The member requests this loan for the maintenance of his vehicle.

loans.name: Clarisa

texts.es: Clarisa, D. 62 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía D. su esposo y sus dos hijos mayores. DesD. hace tres años, Clarisa se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza y al mismo tiempo posee una juguería, ubicada en el primer ambiente D. su casa. Por las mañanas no solo se dedica a vender sus productos D. belleza, sino que también es la ejecutiva y líder D. su zona y es la encargada D. distribuir los productos a cada uno D. sus promotoras. Durante las tardes, a partir D. las seis, atienD. su negocio amablemente, preparando jugos, sándwich D. pollo y D. carne más queques. D. esta manera, está laboriosa mujer distribuye sus tiempos para realizar sus dos actividades que tanto le apasiona,  y le va muy bien, y eso la motiva a seguir trabajando con muchas energías. Para mas adelante Clarisa piensa ampliar su negocio y por ello su preocupación es comprar vitrinas para exhibirlas sus productos o queques. Es su 11avo crédito con MFP, y se compromete pagar todas sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido, y en su banco comunal es una D. las socias mas joviales por lo que todos la estiman. D. obtener el crédito que solicita,  Clarisa realizará más pedidos para la campaña D. san Valentín que se acerca.
texts.en: Clarisa is 62 years old and lives in a house that she owns with her husband and two older children.  For the past three years, Clarisa has worked selling beauty products and also has a juice bar located in the front part of her house.  During the mornings, she not only sells her beauty products, but she is also the executive and area leader and is responsible for distributing the products to each of the sellers.  Starting at 6pm, she happily tends to her business, making juices, chicken and meat sandwiches, and cakes.  This hardworking woman splits her time to complete the two jobs that she is so passionate about, and that are going well for her.  This motivates her to continue working with a lot of energy.  For the future, Clarisa plans to expand her business and as a result, her concern is purchasing display cases to show her products or cakes.  This is her 11th loan with MFP and she promises to make all of her loan payments in the established time frame.  Within her communal bank, she is one of the most cheerful members, which is why everyone values her.  In obtaining the loan requested, Clarisa will fill more orders for the approaching Valentine’s Day season.

loans.use: To stock up with beauty products

loans.name: Tseyenpil

texts.en:
Tseyenpil A., 63, is married and lives with his wife and a son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a house made from a shipping container on a small plot of land that they own, surrounded by a fence. This container was previously used to transport goods by truck. 

His older son studies abroad and the younger son goes to college. 

Tseyenpil operates a jewelry-making business. He began his business as an antique dealer in 1992 and has been operating his business for 19 years so far. Now he is a well known dealer and individuals come to his home to sell their items. 

He purchases every kind of antique item and uses them to make jewelry or sells them at Narantuul, the biggest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar. He has a pretty big collection of antiques that he is going to sell in the future. 

Tseyenpil is a very experienced man with a lot of initiative who is popular as an antique dealer. He says,"If you tell my nickname Halhyn Ih Lanjuu, almost every antique collector would recognize me."  

He plans to open his own antique shop in the future and therefore he needs to increase his profit. He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase more antiques for his business as people sell their antiques at a lower price during Tsagaan Sar, the Mongolian traditional New Year.

loans.use: To purchase more antiques

loans.name: Hermine

texts.en:
Hermine M. is 37 years old. She lives in Vanadzor city with her father and sister.
For about eight years Hermine has been engaged in a clothes trading business that she runs from a rented stall. Three times a month Hermine and her father go to Yerevan to buy merchandise for Hermine’s business. Hermine sells adult's and children’s clothes, shoes and newborn baby’s bedclothes.
She is asking for a loan of 800,000 AMD to buy spring season clothes for resale. This is Hermine’s sixth loan from Kiva partner, Nor Horizon, and she has never made a late payment on any of her loans.

loans.use: To buy spring season clothes for resale

loans.name: Elmira's Group

texts.en:
Elmira T., 52, is a leader of this group. She lives in a village Bokonbaeva, named after a classical Kyrgyz writer. Elmira is married and has a seventeen-year-old son, who is getting ready to apply to college this year. This is a very important issue for Elmira, because she didn't have a chance to get a college degree and promised that it would never happen to her kids. Elmira believes that education will open new doors into the future for her son. She says she’s lucky to work at the same place as her husband. It allows her to spend more time with him and quickly solve various problems. She is employed as a janitor, while her husband is a security officer. Along with these jobs the family has livestock and resells them frequently. Four years of cattle resells has helped the family to make major repairs in the house and a shed. The revenue is usually spent on family needs and invested back in the business. Elmira and her group have know each other for a very long period, and are sure to repay the loan successfully. Elmira’s purpose for the loan is to invest these funds back in her business and buy some more cattle. She strongly hopes that she will soon be able to earn enough to pay her son’s tuition. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase miscellaneous car supplies.

loans.name: Solidario Rosas De Saron De Sacatepequez Group

texts.es:
SOLIDARIO ROSAS DE SARON DE SACATEPEQUEZ.
Es integrada por 3 mujeres entre ellas  Susana S.  O., representante de este grupo, ella soltera  se dedica a la venta de ropa para dama, caballero y niño, como también la venta de productos  ONMILIFE (medicina natural)  desde muy pequeña es comerciante, ya que su madre murió cuando ella tenía 2 años de edad, y fue criada por sus hermanas quienes también son comerciantes,ella solicita este credito para la compra de ropa de toda clase y tamaño. Doña Graciela A. vende ropa típica en el merco local, desde  hace varios años, también tiene una pequeña tienda la atiende su esposo en su domicilio mientras ella está vendiendo en el mercado,ella solicita este credito para comprar ropa tipica por mayor y doña Margarita C., es vendedora de flores y verduras,  hace 35 años, con este oficio ella ha logrado mantener a sus hijos ya que es madre soltera,ella solicita este credito para la compra de verduras y flores, las tres luchan diariamente a pesar de las dificultades de la vida como la competencia, la inseguridad y también la enfermedad, tienen ganas de seguir trabajando y por ello solicitan capital para logran invertir en sus negocios, saben que haciendo una buena inversión ellas progresan junto a sus familias.  Ellas ya han sido clientes de FAPE en créditos anteriores y han demostrado ser mujeres responsables y trabajadoras.
texts.en:
'ROSAS DE SARON DE SACATEPEQUEZ' community bank.

This community bank has three members.  Susana S. O. is the group's representative.  She is single and her business is selling women's, men's and children's clothes.  She also sells Omnilife products (natural medicines).  Susana has been a saleswoman from a very early age since her mother died when she was two years old and she was raised by her sisters who are saleswomen.  Sheis requesting this loan to buy a variety of clothes in different sizes.

Graciela A. sells traditional clothes in the local market.  She has been doing this for several years.  She also has a small store located in her home that her husband works in while she is selling in the market.  Graciela is requesting this loan to buy traditional clothes wholesale.

Margarita C. sells flowers and vegetables.  She has been doing this for 35 years and, through her business, she has managed to support her children.  She is a single mother.  Margarita is requesting this loan to buy vegetables and flowers.

These three women work hard every day in spite of difficulties in life such as competition, lack of security and illness.  They have a desire to continue working and so they are requesting capital to invest in their businesses.  They know that with a good investment they will make progress together with their families.  The women have received previous loans from FAPE and have proven themselves to be responsible and hard-working women.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes in different sizes; to buy traditional clothes wholesale and to buy flowers and vegetables

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta B. is from the village of Galingon, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 48 years old. Vicenta is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Vicenta owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling specialty food products in the local community. Vicenta has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Vicenta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vicenta is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients for her food vending business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Vicenta from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Sopheak

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheak S. (pictured here) is 34 years old. Her husband, Mr. Saret Sean, is 48 years old. They have no children yet. The couple is living in a suburb about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sopheak is a garment-factory worker, while her husband is a motor taxi driver. Unfortunately, his motorbike is old, and he spends a lot of money to make repairs very often. It’s difficult for him to generate income to support his family. Facing this problem, Sopheak is asking for her first loan of $700 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for her husband

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia tiene 31 años de edad y  es una mujer trabajadora que vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo- Lambayeque.

Alicia tiene un negocio de venta de comida en el exterior del mercado Modelo (el mercado más popular de la ciudad de Chiclayo), esto beneficia el negocio de Alicia pues el lugar donde se encuentra ubicada tiene gran concurrencia y por lo tanto Alicia tiene gran demanda en su negocio. Ella cuenta con 8 años de experiencia en este rubro. 

Alicia desea mejorar la calidad del servicio de su negocio y ampliarlo por eso es que quiere invertir en la compra de sillas y mesas para este. Esto la ha llevado a solicitar un crédito de 500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa, para comprar las sillas y mesas.

Alicia es una mujer emprendedora que tiene muchos deseos de mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alicia is 31 years old.  She is a hard-working woman who lives in the city of Chiclayo - Lambayeque.

Alicia has a business selling food outside the Modelo Market (the most popular market in the city of Chiclayo).  This location benefits Alicia's business since it is a very busy spot and so Alicia has a lot of demand in her business.  She has eight years experience in this line of work.

Alicia would like to improve the quality of the service she provides in her business and also expand it.  She would like to invest in buying tables and chairs.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy tables and chairs.

Alicia is an entrepreneurial woman who has a great desire to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her business

loans.name: Deysi Cecilia

texts.es:
Deysi de 36 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución).su esposo trabaja como obrero en una fabrica y tienen tres hijo que estudian en colegios fiscales.

Comenzó hace un tiempo atrás ya que su esposo no tiene ingresos suficientes para mantener a su familia entonce decidió emprender su propio negocio de ventas de ropa. Labora diariamente ofreciendo sus mercadería a diferentes personas conocidos y amigos vende la ropa de mujer a $15 c una ropa de caballeros a $25 cada una, calzados $20 cada una. Le afecta en su trabajo la competencia ya que hay ciertas personas que hacen lo mismo. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar mas mercadería como ropas para mujer y hombre y calzados para incrementar sus ganancias. En un futuro quiere poner su propio local.
texts.en: Deysi is 36 years old, and lives in Primavera de Duran (an urban area that was originally irregular with various hills, brooks and ponds that are still present but it’s a disappearing ecosystem). Her husband works in a factory; they have three children that are attending primary school. Deysi started working selling clothing a while ago since her husband doesn’t make enough to support his family. She works daily offering her merchandize to different people, acquaintances and friends. Deysi sells women’s clothing at $15 each unit, men’s clothing at $25 per unit and shoes at $20. Competition hurts her work since there are people who do the same thing as she. With the loan, Deysi would like to buy more merchandize like clothing for women and men, and shoes to increase her earnings. In the future, she would like to have her own store.

loans.use: buy more merchandize like clothing for women and men, and shoes.

loans.name: Tuya

texts.en: Mrs. Tuya is 60 years old, widowed, and lives with her mother in her mother’s one-room apartment. She speaks Mongolian, Russian and English. Her husband was getting a PhD in the USA but passed away suddenly while he was visiting in Mongolia. After he died, everything she was planning in her life was torn apart. Then she had to move to Mongolia to look after her mom because of the health problems she was having. Her daughter is studying in the USA. Since she came back to Mongolia and she rented a small shop space in one of the shopping centers in town and started to resell clothes from China.

loans.use: buy more clothes to resell in order to make more profits to support her mother.

loans.name: Tunezerwe Group

texts.fr:
Jean-Marie est un commerçant âgé de 54ans qui habite la localité de Kibimba dans la Province de Gitega du centre du pays. Il  fait le commerce de la bière locale depuis 6ans. C’est un métier qu’il a commence alors qu’il était réparateur de vélos. Il est marié à Floride, une cultivatrice. Ils ont ensemble  9 enfants  dont 8 étudient avec 1a l’école secondaire. Il a fait ses études jusqu’en 6e année primaires.

Son crédit de 100,000frans burundais va contribuer à augmenter son capital et agrandir la quantité de bière locale pour revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Il est membre  du groupe  Communautaire« TUNEZERWE».
texts.en:
Jean-Marie is a 54-year old vendor living in the village of Kibimba, in the Province of Gitega, in the centre of the country. He has been selling local beer for six years. He started this line of work after being a bicycle repairman. He is married to Floride,  a farmer. They have nine children, eight of whom study, and one is in secondary school. He finished six grades of elementary school.

His loan of 100,000 Burundi francs will allow him to bolster his capital and expand the sales volume of local beer, helping him increase his income.
He is a member of the “Tunezerwe” community group.

loans.use: to bolster his capital and expand the sales volume of local beer, helping him increase his income

loans.name: Serrana

texts.en:
Serrana is 33 years old and lives in Kakata, a town to the north of Monrovia.  She is married and her husband is a businessman.  They have 2 children, age 9 and 3; the youngest is still at home and the other goes to school.  She attended school herself reaching seventh grade.

She has a small business selling dried meat, oil and peppers which she has run for 7 years.  The main obstacle to her business is the very poor condition of the roads which makes it difficult to transport goods.  She started the business with a small loan from her husband.  Serrana has requested a loan to purchase more stock for the business and to help with the family expenses.  In the future, she hopes to buy some land and build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more food stock for the business

loans.name: Jonabeth

texts.en:
Jonabeth is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children.
 
Jonabeth has a retail shop that sells canned goods, beverages and snacks. She has had this business for a year. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

Jonabeth is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MARIA ELENA MOYANO”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Teofilo; el socio tiene  56 años de edad; el socio tiene 3 hijos de 38, 30, 14 años de edad,  el socio es casado y el socio  es el promotor de un jardín de niños, el cual a iniciado junto a su esposa la directora y a sus hijas las profesoras de nivel inicial, el jardín es muy bello y acogedor, el socio es muy gentil, amistoso y goza de un increíble humor, el socio viene trabajando desde hace 20 años y el desea seguir implementado las aulas, los baños, los útiles escolares, los mapas, los cuadros didácticos , renovar paredes, fachada y siempre es una inversión, el socio en esta ocasión desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de algunos cuadros didácticos, de pinturas para el jardín, de mejorar y ambientar con figuritas y pinturas de dibujos animados el jardín y las diversas aulas. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar pintura y pago al pintor y a los dibujantes que harán las figuras animadas para el jardín y las aulas, comprar mapas didácticos de diferentes actividades.

El socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Sr. Teofilo is a member of the Communal Bank “Maria Elena Moyano” which is located in the District of Huanchac in the Province and Department of Cusco.

He is 56 years old, married, and has three children (ages 38, 30, and 14). Teofilo is the promoter for a children’s kindergarten that he started with his wife, who is the director, and his daughters, who are preschool teachers. Their school is very beautiful and inviting. Teofilo is gentle, friendly, and has an incredible sense of humor. He has been working for 20 years and wants to continue utilizing the classrooms, bathrooms, school supplies, maps, textbooks, as well as repair the walls and façade since these items are always an investment. On this occasion, Teofilo wants to invest this loan in the purchase of some educational workbooks, children’s paints, as well as improve and enliven the atmosphere by adding figurines and animated paintings across the school and in different classrooms.

Teofilo is requesting a loan to buy paint and to pay a painter and draftsmen to make figurines for the school and classrooms. He will also buy educational maps for different activities.

Teofilo is grateful for the support that has been provided, so he promises to complete his payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy educational maps, paints, and to pay a painter and draftsmen to create figurines for the school and classrooms.

loans.name: Luan's Group

texts.en:
Luan was born in 1963. She lives in Kinh No village, Uy No Commune, Dong Anh district. She has three sons. Her husband is a builder.

Mrs. Luan sells clothes in the market. She has had this job for ten years. She has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND). This is the first time she joined SEDA. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy more new clothes to resell. She is the group leader of 5-member group loan from SEDA.

About the other borrowers in her group:

Thuy is 20 years old. She has one child. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND for her small business.

Huong is 31 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy food for pigs.

Xo is 24 years old. She has one child. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND for her small business.

Thom is 27 years old. She has one child. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy food for chickens.

loans.use: to buy more new clothes to resell

loans.name: Maximo Alejandro

texts.es:
Máximo Alejandro tiene 43 años de edad es casado vive con la esposa y con los dos hijos de 23, 18 años de edad en el cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la VCR Caminando Hacia el Futuro, Se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Jesús de gran Poder, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

Máximo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, Compra sus productos en el Comercial Marlín y las ventas en la misma localidad y en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, insumos, líquidos, urea y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es poder comprar un terreno para poder hacer una casa para la familia.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a pasear y dedicar más tiempo al trabajo.
texts.en:
Máximo Alejandro, 43, is married and lives with his wife and two children, 23 and 18, in Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Ríos.

The members of the Caminando Hacia el Futuro Communal Bank, located in the Jesús de Gran Poder area of Ventanas Canton, work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Máximo works in agriculture, growing corn and rice.  He buys his products in Marlín Store and in the stalls there and in Ventanas.

He is requesting the loan to buy seed, supplies, liquid fertilizer, urea, and fertilizer for his crops.  The support of the loan would help him economically to supplement his needs, to confront challenges like disease and illness.  His dream is to be able to buy a piece of land to build a house for his family.

In his spare time, Máximo likes to go for walks and spend more time working.

loans.use: to buy seed, supplies, liquid fertilizer, urea, and fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr:
Abla est une femme de 42 ans, elle est mariée à un chef magasinier et mère de 7 enfants. Elle est couturière de formation, elle achète des tissus pour confectionner des habits qu’elle revend à ses clients. Elle travaille seule dans son activité.
Komi sollicite le premier crédit de WAGES pour acheter des tissus afin de confectionner des habits et les revendre.
texts.en: Abla is a 42-year-old woman who is married to a store manager. She is the mother of seven children. Abla is a trained seamstress. She buys fabrics to make clothing that she resells to her customers. She works by herself in her business. She is requesting an initial loan from WAGES to buy some cloth in order to make clothing to sell.

loans.use: to buy fabrics

loans.name: Leon

texts.en: Leon is a 27-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and only sibling. He started his career in 2005 working in installing solar energy systems in houses. He works independently in his business. With his requested loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will be able to purchase new equipment that will help him install solar energy systems more easily. In the future, he plans to open his own shop and start dealing with a bigger number of customers to earn good income and be able to better support his family.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment that will help him install solar energy systems more easily.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en: Phally, 45 years old, is a worker (she was employed to work in a factory that produce fish product) who earns $2.8 per day. Her husband is also a worker earning $5 per day. They live with three children, two are studying and one is working at the border of Cambodia and Thailand earning about $5 per day. Every month, Phally has to spend $60 on food, $10 on electricity, $40 on school fees, and $14 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy grocery store goods for her daughter to sell. Her daughter is married and needs capital to start a business. Phally and her husband have been working as laborers for years because they don’t have any knowledge to do anther job. She hopes her daughter would do well in her new career so that they can support themselves.

loans.use: To buy grocery store goods for her daughter to sell

loans.name: Luz Aurora

texts.es: La señora Luz Aurora sigue con el consultorio médico y le va muy bien, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de los equipos médicos. La señora Luz Aurora es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras siguen confiando en ella. La señora Luz Aurora está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Luz Aurora continues with her medical office and is doing very well.  On this occasion she needs the loan to provide maintenance for the medical equipment.  Luz Aurora is a responsible, hardworking person and her fellow group members continue trusting her because of these qualities.  Luz Aurora is happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to provide maintenance for her medical equipment.

loans.name: Lowenda

texts.en: Lowenda is a 43-year-old woman. She is married with two sons and one daughter. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Lowenda is looking to change her old home furniture and purchase new items such as living room seats, dining room furniture, and bedroom furniture, but the amount of money she has isn't enough. She needs to take a loan of $3,000 from FATEN. When Lowenda gets the loan, she will be able to purchase new home furniture and offer her family comfortable home living conditions. Lowenda is a conservative woman, so her husband Mahmoud is shown in the photograph instead in the FATEN branch.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture and improve her family's life.

loans.name: Baruela

texts.en:
This is Baruela, 60, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Samson, an overseas contract worker. She is the mother of four children. All of her children are working. At her age, she still wants to keep herself busy, which is why she never stopped her business. 

Baruela owns a variety store. She buys groceries like canned goods, condiments, milk, and sugar: primary commodities that are needed in every household. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors in the local community. She earns a minimum of 350 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 23,000 PHP loan. She will utilize the loan to buy more grocery items in order to have more inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. It will help to attract more customers to buy in her variety store. More sales will result in more profits. It will help her to save more money for her utility bills. 

Baruela hopes that her business will continue to generate an income that is sufficient enough for the needs of her family. She dreams that she can continue to help some of her extended family. She wants to share her blessings with those who are in need. She hopes that her children will have their own families someday. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as it inspires her to be more God-loving, and it strengthens her spiritual life.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for her store

loans.name: Dolgorjav

texts.en:
Dolgorjav is 37 years old and lives with her husband and two kids in her own apartment in the Selenge province of Mongolia. Her husband is a security guard at the local bank and her two children are students. 

Dolgorjav started her hairdressing business in 1993. She is very experienced and a talented, bright woman. Her business is stable and well known by the locals. Now that her business is stable enough, Dolgorjav wants to increase her family income by buying a car so her husband can run a taxi service. 

She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "My husband's income is relatively low, and I want to increase it in order to raise our children properly." She is requesting 3,500,000 MNT to buy a car for her family.

loans.use: to buy a car.

loans.name: Domitila De Jesus

texts.es:
La sra. Domitila de Jesus tiene 51 años, vive en la colonia brisas del sur de la ciudad de Choluteca, Domitila es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada a su negocio propio que es la venta  de ropa  americana, tiene mas de 7 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, la ropa la vende en su casa y tambien la vende en diferentes empresas de la ciudad de choluteca, Domitila se levanta a las 6 de la mañana todos los dias para atender a su clientela. 
Domitila es madre de 2 hijos, los cuales son mayores de edad, y en ocaciones le ayudan economicamente.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa, ya viene la epoca de navidad y es cuando mas vende, pero en estos momentos no tiene capital suficiente para comprar mas ropa.         
Sus tiempos libres los dedica para visitar la iglesia y tambien para la crianza de gallinas.
texts.en:
Domitila de Jesús, 51, lives in the city of Choluteca’s Brisas del Sur neighborhood.  Domitila is an enterprising woman who is dedicated to her business which is sales of American clothing.  She’s been in this line of work for more than 7 years.  She sells the clothes at home and also in various firms in the city of Choluteca.  Domitila rises at 6am every day to tend to her customers.  

Domitila is the mother of two children who are adults and sometimes help her out economically.  She will use the loan to buy clothing because the Christmas season is near and that’s when she sells the most but she doesn’t have enough capital at the moment to buy more clothes.  In her free time she attends church and raises chickens.

loans.use: to buy women's, men's and children's clothing.

loans.name: Nicaja Dos Group

texts.es:
La señora Lesbia es casada, tiene 27 años de edad, no tuvo oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 3 hijos 1 de los cuales esta estudiando, se dedica ala confección de prendas, inició este negocio confeccionando pantalones y hasta el momento lleva 6 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al mismo oficio.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un prestamos que lo utilizara para la compra de maquinas in industriales, y mejorar su producción de pantalones. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales.
texts.en:
Lesbia is married. She is 27 years old. She had no opportunity to study. She has three children, one of which is studying.

She works making clothing. She began this business making pants and she has had six years experience up to now, with the help of her husband who works in the same trade. 

Organizing a group to ask for loans this member is asking for a loan to use to buy industrial machines in order to improve the production of pants and the other members of the group work in agriculture and the breeding of animals.

loans.use: to buy an industrial machine

loans.name: Elaine

texts.en:
Elaine is married, 31 years of age and has two children.

Elaine owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has one year of experience in this business. Elaine needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase chemicals such as gromozones and pesticides, shovels and a wheelbarrow for her business. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be WST 250 or USD $104 per week) to improve or expand the business.

Elaine joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Elaine's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals such as gromozones and pesticides, shovels and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Association Soforal Group

texts.fr:
Association habite dans la région du sud sénégal.Elle a été crée le 25/12/10,elle avait comme activité de départ les cotissations de deux mille francs(2000f)par mois et par persoone pour avoir un fonds .
Association a 4 membres dont leur activité est l'élevage de volaillees,chacun de ses membre a duré dans ce domaine et le maitrisse trés bien.Avec ce crédit,elle achète à Dakar à un prix bas:des poussins,des aliments,des vaccins et des abrevoirs pour mieu démaré leur activité.
L'association dans l'avenir souhaite faire un grand poulailler dans la région du sud avec ses membres qui ont une bonne expérience dans ce métier et recruter des employés dans l'association.
texts.en:
The members of Association live in the south of Senegal. Association was created on December 25, 2010; its initial activity was to collect contributions of two thousand francs (2,000 francs) per month and per person in order to build capital.

Association has four members; their activity is poultry farming. Each member has a long experience in this field and masters it very well.

This loan allows them to purchase chicks, feed, vaccinations, and troughs at low prices in Dakar to better start up their activity. 

In the future the Association, with its experienced members, would like to build a large henhouse in the region south of Senegal and recruit employees in the Association.

loans.use: to purchase chicks

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa es socia del banco comunal Mujer y Fortaleza, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia de Turi en Cuenca, esta parroquia es conocida como el mirador de la ciudad ya que se encuentra en un lugar alto de donde se puede observar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca. Su gente es amable, gentil y carismática mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, se dedican al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura.

Doña Rosa tiene 38 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 18, 16, 14 y 12 años de edad, su primer y tercer hijo trabajan le ayudan económicamente y también estudian a distancia, su segunda y cuarto hijo estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora se dedica a  laborar en la albañilería, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

La Señora. Rosa se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y a la cría y venta de animales como  ganado, cuyes, cerdos y pollos que los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace seis años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y también va a  pagar una letra de una máquina de coser ya que va a poner un taller  de costura para trabajar con sus hijas.

Su meta es crecer poco a poco en su taller y superarse.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the communal bank "Mujer y Fortaleza" and lives near the Turi parish in Cuenca. This parish is known as the viewpoint of the city because it is high above most of the city of Cuenca. The people here are kind and charismatic, and maintain the culture and traditions of their villages. The business activity is mainly commerce, livestock farming and agriculture.
Su meta es crecer poco a poco en su taller y superarse. 

Rosa is 38, married and has four children, ages 18, 16, 14 and 12.  The eldest and third work and help out economically, while studying through distance learning.  Her second and fourth children are in school in the city.  Her husband is a bricklayer an they live in their own home.

Rosa sees to the household chores and also raises and sells livestock such as cattle, guinea pigs, pigs and chickens which she sells when some economic need arises.

She has been a member of the communal bank for six years and plans to use the loan to buy chickens and make payment on a sewing machine she will use to open the sewing business where she and her daughters will work.  Her goal is to continue expanding her shop on a daily basis and become successful.

loans.use: To buy chickens and make payment on a sewing machine.

loans.name: Lourdes Liliana

texts.es:
Lourdes es una mujer de 39 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su pequeño hijo, a quien ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella es padre y madre para su hijo; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Lourdes no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear por las acogedoras y calurosas calles de su ciudad y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Tacu Tacu para compartir con si familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Lourdes trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Lourdes se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un andamio y mercadería, como arroz, azúcar, leche, menestras, dulces, golosinas, gaseosas y otros, de esta manera Lourdes tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido y podrá atender a mas clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un minimarket.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 39 years old and lives in the city of Ica with her young son, who she loves and is her main motivation in life.  She is a kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who dedicates all of her effort to improving her family's life, since she is both mother and father to her son.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, and the need to work since she was very young, Lourdes was not able to study Business Administration at the university, but she would have liked to do so.  In her free time, she likes to take walks through the friendly and hot streets of her city and sometimes likes to cook a dish of tacu tacu (fried steak with rice and beans) to share with her family.

By her own initiative and with a lot of effort and dedication, Lourdes works at her small business selling groceries.  She works every day for about 12 hours.  She believes it is going well because of her good prices and the friendly treatment she offers to her customers. 

Lourdes is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the support they provide, she will be able to purchase shelving and merchandise such as rice, sugar, milk, soup, candy, sweets, soda, and other items.  This will allow Lourdes to keep her store better stocked and be able to serve more customers.  She wants to continue working and making an effort in order to achieve her dream of having a mini-market.

loans.use: to purchase shelving and merchandise.

loans.name: Dadalo

texts.fr: Dadalo est une femme mariée  un seul enfant à charge. Dadalo est âgée de 62 ans et vit à Adidogomé où elle exerce son activité de restauratrice de riz. Dadalo s’approvisionne du nécessaire servant à la préparation deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Dadalo sollicite ce crédit pour commander des sacs de riz, le panier de tomates fraîches et des tas des condiments en vue de bien revendre puis de gagner plus de bénéfices et de venir en aide à ses enfants aux besoins de la famille et d’améliorer les conditions de vie quotidiennes de ceux-ci.

loans.use: Acheter 02 sacs de riz, 01 panier de tomates fraîches et 04 tas de condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her farming business

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.en:
Mrs. M. I. is married and has three children, ages 8, 9 and 14. She is originally from San Luís Potosí, but now lives with her family in Monterrey. Her husband is a construction worker, and his salary can't pay for all the family's needs. For some time, Hortencia wanted to help her husband with family expenses, but didn't know how she could help. A year ago, she was offered work in diaper sales, and she has been doing that ever since. Her business has now borne fruits, and she has a job on a mobile market.

Now Hortencia wants to maker her business grow and is asking for a loan of $200 that will enable her to buy incontinence products for adults, which is in the most demand from her clients. You can help contribute to improve this family's quality of life and support Hortencia. She is sincerely grateful for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Translator

La señora Hortencia es casada y tiene tres hijos de 8, 9 y 14 años, ella es originaria de San Luís Potosí, pero ahora vive con si familia en Monterrey, Nuevo León. Su esposo es albañil y el salario que recibe no cubre todas las necesidades de su familia, hace tiempo Hortencia quería ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, pero no sabía de que manera, hace un año recibió la invitación a trabajar en la venta de pañales y la aceptó. Su negocio ahora le ha rendido frutos y tiene un puesto en un mercado rodante.

Ahora Hortencia quiere hacer crecer su negocio y solicita un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 200 dólares que empleará la compra de pañales para adulto que es lo que más demandan sus clientes. Tú puedes contribuir a mejorar la calidad de vida de esta familia, apoya a Hortencia, ella agradece sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: Buy diapers for resale.

loans.name: Alexa

texts.en:
My name is Alexa P. and I am dedicated to the production and sales of women's suits, dresses, and blouses. This is an activity that I have been involved with for the past 4 years and now I need to increase my sales in order to be able to cover the costs of my home and also to be able to pay for the education of my 2 children that are about to enter high school.

Translated by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

Mi nombre es Alexa P. me dedico a la produccion y venta de trajes de dama, vestidos, blusas, actividad que realizo hace 4 años, necesito incrementar mis ventas para poder cubrir los gastos de mi hogar y tambien poder pagar los estudios de mis dos hijos que estan por salir del colegio.

loans.use: purchase of material, thread, scissors, and oil.

loans.name: Vazer

texts.en:
Vezir H. lives in Bilasuvar, in the southern part of Azerbaijan. He is 50 years old, married, and has three children. Vezir is an internally displaced person from Jabrail - he fled to Bilasuvar during the Azerbaijan-Armenia conflict. Vezir started his business in 1998 when he borrowed money from Aqroinvest CU for the first time to open a small store.  
At his store, Vezir sells dried fruits and baked goods, as well as laundry powder, soap and shampoos. These products are in very high demand all across Azerbaijan. Particularly after Vezir repaid his first credit, the business has been going very successfully. Now, Vezir would like to enlarge the number of products he sells. He is working very hard and has decided to borrow US$1,200 USD from Aqroinvest CU to purchase dairy products and beverages for sale in the store.

loans.use: Purchase of additional products for sale

loans.name: Valida

texts.en: Valida is a mother of one child. She is a widow. Valida and her child live in Khachmaz town. She has been selling phone accessories for 2 years. This 43-year-old woman needs a loan of $600 to purchase phone accessories so that she can increase the number of her clients.

loans.use: To increase the number of phone accessories

loans.name: Sandra Aydee

texts.es:
Sandra works as a secretary and her husband is a chauffer. Both jobs are the source of income with which they support their two sons who are 2 and 7 years old. At night she studes public accounting so that she will have the opportunity to move up in the company where she works and increase her family's income. She lives in the Tacagua district of the city of La Paz.

She will use this loan to buy a medium-quality computer that she will use to do the schoolwork for her university classes.

This is her first loan with Impro. Her socio-economic evaluation of qualifies her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Sandra trabaja como secretaria; el esposo es chofer asalariado y ambas actividades son sus fuentes de ingresos con los que mantienen a sus dos hijos de 2 y 7 años de edad; por las noches estudia contaduría pública para tener la oportunidad de ascender de posición en la compañía donde trabaja e incrementar sus ingresos familiares. Vive en la zona Tacagua de La ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una computadora de mediana calidad, la misma que le ayudara para realizar sus trabajos en la universidad.

Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación socio-económica realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of a computer for studies

loans.name: Sung

texts.en:
Mrs. Sung V. L. is married with five children and lives with her husband in a part of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia.

She runs a stand in front of a primary school selling biscuits and candies to a number of little students passing by and generally makes about $1.50 to $2 per day of profit. Her husband is self-employed as a construction foreman making around $8 a day in revenue. Four of her children are enrolled in school and one is too young to attend school.

Mrs. V. L. hopes to use this loan to purchase construction tools for her husband's business. ( Her husband is pictured because Mrs. Sung V. L. is unavailable)

loans.use: To purchase construction tools to assist in her husband's business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, age 29, is married with an 8 year old. She owns a fish selling business, which she started 1 and a half years ago. She works there from 7am to 6pm daily selling fish and now makes a monthly profit of about $80 from her work.

In the past, Rose took out a successful loan which increased her sales. She now hopes to do this again. She is in a loan group called Tuwuane, whose members ensure one another is paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Valentin

texts.es:
Mr. Valentin C. lives in his own home in the Kenani Pata area, west of the city of La Paz, with his wife, Mrs Serapia Mamani and their four children. Mr. Valentin works as a mason on a private property in Villa Nuevo Potosi, alongside his wife who works as assistant bricklayer. The loan will be used for construction of a structural wall on the west side of the neighbor's property, since the absence of this wall puts the neighbor's house at risk of collapse. This is the first time that he's applying for a loan, and he's been approved because the credit analysis performed came back favorable.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Valentín C. vive en casa propia en la zona de Kenani Pata, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz con su esposa, la señora Serapia Mamani y sus cuatro hijos. El señor Valentín trabaja como albañil en una propiedad privada en la zona Villa Nuevo Potosí, junto a su esposa que cumple las funciones de ayudante de albañil. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de un muro de contención estructural en el lado oeste, que da a la propiedad de su vecino, ya que la ausencia de este muro hace que la vivienda del vecino corra peligro de derrumbe. Esta es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: For use to build a structural wall which is in contention. (Construcción de un muro de contención estructural.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy herbicide, seeds, and fertilizer, rent machinery and hire manual laborers for his rice and corn crop.

loans.name: Christian

texts.es:
Christian lives in his grandparent's house at 6 August Street in the Pasankeri area of the city of La Paz. He's studying computer science. In the house where he lives, he set up a business of online gaming and in the back room, he put in a billards room. With these activitites he is able to generate enough income to cover the cost of food for the household and for his studies. Christian is requesting a loan to buy the latest model computer so that he can also set up an internet cafe. He has a good prior history and he qualifies to obtain a new loan. In addition, he has received a loan through Kiva before.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

El señor vive en casa de sus abuelos en la calle 6 de agosto de la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz, esta estudiando informática y en la casa donde vive instalo un negocio de juegos en red y en la trastienda instalo un salón de billar. Con dichas actividades genera sus ingresos para cubrir sus necesidades de alimentación y estudio. Christian solicita crédito para comprar un equipo de computación de último modelo para la instalación de Internet en su negocio. Su antecedente histórico es bueno y califica para obtener un nuevo crédito, además que ya fue un cliente beneficiado por Kiva.

loans.use: Purchase a computer

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
Ana Patricia is 47 years old and is a single woman living in the region of Barrio La Primavera. She has 2 children aged 20 and 28 years of age but they are now financially independent from her. Ana Patricia has been running her eatery for the last 5 years, and they have been difficult because she has had to learn the best ways to run her business.

Ana's life has been very difficult because she had to take care of her children alone, but she now tries to support them and their kids with an education, to be able to proivde her grandchildren with something that she couldn't to her own children. The loan she is requesting is to purchase ingredients for hte production of her foods, because she would like to expand her production of food to earn a greater income. She will use her improved earnings to renovate her eatery so that it can sit more clients.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Ana Patricia tiene 47 años de edad, es soltera y habita en el Barrio La Primavera, tiene dos hijos de 20 y 28 años de edad, que ya son independientes a ella. Doña Ana Patricia tiene una comideria desde hace cinco años, los cuales han sido difíciles por que ha tenido que aprender la manera de encontrar la mejor manera para administrar el negocio. La vida de Doña Ana ha sido muy dura porque le tocó sacar adelante sola a sus dos hijos, pero ahora trata de apoyarles a sus hijos en la educación de sus nietos, para poder otorgarle lo que no pudo darles a sus hijos. El préstamo lo requiere para adquirir materia prima para la elaboración de sus comidas, porque ahora quiere ampliar la producción de comida para generar más ingresos que le ayuden a mejorar la infarestructura del local para atender a más clientes.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for the elaboration of her food products.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 52-year-old Hellen Kivura.  She is married, and has three children aged between 18 and 24. She has two dependents, who live with her because they are orphans.  In 2005, Hellen established her private tutoring business. Her business is open 6 days a week, 10 hours a day. Hellen requests a loan to purchase a computer much needed at the center. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase a computer for her private tutoring center.

loans.name: Deme (Soutien Mutuel). Group

texts.fr:
The nine women in the Deme (Mutual Support) group are married and, on average, are 20 years old and have three children. They live in polygamous families with their husbands, their husbands’ other wives, and their children in the village of Sikouna 2 (Koulikoro Region, Republic of Mali). Their business consists of selling charcoal, which they buy from farmers who have licenses to cut down trees and produce charcoal. They have a place to store the charcoal in their family homes and generally sell it retail to a diverse clientele (men and women) and wholesale to people who have market stands in big cities like Ségou Fana and Bamako. Brought together by the fact that they are in the same trade, live in the same village and are each experienced in business, the members of the group decided that in order to generate additional income, they would join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are receiving their first group loan. With this loan, they intend to buy an average of 25 bags of charcoal each (1,000 CFA francs per bag). Each bag will then be sold for 1,500 CFA francs, generating a weekly profit of 12,500 CFA francs. This profit will help pay off the interest on the loan and will above all help them to develop their business. Please note that Alimate Diakité is not in the group photo, as she was helping a woman in labor at the community health center in Marka Coungo at the time it was taken.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Les 9 femmes du groupe Deme (Soutien mutuel) sont mariées avec une moyenne d’age de 20 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles polygames avec leurs maris, coépouses et enfants dans le village de Sikouna 2 (Région de Koulikoro République du Mali). L’activité principale de ce groupe de femmes est la vente du charbon de bois, qu’elles achètent avec les paysans qui détiennent des permis de coupe de bois et de fabrication de charbon. Elles disposent d’un lieu de stockage dans la concession conjugale et vendent généralement le charbon de bois en détail à une clientèle variée (femmes et hommes) et en gros aux forains venant des grandes villes comme Ségou Fana et Bamako. Unies par des liens professionnels, de voisinage et très expérimentées dans les activités économiques, les membres du groupe, afin de trouver les ressources complémentaires, ont décidés d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur premier prêt de groupe. Avec ce prêt, elles comptent acheter chacune en moyenne 25 sacs de charbon (1.000 FCFA par sac). Chaque sac est revendu à 1.500 FCFA, soit un bénéfice hebdomadaire de 12.500 FCFA. Ce bénéfice servira à payer les intérêts du prêt et surtout à renforcer l’activité. Il est à noter que la nommée ALIMATA D. ne se trouve pas sur la photo de groupe. En effet, elle était en train d’assister une femme en travail au centre de santé communautaire de Marka Coungo.

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal and various items

loans.name: Licenia

texts.es:
Licencia and her husband Pedro are parents of 7 children who are now independent and have their own families, they had fixed their house so they can all live together, but keeping each family’s privacy.
Licencia works selling regional vegetables, fruits and other products, she, with her big smile and kindness provides good attention to her clients, who are satisfied with Licencia’s products. She has a space on her house where she keeps her business, where she works all day, she has 16 years working on this activity and until now it has brought her good income. She likes her job because she gets to know lots of people; they like her very much and talk about several subjects.
Licencia is asking for a loan to extent her business and later on build a portable kiosk.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Licenia y su esposo Pedro son padres de 7 hijos que ya son independientes y de familia, han acondicionado su casa para que puedan vivir todos juntos, pero respetando la privacidad de cada familia. Licenia se dedica a la venta de verduras regionales, frutas y otros productos, ella, con su gran sonrisa y amabilidad da una buena atención a sus clientes, quienes se van satisfechos con los productos de Licenia. Tiene un espacio en su vivienda donde está su negocio, al que dedica todo el día, lleva ya 16 años en esta labor y hasta ahora le ha traído buenos ingresos económicos. Le gusta su trabajo porque conoce mucha gente, la cual le tiene mucho cariño y conversan de muchos temas. Licenia pide este préstamo porque quiere ampliar su negocio y posteriormente mandar a construir un kiosco.

loans.use: To increase her investment capital to extent her business / Incremento de su capital de inversión para la ampliación de su negocio.

loans.name: Sandra Araceli

texts.es:
Sandra inició el negocio por tener un ingreso y poder mantenerse ya que es soltera y vive con sus padres. Inicio hace tres años vendiendo lencería en su circulo mas cercano: familia y amigos y ahora esta mas establecida ya que tiene un local y ha logrado mejores ganancias.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para la compra de lencería.
texts.en:
Sandra started the business to have an income and to be able to take care of herself because she is single and lives with her parents. She started three years ago selling lingerie in her closest circle of family and friends and now is more established because she has a shop and has achieved better earnings. She needs a loan for US$250 which she will repay in six months to buy lingerie.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Zebonisso

texts.ru: Акобирова Зебониссо жительница района Файзабад. 1968 года рождения. Замужем и имеет пятерых детей. Занимается сельским хозяйством и животноводством. Перед зимой ей для хозяйства необходимо запастись комбикормом. Поэтому она планирует получить кредит и закупить сено и жмых. Это поможет ей безпрепятственно откармливать своих животных. Развитие животноводства  поможет сохранить цены на молочные и мясные продукты. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Zebonisso A. lives in the Fayzabad region. She was born in 1968. She is married with 5 children. She works in agriculture and animal husbandry and needs to buy forage before the winter comes. Zabonisso plans to obtain a loan for purchasing hay. This would help her feed the cattle. The development of this animal husbandry business would contribute to keeping local meat and dairy prices low. Zebonisso plans to repay the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase forage

loans.name: El Sol Sale Para Todos Group

texts.en:
This group of nine individuals is from a larger group of 22, called "El Sol Sale Para Todos". They are all looking to receive a loan to either start a small business or increase the small business they started with an earlier loan.

Magaly is the group representative and chosen leader. She is a very hardworking woman, and she has a lot to work hard for. She is a single mother of four young children who all depend on her to provide for them. Before her first loan, she had no form of income and she and her children were barely getting by. She now has a small business selling food and hopes to increase the size of her business and generate more income. She dreams of living in her own house and being able to send her kids to college. She is ready to work for those dreams and believes this is the first step!

On behalf of Magaly, the group, and Esperanza International, thank you for your support!!!

loans.use: Products for food production

loans.name: Yesica Yanet

texts.es:
Yesica forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Pariahuanquinas II” del distrito de Pariahuanca, provincia de Carhuaz, departamento de Ancash.

Tiene 23 años de edad y 01 hijo junto a su conviviente que es obrero. Comenta que se encuentra tranquila y que su logro ha sido ser independiente, vivir solamente con su familia. Vende golosinas, tanto en su casa que se encuentra ubicada frente a la plaza de Pariahuanca, como en el centro educativo de Pariahuanca. Sus productos los compra en la ciudad de Huaraz. También nos dice que su negocio ha crecido porque hace un tiempo vendía solamente helados. Actualmente ha diversificado su negocio con golosinas. Afirma que se encuentra tranquila y espera seguir creciendo en su negocio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 300, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en la compra de golosinas.
 
A Yesica le gustaría capacitarse para seguir adelante en su negocio y en su vida personal y familiar.
texts.en:
Yesica belongs to the “Mujeres Pariahuanquinas II” cooperative bank, located in the Pariahuanca district, Carhuaz province, in the Ancash department. She is 23 years old, and has one child with her partner who is a laborer. She comments that she feels content with her achievement of financial independence and of living only with her immediate family. She sells sweets both from her home, located in front of the Pariahuanca plaza, as well as in the educational center of that area. She buys her products in the city of Huaraz. She also tells us that her business has grown because, at one time, she only sold ice creams. Currently, she has diversified her enterprise to include other sweets/candy. She notes that she lives peacefully, and hopes to continue expanding her business. With this loan of 300.00 soles, to be repaid in four installments, she will invest in the purchase of candies. Yesica would like to learn further how to help her business get ahead, and how to manage her personal and family lives capably.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of candy/sweets.

loans.name: Rocio Marleni

texts.es:
La señora Rocío es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Villa del Lago II” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 20 años de edad y es soltera sin hijos. 
Con el primer préstamo de S/ 500 compró ajo para vender en su triciclo de manera ambulatoria en la calle. Tiene casi un año trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que actualmente está estudiando computación e informática.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará mayor cantidad de ajo para seguir vendiendo en su triciclo.
Rocío desea continuar trabajando para seguir estudiando y llegar a ser profesional, además poner una tienda.
texts.en:
Miss Rocío is a member of the “Mujeres de Villa del Lago II” microfinance institute in the district, province and department of Puno. She is 20 years old, single and has no children.

With her first 500.00 PEN loan, she purchased garlic in order to sell it on her urban delivery tricycle as a street vendor. She has been working with the microfinance institute for almost a year, and she states that she is currently studying information technology.

With this 1,200.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 4 monthly installments, she will purchase a greater quantity of garlic in order to continue selling it on her work vehicle.

Rocío wishes to continue working so that she can keep studying and one day become a professional. Furthermore, she hopes to set up her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase garlic

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia tiene 47 años de edad, es madre de tres hijos que cursan estudios técnicos, vive junto a su esposo.
