texts.es: La soica actualmente tiene 45 años de edad; la socia sigue con su negocio propio de venta de comidas en el mercado, la socia ha mejorado su calidad de vida y la de su familia con las inversiones que realiza, ella ahora también cría animeles menores como cuyes, chanchos y aves de corral en muchas ocasiones ella prepara alimentos con la carne que ella misma cría; la socia ha estado sacando los prestamos para invertir en su puesto de venta de comida, e la compra de meza, sillas, utensilios y otros y en esta ocasión desea mejorar y renovar algunos utensilios como cubiertos, vasos y platos para servir las comidas, la socia desea comprar viandas para llevr los alimentos a los negocios de sus clientes, la socia también desea invertir el credito en la compra de insumos para la preparación de los potajes como arroz al por mayor en sacos, aceite en bidones y otros. La socia soliciat el prestamo para invertir en la compra de utensilios para el negocio y de insumos para la elaboración de los potajes.
texts.en:
Gabriela is 45 years old. She is continuing with her business of selling meals in the market. She has improved her quality of life and that of her family with the investments she is making. 

Now she also raises small animals such as guinea pigs, pigs and poultry. On many occasions she prepares food with the meat that she herself raises. She has been taking out loans to invest in her food stall; to buy tables, chairs, utensils and other things,

On this occasion she wishes to improve and replace some utensils, such as cutlery, glasses, and plates for serving the meals. She wishes to buy  containers for taking food to her customers businesses. She also wants to use the loan to buy ingredients for preparing dishes, such as rice sold wholesale in bags, cooking oil in barrels, and other things. She is applying for the loan to buy utensils for the business, and ingredients for making food dishes.

loans.use: To buy utensils for her food stall business, and ingredients for making the dishes.

loans.name: Anta   Mbaye  Thiam Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Anta est consolidé le 5 octobre 2011 date d'inauguration du banc villageois; il est composé de douze femmes issues de la même concession et liées par une forte solidarité. Le commerce constitue leur activité principale.

La responsable Fatou est âgée de 40 ans , elle est mariée mère de sept enfants; elle mène une activité de vente de niébé et autres produits alimentaires, elle a une bonne expérience de 2 ans;elle fais aussi de la couture. Elle est debout tout à fait à droite sur la photo habillée en tissu multicolore et a mis les mains sur les hanches.

Elle achéte ses produits dans les marchés hebdomadaires et revend dans son village.

Elle souhaite acheter une bonne quantité de produits pour ainsi se faire plus de revenus.

Elle compte augmenter son épargne afin de pouvoir aider son mari dans les dépenses de la famille, subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants et acheter un terrain pour eux.
texts.en:
The Anta community bank was formed on October 5th, 2011, the date their village bank was created.  The group has 12 female members who are from the same area and linked by a strong sense of solidarity.  Their main business activity is commerce.

Fatou is the group's leader.  She is 40 years old, married, and has seven children.  She has a business selling cowpeas and other foodstuffs.  She has a good two years experience and also sews for a living.  She is standing on the far right of the photo, dressed in a multi-colored dress, and has her hands on her hips.

Fatou buys her products in large quantities in order to make more income.

Fatou plans to increase her savings in order to help her husband with their family expenses.  She would also like to meet her children's needs and buy a plot of land for them.

loans.use: to buy food products for resale

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida is 40 years of age, married and has a son who has just started attending school. She is a housewife and spends her time staying at home and doing her household responsibilities.

Her husband operates a sweetmeat selling business. The taste of his products is very good which helps him in attracting a good number of clients. Zahida also supports her husband by preparing sweetmeat for him. She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will purchase ingredients used in making sweetmeat of better taste and in larger quantity.

Zahida is hopeful that her husband’s income will be improved after the investment. He has operated his business for the past many years and Zahida has full confidence in him.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making better quality sweet-meat.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe is 45 years old and lives in Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is married, has three children and earns a living by running a store where she sells toiletries. She has been in this line of work for five years and is applying for a loan for PHP 14,900 to buy more products to sell to her customers. She has been a member of PMPC for four years and hopes to earn enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more toiletries to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Adelphine

texts.en:
Adelphine is 23 years old, married, and has two children. She works with her husband selling shoes in a store they have run for seven years. 

Adelphine is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more shoes for the store. The profits will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for sell.

loans.name: Martha Noemi

texts.es:
La Señora Martha es socia del banco comunal Pauteñitas, vive por el cantón Paute (Cuenca) lugar que es privilegiado por su clima templado, la población de Paute es una de las más laboriosas y emprendedoras Cuentan con gastronomía típica y disposición de los más atractivos platos típicos, la producción de flores, hace de este cantón un verdadero jardín, se cultiva para exportación, rosas de la más alta calidad.

La Señora Martha tiene 25 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos  de 4 y 2 años de edad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo un camión, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.
 
Doña Martha se dedica a cuidar de sus hijos, en sus tiempos libres vende productos naturales de Herbalife, esta actividad la realiza hace 5 años y trabaja de domingo a domingo, también entrega frutas en los mercados gracias a que su esposo trae en el camión.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de productos naturales de Herbalife.

Su meta es subir un puesto más alto en Herbalife.
texts.en:
Señora Martha is a member of the Pauteñitas communal bank. She lives in the Paute canton (Cuenca), an area with a wonderfully mild climate. The residents of Paute are very hard-working and enterprising. The region has a traditional and delicious cuisine. Flowers, including the highest quality roses, are cultivated in this canton for export; the whole canton is like a garden.
Martha is 25, married, and has two children ages 2 and 4. Her husband is a driver, and drives a truck. They own their own home.

Martha takes care of their children and sells Herbalife products in her free time. She has been doing this for five years, and works every day of the week. She also supplies fruit to the markets, thanks to her husband and his truck.

This is her second loan in the communal bank and she will invest it in Herbalife natural products.

Her goal is to have a higher position in Herbalife.

loans.use: To buy Herbalife natural products.

loans.name: Mateo

texts.es:
El sr. Mateo de 46 años es casado y tiene 2 hijos que aun dependen económicamente de él y de su esposa, el tiene 7 años viviendo en una casa de interés social, trabaja como operador en una maquiladora de la localidad 10 horas diarias de lunes  a viernes su esposa contribuye a los gastos del hogar y al igual que el trabaja en una maquiladora.
Mateo es un esposo y padre  que se preocupa por el bienestar de su familia,  tiene una la cual es madre soltera y que está viviendo en casa de el;  las viviendas de interés social son muy pequeñas  y apenas si tienen un espacio para cuatro personas es por ello que Mateo se preocupa por que su hija y nietos estén en un lugar cómodo y le está construyendo una recamara para ella y para sus niños y solicita el apoyo para terminar la construcción de un cuarto que el inicio hace 5 años y por cuestiones económicas no ha podido realizar.
texts.en:
46-year-old Mateo is married and has two children who are still financially dependent on himself and his wife.  He has been living in government-subsidized housing for seven years.  Mateo works as a laborer in a cross-border assembly plant in his town.  He works 10 hours a day, from Monday to Friday.  His wife contributes toward their household expenses and also works in an assembly plant.

Mateo is a husband and father who cares about his family's well-being.  One of his children is a single mother and is living at home with him.  Government-subsidized houses are very small and barely have enough space for four people.  Mateo would like his daughter and grandchildren to live comfortably and so he is building a room for her and her children.  He is requesting support so that he can finish building the room which he started five years ago but, for financial reasons, has been unable to finish.

loans.use: to buy building supplies

loans.name: Gilma Jeannett

texts.es: Gilma, quiere realizar una nueva inversión por eso está solicitando préstamos para la compra  de quintales de maíz y leña, con esto mejorara la condición de su negocio para tener una mejor producción y venta con los clientes. Gilma considera que su negocio ha mejorado, que ha incrementado sus ventas y le ha dado una mejor condición para el sustento diario junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Gilma wants to make a new investment, so she is requesting a loan to buy bushels of corn and firewood. This will improve the condition of her business so that she will have better production and sales to her customers.

Gilma believes her business has improved since her sales are higher and she is in a better condition to provide for her family’s daily needs.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.es:
En el municipio de Larreynaga Malpaisillo en un poblado del  departamento de león, la señora Azucena se dedica arduamente  a laborar como Auxiliar de enfermería, actualmente esta desempeñándose con el cargo antes mencionado, dedicándose a esta labor desde hace 37 años, es soltera con 1 nieto a su cargo al que tiene que proporcionarles  las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrolle, responsabilidad que asumió de una hija de ella.
Una de las necesidades que la señora azucena  atraviesa hoy en día es de Mejorar su vivienda, la que se encuentra en mal estado, ya que debido a esta necesidad, le `permitió tomar la decisión sabia de visitar a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de Materiales de construcción como: Hierro, piedrín, Ladrillos, Cemento, Ladrillo de Piso, Zinc y Mano de Obra para la construcción de un porche.
texts.en:
In a village in Larreynaga Malpaisillo municipality, in León department, Azucena works hard as a nursing assistant.  She has been working in this job for 37 years.  She is single and has one grandchild in her care.  She is responsible for providing her grandchild with the necessary conditions in which to grow up.  She assumed this responsibility from one of her daughters.

One of the needs that Azucena is currently experiencing is that of improving her home which is in a bad state of repair.  Owing to this need, she took the decision to visit Ceprodel to request a loan with which to buy building supplies such as iron, gravel, bricks, cement, paving bricks and sheets of metal, and to pay laborers, to build a porch.

loans.use: to buy iron, gravel, bricks, cement, paving bricks and sheets of metal, and to pay laborers

loans.name: Djantoyerela 2 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe DJANTOYERELA 2  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  41 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KALAKAN, commune de KOLONDIEBA, une des préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est: le riz, l’arachide et le mais avec YAMOU la 1ère personne à droite sur la photo position debout. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter: 3 hectares. La production est vendue à KOLONDIEBA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 180 000F cfa qui la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Achat d’intrants, de semences et frais de labours pour la campagne agricole.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a person who has had to overcome a lot of adversity in her life. However, she has always had the strength to overcome it and move forward with her four children. 

Kiva lenders, meet Betty, one of the most hardworking women on planet Earth. She is 36 years of age, very hardworking and a go-getter. She hails from Momul, a remote village in the Kericho area of Kenya. 

Her primary sources of income are crops and animal farming. She also gets some income through a personal business. Betty is content with the farming way of life. 

Betty is a very enterprising woman, and although she never had formal education or formal employment, she has always worked hard on her farm and she has always assured her children and family of a decent meal. 

The Kericho area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming, and that is why she is seeking a loan to buy seeds and start horticulture farming. Because of good roads, a good climate, and a good transportation network, she is sure that she will reap maximum profits and be able to increase her business. Being a woman and accessing funds in Africa is very challenging, but Betty feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising women like her. 

Betty is well disciplined with finances, and she plans that through the accumulated profits, she will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children who are in school. Please help Betty so that her horticulture farming can flourish!

loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticulture farming and provide a better income for her four children.

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en:
Lydia resides in Sitet, a remote village in the lush hills of Nandihills, in the Rift Valley of Kenya. As the key breadwinner of her family she has been practicing mixed farming for the past 11 years. Because of the immense knowledge she has of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, and crops. Although she has been making profits from farming, she has identified a “niche market” for selling cereals; the only big challenge she faces is lack of funds. 

She is requesting a loan to buy cereals. She intends to buy different varieties of cereals; that is, maize, sorghum, rice, wheat, barley, and millet, to sell in the local market. Market for the cereals is never a problem because the demand is always high, and she plans to take advantage of that. 

Because of the good relationship she has with her neighbors, she plans to increase her market by using word of mouth to reach more customers and markets. She plans that, through accumulated profits, she will be able to buy a milling machine for grinding maize. Through this loan, Lydia’s life will take another turn, and she will be able to secure the future of her family. Help this smallholder farmer to accomplish great things with just a loan.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Norma Aracely

texts.en:
Norma is mother of a young man of 19 years of age and lives in the community of Huhi in a southern State, Yucatan. Two years ago she suffered the loss of her husband and following the loss of an income she started selling shoes with the help of her son. She started selling among family members and friends, but the demand grew and she decided to work full time in her business. Tenacity is a characteristic that Norma undoubtedly possesses. Despite the loss of her husband that she suffered she kept moving forward for the love of her son.

Now she requires a loan in the amount of $925, of which she will use for the purchase of shoes in greater quantity, to get a better price for them and greater earnings. Help Norma and her family. They need you, don't wait any longer. You only need to make your decision now. They thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Norma es madre de un joven de 19 años de edad y vive en la comunidad de Huhí, en un estado del sur del país, Yucatán. Hace 2 años ella sufrió la perdida de su esposo y ante la falta de ingresos comenzó a vender zapatos con la ayuda de su hijo. Empezó vendiendo entre familiares y amigos, pero ante la creciente demanda, decidió dedicarse por completo a ésta actividad. La tenacidad es una característica que indudablemente Norma posee, pues a pesar de la pérdida que sufrió siguió adelante por el amor a su hijo.

Ahora ella necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de $ 925 DLLS, mismos que utilizará para la compra de zapatos en una mayor cantidad para poder un obtener un menor precio y por ende mayores ganancias. Ayuda a Norma y a su familia, ellos te necesitan no lo dudes más, sólo hace falta que te decidas, ellos te lo agradecen.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia is 26 years old and a mother of 3 children. She completed basic education decided thereafter to trade. She currently prepares a local food made with maize. Fried, it is a staple for the majority of the inhabitants in the community.She intends to use a KIVA loan to procure her maize supplies directly from the market and eliminate the high price demanded by her creditors.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.en:
My name is María P., and I sell a variety of products like women's purses, batteries, nail polishes, deodorants, hangers, eyeglasses and some other things. I've been in this business for four years now and I have a lot of customers, because my shop's location is in the busiest commercial street in my city. My goal is to increase my stock so that I can sell more products and remodel my home.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Maite Barragán

Mi nombre es Maria P. me dedico a la venta de productos varios como ser carteras para dama, anteojos, focos, baterias, esmaltes, desodorantes, ganchos y otras cositas, tengo mi negocio hace unos 4 años, tengo muchos clientes ya que mi puesto de venta es ubicado en la calle del comercio de mi ciudad en la cual transita mucha gente, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener mayores ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi casa de habitacion.

loans.use: purchasing purses, necklaces, batteries, eyeglasses, nail polishes, hangers, creams, etc...

loans.name: Kenan

texts.en:
Kenan A. lives in Beylagan, a small town in southwest Azerbaijan. He is 23 years old and he is single. Kenan has a food market near his home. He is selling bread, tea, sugar, sweets, drinks, cigarettes, etc. at his market. His father helps him at his job.

Last mounth Kenan increased the area of his market. Now he wants to to buy more kinds of goods and increase his daily selling. Because of this, he applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for a loan. Kenan needs $500 to buy more kinds of goods and to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es:
Pamela has a small general store where she sells soft drinks, rice, noodles, sugar, crackers, etc. Her home is located in the zone called Alto San Pedro in the city of La Paz. This is the second time she has requested a loan. Her previous loan qualified her as a good client as she complied with the terms of the loan. She will use the money to buy merchandise, and maintain her store with enough products to meet the demands of her customers. Her business qualifies her to receive this credit. She has experience in her business, and the income she generates is enough to cover this loan.

Pamela tiene una tienda de abarrotes donde vende refrescos, arroz, fideo, azúcar, galletas, etc. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito. Su antecedente crediticio la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de mercadería ( arroz, fideo, azúcar, galletas y otros) y mantener su tienda con mercaderia suficiente para abastecer la demanda de sus clientes. Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio, el cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy merchandise for her small general store. (soft drinks, rice, noodles, sugar, crackers, etc. )

loans.name: Hipólita

texts.en:
Hipólita is a “feriante.” This means that once each week she makes the long trip outside her home city of Ayacucho, Perú to the rural countryside where she buys large supplies of cheeses and meats. Her method of transportation depends upon what she can find, though usually she is able to take the bus. These supplies she brings home to the city to sell in the markets and also door-to-door. Hipólita has been involved in this type of business for the past 15 years, when her friend invited her to join in the business.

As Hipólita is a single mother of three teenaged children, she also sells candy to supplement her income. During the frequent and very large city and national festivals, she brings huge supplies of candy to sell to those who are celebrating, often staying all night until very early the next morning. This she has also been involved in for the last 15 years, alongside her cousin.

Hipólita has been a part of her village bank as long as she has been a businesswoman. She says she loves taking part in the economic help provided and taking advantage of the opportunities it allows. Currently, it is helping her work toward a lifelong goal of hers: to buy her own house for herself and her children. They are presently living in a rented portion of her sister’s home. Without her village bank, she explains, doing business would be very hard, if not impossible, and goals like buying her own home with her own money would be unthinkable. Hipólita is requesting a loan of $300, with which she will pay for her weekly transportation into the countryside, as well as the purchase of larger quantities of meats and cheeses.

loans.use: Purchase larger quantities of meats and cheeses, and pay for weekly transportation into the countryside.

loans.name: Kan

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Kan, 69, and her husband, Mr. Mao Loeng, 74, have been married since 1957. They have two children, one son and one daughter. Her daughter has been married and living with her and weaving silk at home. Her son is studying. Kan and her family are living on an island of the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. Kan has been a silk weaver since 1953. It's a skill she learned from her mother. Her husband learned to weave silk from her and started weaving silk in the same year, but now he is retired.

Kan is requesting her sixth loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $300. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and to pay for the preparation of her new loom.

loans.use: Buy silk materials and prepare loom

loans.name: Saro

texts.en: Saro D. lives in Nau, Tajikistan. She is married and has 4 children. Saro D.  became a client of  MicroInvest in 2006 when she was in a difficult situation and applied for her first loan. She started the business practically from scratch. Now she is engaged in selling grits (buckwheat, rice, pea, green gram, etc) and has her own outlet in the food bazaar. Additionally she is a school teacher. She is experienced in business for 10 years. Mrs.D. now requests a loan of 3200 STJ for the purchase of new goods.

loans.use: For the purchase of new goods.

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Mrs Anastasia has a taco business. This business is their family’s source of income where both her and her husband work. We sell tacos in different places in the city of Nuevo Laredo. We would like to purchase a stand outside of our home and therefore be able to also take care of the children. I request a loan of US$1,200 to purchase a taco stand.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Anastasia tiene un negocio de tacos. Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de mi familia en trabajamos mi esposo y yo. Nosotros vendemos tacos en diferentes partes de la Ciudad de Nuevo Laredo. Queremos comprar un puesto para establecerlo fuera de la casa y así también cuidar a los niños. Solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls para la compra de un puesto de tacos.

loans.use: Purchase a Stand to sell Tacos

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 45 year-old Stella C., single with four children ranging in age from 13 to 29.

Stella owns a soft drinks business, a popular venture for micro-entrepreneurs in Tanzania owing to the hot weather, and requests a loan of $275 in order to purchase additional stocks of drinks in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of soft drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Enercida

texts.en:
Enercida is a humble but hard-working and active entrepreneur who strives to support her three children.  Enercida lives in the Casabe community of Santo Domingo where she sells shoes and underwear.  The entrepreneur explains that she doesn’t have the capacity to buy or rent a local stall, but she’ll keep working hard in order to achieve that goal, and in the meanwhile strengthen her business.
Enercida is requesting a loan (the second one she’ll take from FSMA) to buy more shoes and underwear and add new styles in order to attract new people to her business.

loans.use: Purchase of women's clothing for a small business.

loans.name: German Enrique

texts.es:
German Enrique D. is originally from the city of Bluefields. He's married to Lucia Luz Amaya Sarmiento. They have 4 young children. He opened up a little bakery about 3 years ago where he bakes (using outdoor ovens) pastries filled with pineaple and cheese which are native to the area. This business is the only form of income for this family. His clients are the local coffee shops in the area. He currently buys his main ingredients little by little since he doesn't have the income to buy everything in bulk. This is the main reason why he's requesting a loan to purchase flour, sugar, lard, salt, yeast, charcoal in big quantaties. With these purchases, he hopes to increase his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Germán Enrique D. es originario de la ciudad de Bluefields, esta casado con la Sra. Lucia Luz Amaya Sarmiento ambos tiene 4 hijos menores de edad, hace 3 años el Sr. D. tiene una pequeña panadería donde su especialidad es hornar de forma artesanal pan dulce relleno de piña y queso, este negocio es el único ingreso de la familia, sus clientes son los cafetines que lo prefieren por ofrecer su producto a domicilio, en estos momentos el Sr. D. compra en pocas cantidades los ingredientes principales de su producto ya que no cuenta con suficiente capital para poder comprar en grandes cantidades, generando poca ganancia para el negocio por esta razón el Sr. D. necesita comprar 4 quintales de harina a $ 46.00 dólares el quintal, 2 quintales de azúcar a $ 30.00 dólares el quintal, 1 caja de manteca a $ 36.00 dólares la caja, 1 caja de levadura a $ 43.00 dólares la caja, 1 paca de sal a $ 3.00 dólares la paca y 16 sacos de carbón a $ 3.00 dólares el saco con esta inversión podrá aumentar sus ganancias.

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar, lard, yeast, salt and charcoal

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tran Thi T., 42 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 1997. After 11 years old membership, her family economy has improved a great deal. At first, she borrowed 80 USD to invest in raising pigs. Then, she decided to buy rice-husking machine because she realized that combining both activities would be more effective. She could use the remaining, unwanted rice to feed the pigsAlso, the rice-husking machine would be a great assistance to the local people. Currently, she has 5 pigs. Her two children are still going to school. This time, she wants to borrow 1100 USD to fix the machines and to invest in breeding animals. Her average income is 225 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Ở tuổi 42 nhưng nhìn chị Trần Thị Thắm còn rất trẻ, T. gia Quỹ năm 1997. Qua 11 năm vay vốn của Quỹ để phát triển kinh tế gia đình chị đã thay đổi rất nhiều. Vòng vốn đầu gia đình chị vay 1.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, từ việc chăn nuôi lợn ý định mua máy say sát của gia đình anh chị được nảy sinh. Thấy rằng nếu gia đình chăn nuôi nhiều và kết hợp với nghề làm máy sát thì sẽ tận dụng được nhiều thứ không lẵng phí. Với suy nghĩ đó gia đình chị đã vay vốn mua máy say sát một trong những loại máy mà không thể thiếu với người nông dân, vừa phục vụ bà con trong địa phương có thêm thu nhập lại tận dung được cám, gạo vãi để chăn nuôi, lúc gia đình chị có máy sát cũng là thời điểm mô hình chăn nuôi của gia đình chị được mở rộng, hiện tại nhà chị có trên 5 con lợn thịt. 2 con đang ở độ tuổi đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 18.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và sửa máy sát. Thu nhập bình quân. 4.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: fix the rice-husking machines and breed animals

loans.name: Afi

texts.en:
Afi F. is a fishmonger. She is a single parent whose income is not sufficient for herself and her 5 children. Demand for her processed fish is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

Afi is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth C. is a 33 year old young woman who lives in the Hialeah neighborhood of Managua. She and her husband, who works cleaning rooms, have an 8 year old daughter. Each of them work hard every day to give her a better life. Elizabeth has worked taking in outside laundry and ironing for the last 4 years. She began working when she saw the need to help her husband with the household expenses, and alsobecause she wanted to finish building their home. This loan will be used to purchase construction materials which they will be used to build a room for their daughter, to give her greater comfort and privacy. Elizabeth hopes to find better work which will help her progress in life.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Elizabeth C. es una joven de 33 años, habita en el barrio Hialeah de Managua, es casada, su esposo es recamarero, tienen una niña de 8 años de edad, por la que trabajan diariamente para darle una vida mejor. Elizabeth trabaja lavando y planchando ajeno, hace 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Se vio en la necesidad de buscar trabajo para apoyar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, y porque también querían terminar de construir su hogar. El préstamo será usado para la compra de materiales de construcción para hacer un cuarto para su pequeña hija y así darle comodidad y mayor privacidad. Elizabeth espera poder encontrar un mejor trabajo que le permita desarrollarse en la vida

loans.use: Construction of a room for her daughter

loans.name: Aminata Collé

texts.fr: Aminata Collé Cissé, 40 ans, mariée est membre du banc villageois de Boucotte Face Néma depuis 4 ans et demi. Elle veut poursuivre son activité qui consiste à acheter de l’huile de palme, du jus de citron et du miel à Sindone et revendre au marché Grand Dakar. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille <b>Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.<b/>
texts.en:
Aminata Collé Cissé is 40 years old and is married. She has been a member of the Boucotte Face Néma village bank for the past four and a half years. Her business, which she is keen to keep going, consists of buying palm oil, lemon juice and honey in Sindone and selling it at the Grand Dakar market The income from her business allows her to improve her family’s living conditions.

She is requesting a loan that will be repaid after six months in one installment.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell food products.

loans.name: Zebiniso

texts.en:
S. Zebiniso is 22 years old. She is living with her parents and two little brothers. She is a well-known seamstress in her community. Five years ago, Zebiniso decided to take advantage of her reputation, and bought a tailoring machine. Since then, she has provided tailoring services. Zebiniso is well-established and has many customers, the majority of whom are young girls who often order national dresses. She constantly has new clients and has seen her business grow.

Zebiniso is requesting a loan of 2500 Somoni ($750) to purchase the new modern fabrics for sewing the national dresses.You can help improve the quality of life of her family. Zebiniso and her family are grateful for your generosity and support.

loans.use: Purchase new modern fabrics for sewing national dresses

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is a small entrepreneur from Simferopol. She runs a business selling women’s shoes and boots in the central city marketplace. Galina has a serious business approach, focusing on client demand and modern fashion trends. She has been in this trade for 5 years. Presently, she has about 10,000 Grivnas in inventory. Her net profit is about 2,000 Grivnas.   

Galina is very enthusiastic about her venture. She has encouraged some other people take decisive steps and start their own businesses. You can definitely call Galina a workaholic! She invests all her energy in her business and seeks to see its growth. One of her dreams is to do a complete remodeling of her house, working out the interior design herself. Galina is requesting a loan of 5000 Grivnas to purchase additional merchandise and boost her sales this winter season.

loans.use: To purchase additional 50 pairs of boots

loans.name: Bukola

texts.en: Bukola sells gifts and prayer items. Bukola is a LAPO client. She is 35 years old and married with a child. Bukola lives in Shibiri, Lagos state, Nigeria. She is requesting the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more prayer items and gifts to sell. She hopes to expand her business. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more gifts and prayer items to sell

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: Astou F., veuve est membre du banc villageois de Kandé Alassane depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter de l’huile de palme, de la pâte d’arachide, des bidons et des seaux pour renforcer son petit commerce. Les produits sont achetés à Yarang et revendu à Ziguinchor. Elle vend aussi  des cacahuètes à tout moment. Elle participe aux dépenses familiales et contribue au bien être de sa famille. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Astou F. is a widow. She has been a member of the village loan group of Kandé Alassane for seven and a half years and wants to buy some palm oil, peanut butter, containers, and buckets to bolster her modest business. Goods are purchased in Yarang and are resold in Ziguinchor. Astou also sells peanuts anytime. She is helping to cover family expenses and contributes to the well-being of her family. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in palm oil and peanut butter

loans.name: Bogdan

texts.en:
Bogdan offers transportation services in Ivano-Frankivsk where he is originally from. He started his business about 8 years ago, after he quit working as a public van driver. This enterprise has been an effective source of income for his family of four – his wife Lidiya and two daughters, 12 and 9 year old. Currently, his monthly income is about 8,000 Grivnas. 

Bogdan works 16 hours a day to provide a decent living for his family. Right now he’s faced with a need to do some repair work on his vehicle. He is requesting a 7,500 Grivna loan to paint his car and give it a fresher, nicer look. Bogdan has many challenges in his work. However, he doesn’t want to go back to being a hired employee, preferring to work for himself.

loans.use: to paint his car used for work

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora Magdalena es socia del Banco Comunal “03 de Mayo”, en el Jr. Amazonas, distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 39 años de edad, de estado civil casada,  tiene 05 hijos y posee estudios de primaria incompleta (quinto grado). 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 04 años; se dedica al engorde de ganado menor y a la artesanía de bayeta; su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir ganado menor para engórdalo y venderlo como carne en las fiestas de la candelaria. 
Con este préstamo de S/ 2000.00 nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 5 cuotas mensuales; podrá adquirir ganado (toros para engorde) y materiales para hacer sus tejidos en bayeta (tela bayeta, hilo, etc.), ello a fin de continuar generado ganancias lo que le permitirá ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios; asimismo ella desea construir sus casa  puesto que ya cuenta con un terreno que pudo adquirir con sus ganancias anteriormente.
texts.en:
Magdalena is a member of the "03 de Mayo" Communal Bank in Jr. Amazonas, Llave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 39 years old, married, has five children and a fifth-grade education. She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for four years, fattening small livestock and making cloth handicrafts. With her first loan of 300 soles, she was able to buy small livestock for fattening and sell the meat at Candlemas festivities. With this loan of 2000 soles, which she promises to repay in five monthly payments, she will be able to purchase livestock (bulls for fattening) and materials for weaving (fabric, thread, etc.). The money she generates will allow her to support her children in their studies. She also wishes to build a house, as she was able to buy land with her previous earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock (bulls for fattening) and materials for weaving (fabric, thread, etc.)

loans.name: Dekpate

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier de hanoukokpe qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé, elle a pour activité principale la vente des serrures et des clés pour les maisons, elle fait ce commerce depuis 1994 et s’approvisionne dans les pays voisins du Ghana et du Benin, actuellement son stock est épuisé, c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite de wages un prêt pour augmenter ses activités avec 3 cartons de serrures, 02 cartons de tachettes et 7cartons de crochets. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants.
texts.en:
Dekpate D. lives the neighborhood of Hanoukpe, on the outskirts of the city of Lome. Her main business is selling keys and locks for houses and she has been doing this since 1994. Dekpate buys hers supplies in the neighboring countrys of Ghana and Benin. At present her inventory is depleted and this why she is requesting a loan from WAGES to increase her business by buying 3 cartons of locks, 2 cartons of latches and 7 cartons of catches. Dekpate is married and the mother of three children.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy locks and latches for resale

loans.name: Sonia Aurea,

texts.es:
A sus treinta y un años, durante toda su vida ha trabajado en diversos negocios. Al inicio no propios pero mas adelante se dio cuenta que teniendo una microempresa generaba mas ingresos. Por lo que luego de ahorrar y planificar bien su proyecto, decidió abrir una panadería junto con su esposo. La idea nació no solo por las ganas de mejorar, sino también de sacar provecho al máximo a los conocimientos de su esposo sobre panificación adquiridos en sus diversos lugares de trabajo.

Con un hijo de doce años, Sonia pone todo de si para poder seguir creciendo en su negocio. Por ahora solo piensa en ir implementando más su local, con mercadería y mejor apariencia.
texts.en:
Sonia is thirty one and during her lifetime has had various jobs. At first she worked for other people but later she realised that having her own micro-business would generate more income. After saving and planning her business project, she decided to open a bakery together with her husband. The idea came when she decided she wanted to increase her income but also when she realised she could take advantage of her husband's baking knowledge acquired from working various jobs. With a twelve year old daughter, Sonia is giving it all she's got so that her business will continue to grow. At the moment, she is only thinking about improving her shop in terms of filling it with more produce and in terms of its appearance.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Roden-Scott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy produce

loans.name: Tania

texts.es:
Tania  socia del Bancomunal Niño Divino.
Tania es conviviente tiene  41 años, dos hijos de 12 y 7 años que están en la escuela estatal. 
Desde niña Tania ha vendido con su mamá en el mercado anticuchos, allí ella aprendió del negocio, estudio enfermería técnica, no llegó a terminar por que se dio cuenta que le gustaba estar en el negoció  de ventas.  Ahora ella se dedica a vender ropa nueva y usada en Pista Nueva.
Tania necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para compra de ropa de invierno y vender en Huaraz. 
Desde que esta en Finca, su economía ha mejorado, sus hijos están en al escuela particular, pudo comprar un auto  de segunda y ahora lo alquila, ella se siente agradecida por todo lo que ha aprendido, y ha podido lograr.    
El sueño de Tania es remodelar su casa para alquilarla por cuartos.
texts.en:
Tania is a member of Bancomunal Niño Divino.

Tania lives with her partner. She is 41 years old and has two children, aged 12 and 7, who are in a state school.

Since childhood, Tania has sold kebabs in the market with her mother. There she learned business. She studied technical nursing, but did not finish because she realized that she liked being in business and sales. Now, she sells new and used clothes in the Pista Nueva.

Tania needs a loan of 1,000 soles ($325 USD) to purchase winter clothes and sell them in Huarez.

Since she has been with the Finca, her finances have improved. Her children are going to private school. She was able to buy a second-hand car that she now rents. She feels thankful for all that she has learned and has been able to achieve.

Tania’s dream is to remodel her house to rent rooms.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase winter clothes and sell them in Huarez

loans.name: Haitham

texts.en:
A married father of one, Mr. Haitham H. is 39 years old. The college cafeteria has become an important source of income for Haitham’s family. This is where he operates now. Haitham’s friendly manner has made the cafeteria into a place that is very popular with the college students. 

Due to the requests he receives daily from his regular customers, he wants to increase his stock of products. In order to do this, Haitham is requesting a loan of $3000. He hopes you will be able to help him.

loans.use: To increase his inventory in the cafeteria.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 51 years old and married to Julao. The couple manages a rice farming business, which is their main livelihood. Aside from that, Josefina also maintains a hog raising business as an alternate source of income to further support their most important needs. Due to lack of financial capital for their farming, Josefina is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000. She hopes that through the loan she is requesting, they will able to avoid asking local money lenders who charge a very high interest rate.

The couple is blessed with three children; Joseph is 29 years old but only completed elementary school, Joel is 24 years and was able to finish high school and the youngest,  Jhulina is 11 years old. Josefina hopes that her youngest daughter will finish college through the sacrifice of the family.

loans.use: Business Maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Growing produce for markets

loans.name: La Esperancita Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha:  María Antonia López Guevara, Susana Isabel González González  e Isela del Carmen Chávez.

El grupo solidario La  Esperancita es originario de la ciudad de Masaya, de la comarca Las Conchitas, ellas por igual tienen sus actividades económicas y dependen solo de ellas, son bien conocidas por esta actividad en sus barrios.

Doña María Antonia se dedica a la elaboración y venta de nacatamales, los hace en su casa y los vende en la comarca, vive con su nieta, es viuda desde hace varios años y su negocio la mantiene con sus gastos. Sueña poder mejorar su casa para cuando esté mayor sentirse más cómoda.

Doña Susana se dedica al destace de cerdo, tiene muchos años de experiencia en este negocio, tiene tres hijos pequeños en edad escolar  es la coordinadora del grupo,su esposo le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, trabaja en carpintería, ella expresa que su negocio es de ella y compra lo que ella quiere para ella y sus hijos. Sueña con mejorar su negocio y así mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.

Doña Isela es una mujer mayor con una familia 2 hijos , ellos estudian en la escuela del barrio, le ayudan en el negocio de la crianza de cerdos y en destace. Su negocio le garantiza la alimentación de la familia y es por esto que ella es muy importante en las decisiones del hogar.
texts.en:
Photo from left to right: María Antonia López Guevara, Susana Isabel González González e Isela del Carmen Chávez. The group La Esperancita is native of the city of Masaya located in Las Conchitas. They equally have their own economic activities and depend completely on them. They are well known for this activity in their neighborhoods. Doña María Antonia is dedicated to making and selling nacatamales (type of tamale). She makes them in her home and sells them in her area. She lives with her granddaughter. She has been a widow for various years and her business takes care of their expenses. She dreams of being able to improve her home so that when she is older she can feel more comfortable. Susana is dedicated to butchering pork. She has many years' experience in this business. She has three small children who are school age. She is the group's coordinator. Her husband helps her with the bills. He works as a carpenter. She says that her business is for her and she buys what she wants for herself and her children. She dreams of improving her business and also improving the standard of living for her family. Isela is an older woman with a family and two children. They study in the neighborhood school. They help her with the business raising and slaughtering pigs. Her business guarantees food for her family and it is because of this that she is a very important decisionmaker in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pigs to sell the meat and nacatamales.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La señora Gregoria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 38 años de edad, es madre soltera, y tiene 4 hijos.  Gregoria tiene estudios de primaria completa y vive en el Barrio San Miguel.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 03 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para la compra de cereales. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de ropa americana, la misma que será vendida en las ferias de la zona.

Su deseo es comprarse un terreno en Ilave y luego con el tiempo construir, para poder vivir con sus hijos.

A ella le gustan la puntualidad y las charlas de capacitación.
texts.en:
Gregoria belongs to the 3 de Mayo Community Bank, which is located in the Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is a 38 year old single mother of four children. Gregoria has an elementary school education. She lives in the San Miguel neighborhood. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for three years. She used her first loan of 300 PEN to buy cereals. She now needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy American clothes. She will sell them at the regional fairs. Her wish is to buy a piece of land in Ilave and, in time, be able to live there with her children. (About her community bank) She likes the punctuality and the training talks.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy second hand clothes

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en: Lucena R. manages a small rice field which is 5 hectares (12.5 acres) in size in Veruela, Agusan del Sur. She has four children and a very supportive husband who looks after their needs. Aside from having a farm, she also sells different goods. She only sells those items that are needed by people everyday. Lucena would like to ask for a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI). She will use the loan to buy three bags of ammonium sulfate fertilizer, rice seed, and other inputs. She is hoping that what she invests in her business will lead to good return of investment in the future. CEVI helps small businesses grow. It provides its clients with not just loans but with training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy three bags of ammonium sulfate fertilizer, rice seed, and other inputs

loans.name: Mayira Group

texts.en:
These are the members of the Mayira group. They are small-scale businesspeople from Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of 500,000 SLL each to improve their businesses. With a loan, they will be able to add more goods to their stalls, make more sales and generate a better profit. Consequently, their living standard will improve and they will be able to better look after themselves and their children.

The leader of this group is Alfred (pictured left). He was born in Magburaka and is now 35 years old. He is married with three children – two of whom are in primary school and one of whom is not yet of school-going age. Alfred sells cosmetics and has been in this business for many years now.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
Rene D. is the 44-year-old father of three children from Sto. Nino, South Cotabato, Mindanao. His eldest child is 18 years old and, as a father, Rene is worried about the future college education of his children. His business is rice farming. This is his only source of living that has sustained his family for a long time now.

Rene has been a Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) client since 2002 and has kept a good repayment record on all his loans. He is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI which he will use to buy farming materials, to pay for the laborers for his upcoming harvest, and to start another business to augment his income.

Rene said he likes CEVI a lot because it gives him not just loans but insurance and a low interest rate as well.

loans.use: To buy farming materials, to pay laborers and to start another business

loans.name: Rodegunda

texts.en: Rodegunda C. is from the village of Agusan Canyon, Camp Phillips, Bukidnon. She is 51 years old, is married, and has six adult children. Rodegunda owns and operates a business providing transport services using her "habal-habal" motor vehicle (her husband as the driver) in the local community (a habal-habal is a motorcycle with an extended seat that carries 2-6 passengers). Rodegunda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In 2006, Rodegunda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase items to expand her services offered. Rodegunda is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used for motor vehicle maintenance. This loan will be her 5th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children’s education. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for maintenance of the motorcycle

loans.name: Ganjuur

texts.en: Ganjuur A. lives with her husband and twin daughters in a house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her older two children are married and live in the Dundgobi province of Mongolia and herd livestock for a living. One of younger daughters attends the Agriculture university and the other wanths to become a hairdresser. A. operates a fruit retail business in a mobile stall in Ulaanbaatar with the help of her husband. She purchases fruit from the Narantuul and Bars markets, the two largest markets in Ulaanbaatar, and sell them to people for a profit. A. and her husband are a very hardworking couple who have managed to build their house with their fruit stand profits. Her current working capital exceeds 300,000 tugrug (~210 USD) and she is planning on opening one more mobile stall where her husband can operate separately.  A. is requesting a 700,000 tugrug (~492 USD) loan in order to afford her daughter’s tuition fee so that she might be able to get job in the city after graduation and live closer to her parents.

loans.use: To afford her daughter’s tuition fee at the Agricultural University

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima H. is from the village of Malugas. She is 66 years old. Zosima is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Zosima owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling rice products in the local community. Zosima has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Zosima joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zosima has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. Zosima is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Zosima from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & for working capital

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophal C., 35, and her husband, Mr. Ran Lun, 40, married in 1991 and have one son and one daughter. Both of them are in school. They are living on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Sophal has been a silk weaver since she was 15 years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village where she lives, and the middleman then takes take them to sell in Phnom Penh market. 

Mr. Ran Lun has been selling cows, oxen and horses since he was married. He hopes to buy more cows, oxen and horses for resale; he will be able to generate much income at the same time. 

Hence Sophal is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 to provide capital for her husband to expand his business.

loans.use: provide capital for her husband to purchase more cows, etc.

loans.name: Erdenebileg

texts.en:
Erdenebileg N. is a 47 year old father of 5 children. He currently lives with his two youngest children, 17 year old daughter and 23 year old son, and his wife in Bayanhongor province, one of Mongolia's western provinces. His three oldest children are all university students in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The 23 year old son works in a local company and the youngest daughter an 11th grade student at a local high school.

Erdenebileg sells various food products for the locals. He visits local families and herder families by car and sells various basic food products, including rice, sugar, flour, etc. When he is in town, he uses his car as a taxi for locals. He says that his family business pays for his three children's university tuition. His goal is to make sure that all of his children receive a good education without any financial strains.

He is requesting a loan to purchase more food products for his business.

About XacBank:
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva's 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

loans.use: To purchase more food products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase shop items in bulk for her business

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita M. is from the village of Centro 2. She is 58 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Carmelita owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Carmelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Louise

texts.fr: Louise S. est âgée de 53ans, mariée et mère de 9enfants. Elle s’active dans le petit commerce de miel et d’huile de palme. Elle souhaite avec ce prêt renforcer son capital afin de mieux subvenir aux besoins de santé et de scolarité de sa famille.
texts.en:
Louise S., age 53, is married and the mother of nine children. Her business consists in selling honey and palm oil. She would like to use this loan to bolster her working capital, in order to better provide for her family's healthcare and school expenses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell honey and palm oil

loans.name: Rosa Victoria

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosa Victoria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 39 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que dependen de ella y están estudiando.
	
Ante la necesidad de aportar al ingreso económico del hogar, motivada por su esposo y ella misma, emprendió su pequeño negocio de abarrotes, con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00, obteniendo muy buenos resultados desde un inicio por sus precios cómodos y la buena atención al cliente. Su negocio se encuentra  ubicado en su misma casa, en un local muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes. Sus principales clientes son los vecinos y amigos de su barrio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00 comprará  y surtirá con más  productos su negocio como cajas de cocoa, paquete de aceite, leche en cajas, insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes y otros productos para mantener contenta a su clientela. 

Rosita como la llaman de cariño, se siente muy feliz del servicio que brinda y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por la oportunidad que le ha dado.
texts.en:
Senora Rosa Victoria, belongs to the communal bank “Los Eucaliptos”, Tarapoto district, state and province of San Martín. She is single, 39, and the mother of 2 children of school age. Before there was the necessity of contributing to the household income, motivated by herself and by her husband, she started her small grocery business with her first loan of $100. she got very good results from the start because of her accessible prices and good client attention. Her business is in her home, in an area well-equipped to take care of her clients. Her principal clients are the neighbors and friends of her neighborhood. With this loan of $300 she will buy more business supplies such as boxes of cocoa, packages of oil, boxes of milk, personal hygiene and home cleaning products, soft drinks, and other products to keep her clientele happy. Rosita, as she is called, feels very happy with the service she provides, and thankful to the Movement Manuela Ramos for the opportunity it has given her.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of groceries and soft drinks

loans.name: God's Mercy Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth V. leads a group of five borrowers called God’s Mercy. She is 42 years old, married, and has three children who are 18, 19 and 23 years old. In addition to her children, Elizabeth also supports three of her nieces.

For 15 years, Elizabeth has made a living selling cocoa nuts and fish at the Red Light Market, the largest market in Liberia.  She sells the cocoa nuts wholesale by the bag and the fish individually, which is convenient for customers and keeps them coming back to make new purchases.

Elizabeth plans to use her 9,000 Liberian-dollar portion of this 45,000 Liberian-dollar group loan to buy more cocoa nuts and fish.  Her goal is to grow her business and to continue to support her children and her nieces.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Elizabeth is the one holding the sign. The inset at the right is a photo of loan group member Mamie K..

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts a special emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more fish and cocoa nuts.

loans.name: Khun

texts.en: Khun K., age 42, is married and resides with her children in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She has five children. She is in a business of producing palm sugar for sale, earning an income of $2.50 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially the children’s education. Her husband is employed in a nongovernmental organization, earning an income of $3.50 per day. He has been with this job since 2006. K. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. This is her first loan from CREDIT, partnered Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband's commute

loans.name: Tomasa Catiil Group

texts.en:
Tomasa C. is from the village of Upper Puntod. She is 48 years old. Tomasa is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Tomasa is married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Tomasa owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Tomasa has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $33 a month from these activities.

In 2001, Tomasa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tomasa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Tomasa is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 21st loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda tiene 27 años y es una madre de familia muy trabajadora. Vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Teófilo de 31 años y sus 2 hijos, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro.

Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas; cultiva papas y maíz, las cuales lleva a vender hasta el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, donde las vende al por mayor. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante este negocio.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta la ciudad, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Para más adelante, desea alquilar un puesto estable en el mercado mayorista, ya que por ahora vende como ambulante.

Este es el sétimo préstamo de Hilda con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre está al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más abono e insecticidas, con lo cual espera mejorar y proteger sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Hilda is 27 years old and is a very hardworking mother. She lives in a rented house together with her husband, Teófilo, who is 31, and their 2 children, to whom she wants to provide a better future.

With much effort, she has been able to work on her lands and make them productive again. She grows corn and potatoes, which she brings to sell at the city’s wholesale market, where she sells them wholesale. Her crops have given her the necessary income to support her family. This is why she wants to put all of her efforts into having her business succeed.

What she likes most about her work is caring for her crops. She has worked in this business for 8 years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting her products to the city, since the bags that she brings are very heavy and are tiring. In the future, she wants to rent a stand at the wholesale market since she currently sells on foot.

This is Hilda’s seventh loan with MFP and she has been very punctual with her previous loans and hopes to be so again with this one. She is a very active member of her communal bank and is always on top of the agreements reached by her group. With the 2,500 PEN requested, she will purchase more fertilizer and insecticide, with which she hopes to improve and protect her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es una madre de familia de 45 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a uno de sus hijos en el sector Los Algarrobos del distrito de Mosefú, también conocida como La Ciudad de las Flores, es una zona con fama nacional por sus festividades turisticas y religiosas y se encuentra ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace muchos años a la venta de flores en los exteriores del cementerio de la ciudad de Ferreñafe, este negocio es realizado durante los fines de semana, que es cuando el camposanto recibe un mayor número de visitantes. Esta actividad constituye una fuente importante de ayuda a la economía familiar ya que su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y esta actividad no le brinda ingresos de manera permanente.

Hace algunos meses Mercedes adquirió con mucho esfuerzo una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros) con la que perciben ingresos adicionales, el vehículo es conducido por su hijo que recorre la ciudad de Monsefú y sus caseríos aledaños brindando su servicio.

El continuo uso brindado a la unidad y el estado accidentado de los caminos que unen a la ciudad de Monsefú con sus caseríos han hecho que la mototaxi empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para su correcto funcionamiento. Además ella desea regularizar toda la documentación que le permita ofrecer el servicio dentro de la legalidad correspondiente, por este motivo ella se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Mercedes es una mujer trabajadora y entregada a su familia, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de cancelar sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Mercedes, age 45, lives with her husband and one of their children in the Los Algarrobos section of the Mosefú district. It is also known as “La Ciudad de las Flores” (The City of the Flowers). This area is famous nationally for its tourist and religious festivities. It is located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For many years she has been selling flowers outside of the cemetery in the city of Ferreñafe. She works at this business on the week-ends because that is when there are a large number of people who visit the graveyard. This activity constitutes an important source of economic help to the family. Her husband is a farmer, and this does not produce income in a permanent way. A few months ago Mercedes, with much effort, got a “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle used to transport cargo and passengers). She gets additional income from the mototaxi. The vehicle is driven by her son. He travels the city of Monsefú and the outlying rural communities offering his services. The continual usage of the vehicle and the rough state of the roads that join the city of Monsefú with its rural communities have caused the mototaxi to start to have some problems. These require urgent repair to make it operate correctly. She also wants to pay for all of the documentation that permits her to legally offer taxi services. That is why she is requesting a loan for 2,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to help her achieve her objective. Mercedes is a hard-working woman who is devoted to her family. Her greatest desire is to continue growing as a businesswoman to be able to give her family a better quality of life. She has previously worked with our institution. She has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility at the time of making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair, maintenance, and documention expenses for her mototaxi

loans.name: Lydia

texts.fr: K. Lydia est née en 1970 à Ekpè dans la commune de Sèmé-Podji au Bénin. Mariée à BOITCHA Pascal, Lydia est mère de cinq enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Lydia vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari à Tchonvi, dans la commune de Sèmé-Podji, depuis quatre ans environs. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Lydia n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. Pour assurer ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants, Lydia mène comme activité, la vente de produits vivriers et d'huile de palme à son domicile, et parfois de façon ambulante. Lydia exerce cette activité depuis sept ans environs et a déjà bénéficié d'un crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé à ALIDé. Dans l’optique d'agrandir davantage son activité et d'augmenter le stock de ses produits afin de mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle, Lydie sollicite un deuxième crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Lydia K. was born in 1970 in Ekpé, part of the Sèmé-Podji commune of Benin. Married to Pascal BOITCHA, Lydia is the mother of five children, some of whom are in school. For the past four years, she has lived with her husband and children in Tchonvi, in the Sèmé-Podji commune. The couple share coping with various family expenses. Lydia has never attended school. To meet her needs and those of her children, she retails fresh produce and palm oil primarily from her home, and sometimes as an itinerant vendor. She has been running this business for approximately seven years, and has already been granted one loan from ALIDé, which was fully repaid. She is now requesting a second loan, wishing to expand her activity and increase her stock of supplies to better meet her customers’ expectations.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fresh produce and containers of palm oil

loans.name: Rosa Vilma

texts.es: Rosa Vilma C. D. R. D. 50 años D. edad, resiD. en Nueva San Salvador, ubicado en el departamento D. La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo el cual se dedica a trabajar para una empresa privada. Rosa posee una tienda D. productos D. primera necesidad como comestibles y productos D. uso diario en el hogar, muchos productos poseen una gran demanda por parte D. las personas, las cuales Rosa desea mucho poder aumentar, ya que le permitirán tener mayores ganancias lo cual es muy importante para ella, ya que es gracias a la tienda que tanto ella como se esposo poseen una vida estable. Rosa solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la tienda comprando productos como leche en polvo, pan, golosinas y sodas, entre otro número D. productos más. Rosa posee una gran ilusión D. poder ver su negocio en mejores condiciones y brindándoles el dinero necesario para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Rosa Vilma Cárcamo D. R., 50, lives in Nueva San Salvador, La Libertad department, with her husband whose employed by a prívate firm. Rosa has a grocery store where she stocks basic needs items like foodstuffs and daily home use items; many of the products are in high demand by people and Rosa wants to increase her stock amounts so that she can earn higher profits, which is very important to her, because it’s thanks to the store that she and her husband have stable lives. Rosa is asking for funds to invest in stock items for the store like: powdered milk, bread, sweets and soft-drinks among many other products. Rosa hopes to see her store’s condition improve so that it will produce income for her to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

location.town: Nueva San Salvador, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Liezl

texts.en:
Liezl D., from the village of San Carlos, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur, is 28 years old, married, and has one school-aged children. To make a living, Liezl owns and operates a business venture manufacturing and selling clothing products to local businesses and community members. Engaged in her business for over four years, she earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Liezl joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 6000 PHP from GDMPC that was used to to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products, she is requesting a new loan, her fourth, of 7000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul S. is from the village of Malintubuan, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte. He is 46 years old. Paul is married. To make a living, Paul operates a specialized retail store.
