The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Paul has been engaged in his business for more than eight years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2009, Paul joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Paul has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Paul is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Paul from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About PMPC Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Evelia

texts.en:
Evelia O. is from the village of Waterfall, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 57 years old. Evelia is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Evelia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, and also different varieties of household products, in the local community. Evelia has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Evelia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Evelia is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 18th loan taken out by Evelia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 28 años, vive con su madre en casa de sus padres. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a realizar bordados para los trajes típicos de su localidad. Desde su misma casa trabaja todos los días y en el horario que más se acondicione a sus necesidades. Su madre de vez en cuando la ayuda en el trabajo, puesto que el trabajo requiere de mucha dedicación si quiere conseguir que estas prendas sean coloridas y con buen acabado. Una vez terminada la labor, es entregada a los clientes que solicitan sus servicios. Disfruta mucho la actividad que realiza, porque este trabajo lo puede hacer en su casa sin presiones, además de que sus bordados son bien cotizados en su zona y más en fechas festivas como es este mes de julio y agosto. Desea para el futuro mejorar sus trabajos e incrementar su producción. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de hilos dorados, plateados y de diversos colores, también comprará nuevos bastidores.
texts.en:
María is 28 years old and lives in her parents' home with her mother. Since she was a child she has been creating the embroidery on the traditional suits from her region. She works everyday from home, so she can set her schedule to best fit her needs. Her mother sometimes helps her, because it takes a lot of work to make the colorful, well-finished garments. Once finished, the suit is delivered to the customer who requested it. María really enjoys her work because she can work at home without pressure. Her embroidery is in high demand locally, especially around holidays such as this July and August. For the future, she hopes to improve her work and sales. This is María's 6th loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has this financial support. She has always been responsible in her loan repayment and is grateful to be a part of her community group because all of the members are responsible and supportive. María is also grateful to those people who will provide the funding for the loan she is requesting. This loan will be very useful in the progress of her business. María will invest in the purchase of gold, silver, and colored thread. She will also buy new embroidery frames (to hold the fabric in place during embroidery).

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various colored thread and embroidery frames.

loans.name: Valentin

texts.es:
Valentín tiene 36 años y vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con su esposa y sus dos hijos. Valentín trabaja en el gobierno regional del Cusco desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde. Valentin se levanta muy temprano para vender jora de maíz a su clientes. Ya son 9 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.
 
Con su próximo préstamo, Valentín espera recibir $800 USD. Por el momento, tiene suficiente mercadería en su domicilio. Le gustaría con el dinero del préstamo para comprar maíz. 

El banco comunal “Las Leonas de San Jerónimo”  ya tiene 10 ciclos de funcionamiento, pero Valentín hace varios años atrás que recién participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien.
texts.en:
Valentín is 36 years old and lives in the city of Cusco with his wife and two children. He works for the regional government of Cusco from seven in the morning until three in the afternoon. He rises very early to sell "jora de maiz" (corn meal derived from germinated seeds) to his customers. He has been selling "jora de maiz" for 9 years and has been successful due to his determination and effort. With this loan application, Valentín hopes to receive $800. At the moment, he has sufficient merchandise in his home. He would like to buy corn with the loan proceeds. The communal bank “Las Leonas de San Jerónimo” (The Lions of San Jerónimo) has already completed 10 loan cycles, but Valentín only joined the bank several years ago. He has been a productive member.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline R. is from the village of Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 63 years old, widowed and has 1 adult-aged child. Evangeline owns and operates a dressmaking business, manufacturing and selling clothing products to local businesses and community members. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Evangeline joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC, which was used to to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Evangeline from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Twegatte Women's Group-Kampala

texts.en:
Mukibi Annet, 57, belongs to the Twegatte Women’s group-Kampala.
Don’t compromise your principals and beliefs is the precept she has been using to push her retail shop. Her sand and firewood sales set her business horizons way beyond the boundaries of being mediocre and way ahead of her competitors. Having been a teacher, Annet says the proactiveness she used while teaching is still proving to be relevant. Annet is happily married and is a local councilor in her home area. In a week she makes profits that total 300,000 shillings. With this loan, she wants to buy more retail stock such as sugar, salt and beans. She also wants to buy more sand and firewood for resale.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, salt, beans and firewood for resale

loans.name: Chita

texts.en:
Chita B. is from the village of Poblacion, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 43 years old. Chita is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Chita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Chita has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Chita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Chita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Chita is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Chita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama B.  is a twenty-seven-year-old hairdresser at Nyinasi near Abura. Ama B. is married and has two children. Her husband is a butcher. She plans to use her loan to improve her business; she wants to buy more of the gadgets such as hair dryers and chemicals like shampoo she uses in her hairdressing business. She will then use the profits she makes in her business to further her children’s education.

loans.use: buy hair dryers and chemicals like shampoo

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy different kinds of threads and cloth

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en:
Jeffrey C. lives on Arellano St. in Tuguegarao City. He is 46 years old and married. To make a living, he owns and operates a restaurant, serving lunch foods to customers in the local community. Jeffrey has been engaged in his business for over twenty years and earns approximately $166 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jeffrey joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be his 1st loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani lives in Pakistan, in the small city of Kasur, famous for its leather industry. She lives with her family in the area of Dungipura in a 3-room brick house. She moved here after her marriage to M. R. 25 years ago. Rani is a talented woman, operating a clothing sales business from her home. She has a good name in the region due to her choice of fabrics and well-designed clothes. She receives regular orders from her local area clients every month.

Rani is the mother of 2 daughters who are involved in the embroidery business, embroidering clothes on order. Her husband operates a power loom (a hand-operated machine for weaving thread or yarn into cloth) business. He makes threads of different colors on order and earns income for the family.

Rani has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah to improve her clothing sales business. She plans to use the loan to buy a variety of clothes in bulk to earn more income. Rani has been running this business for over 10 years and is very confident about its future growth. She is hopeful that the loan investment will help her increase her profits and enable her to collect dowry for her elder daughter's marriage. Rani is a new loan applicant with Asasah.

Note: In the photo, Rani is holding the book (the Asasah Passbook) in her hands.

loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk

loans.name: Corazones Unidos (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Corazones Unidos está formado por 9 socias que viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se caracteriza por mantener su cultura y tradiciones, en la cual encierra un hermoso centro histórico, su gente es amable y cordial como nuestras socias quienes son mujeres luchadoras quienes con su trabajo diario sacan  adelante a sus familias y les brindan lo mejor que se encuentra a su alcance.

La Señora. Marína G. vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, es el séptimo crédito que realiza en la banca comunal y le gusta ya que cuenta con grandes amigas quienes cada quince días salen de la rutina con la alegría que cada una pone en la reunión.

Nuestra socia tiene 49 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos  de 27, 24, 21, 20, 18 y 14 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos son casados y viven independientes, su tercer hijo se dedica a trabajar y es solo para sus gastos, su cuarta hija estudia en el universidad y sus dos últimos hijos estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña Marína tiene un carrito salchipapero en donde vende papas fritas, actividad que viene desempeñando hace un año, vende solo los fines de semana y de lunes a viernes labora en un restaurante desde las 6 de la tarde hasta las 10 de la noche.

Con el dinero de su crédito va a comprar un quintal de papas y golosinas para la venta en su carrito. Su meta es ampliar mucho más su negocio.

La Señora. Jhoana L. vive en las afueras de la ciudad, es una mujer muy joven con apenas 24 años, es separada de su pareja hace un año y tiene 4 hijos de 11, 9, 2 años y su ultimo hijo de apenas 3 meses de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en la escuela, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de un familiar. 

Doña Jhoana se dedica a laborar en la limpieza de casas, actividad que la desempeña hace 3 años y solo 4 horas al día, trabaja de lunes a sábados.

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en la banca comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para iniciar en este negocio. su meta es crecer en este negocio para no tener que salir de su casa y dejar a sus hijos solos.
texts.en:
The Corazones Unidas community bank has 9 members who live in different parts of the city of Cuenca.  This city is noted for having maintained its culture and traditions and its beautiful historic center.  It is also noted for its kind and friendly people such as these women.  These are determined women who, through their daily work, get their families ahead in life and provide them with the best that they can.

Mrs Marína G. lives in the Cuenca city center.  This is her seventh loan with her community bank and she likes it since she has some good friends there who leave their daily routine every two weeks and come to the bank meetings which each one injects with a bit of happiness.

Marína is 49 years old.  She is married and has 6 children aged 27, 24, 21, 20, 18 and 14.  Her eldest two children are married and live independently.  Her third child works and covers his own expenses.  Her fourth child, a girl, studies at university and her youngest two children are studying in high school.  Her husband works as a private employee.  They don't have their own home but rent.

Marína has a 'salchipapero' (Peruvian fast food) cart from which she sells French fries.  She has been in this business for a year.  She sells on weekends.  From Monday to Friday she works in a restaurant from 6.00pm to 10.00pm.

Marína will use her loan to buy a 100kg sack of potatoes and candies to sell on her cart.  Her goal is to expand her business a lot more.

Mrs Jhoana L. lives on the outskirts of the city.  She is a young woman of 24.  She separated from her partner a year ago and has 4 children aged 11, 9, 2 and 3 months.  Her eldest two children are in school.  She doesn't have her own home but lives with a family member.

Jhoana works cleaning houses.  She has been in this business for 3 years and works 4 hours a day, from Monday to Saturday.

This is Jhoana's first loan with her community bank and she will invest it in buying chickens to set herself up in this business.  Her goal is to grow in this business so that she doesn't have to go out and leave her children home alone.

loans.use: To buy a 100kg sack of potatoes; to buy candies and chickens

loans.name: José Amílcar

texts.es: José Amílcar H. F. de 35 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Ilopango, el cual se encuentra en el departamento de San Salvador. Él vive junto a su esposa y tres hijos menores de edad. José desde hace 14 años atrás que se dedica a la pesca artesanal, actividad la cual se le facilita en gran manera debido a que su casa se encuentra en las cercanías del lago de Ilopango, en donde José pesca a diario, y posteriormente comercializa los pescado con diferentes clientes, de esta manera él se gana el sustento diario y cuenta con lo necesario para sostener a su familia. José solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar más materia para elaborar  redes más grandes y de esta manera obtener una mejor pesca con más variedad de pescado. Lo que más desea José es mejorar su negocio, ya que es esta la única fuente de ingresos que posee.
texts.en:
José Amílcar H. F. is 35 years old.  He lives in the town of Ilopango, in San Salvador department, together with his wife and three dependent children.  José has been working as a traditional, small-scale fisherman for 14 years.  His work is made easier because his house is located very near Lake Ilopango where he fishes every day and where he then sells the fish to his different customers.  In this way, he earns his living and has what he needs to support his family.

José is requesting a loan to buy more materials to make bigger fishing nets so that he improve his fishing and catch a greater variety of fish.  What José would like most is to improve his business since it is the only source of income that he has.

loans.use: To buy material for making fishing nets

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a dairy farmer in Kitale town, western Kenya. She has been farming for the last nine years and employs one farmhand. She sells her milk to the local market.

Mary is 60 years old and married with 6 children who are now between the ages of 14 and 31. Three of the children are currently attending school.

She has requested for this loan of 75,195KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a motorcycle for transporting milk to the market. She says that this motorcycle will enable her deliver milk to the market without any problem and this will improve her income. She says that her major challenge has always been the poor road network which hinders access to the market. She plans to venture into the business of processing milk products in future.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for transporting products

loans.name: Rrisca

texts.es: Rrisca, es una mujer luchadora, que a pesar de sus 62 años, trabaja arduamente en compañía de su esposo Gerardo, para cuidar de sus 6 hijos, todos ello menores de edad. En armonía familiar ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en Pueblo Pardo (selva central peruana). Todas las mañanas en compañía de su esposo Gerardo, sale a cuidar de sus 2 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas, donde siembra una variedad de frutas como: carambola, cacao, palta y mango. Ya tiene 10 años dedicándose a ello, y asegura le gusta mucho el trabajo en el campo; “puedo disfrutar de la tranquilidad, y es mi propio negocio”, afirma. Por ello más delante desea adquirir más terrenos agrícolas, con la ayuda de sus hijos, ya que le dificulta mucho llevar su cosecha a comercializarlo en la ciudad, por ese motivo comercializa sus frutas en su mismo terreno agrícola. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Caramboleros”, y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde es una socia responsable y dedicada. Los frutos de Rrisca, están creciendo fuertes y saludables, por ello con el crédito que solicita, está pensando comprar varios sacos de abono orgánico; asimismo en el pago del personal para su cosecha de mango.
texts.en: Rrosca is a hardworking woman that, in spite of her 62 years, works hard with her husband Gerardo to care for their six minor children. In familial harmony they live in their own house, which is located in Pueblo Pardo (the jungles of central Peru). Every morning, in the company of her husband Gerardo, she leaves to go care for their two hectacres of agricultural land. They grow a variety of fruit such as star fruit, cocoa, avocado and mango. She has been working in this field for the past ten years. She likes to work in the countryside. “I can enjoy the tranquility and it is my own business,” she says. In the future she would like to buy more agricultural land. With the help of her children she brings her harvest to sell in the city. She grows her fruit on her farmland. She belongs to the “Los Caramboleros” Community Bank. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She is a responsible and dedicate member of the bank. Rrisca’s fruit is strong and healthy. With this loan she would like to buy organic fertilizer and also pay workers to harvest her mangos.

loans.use: To buy sacks of organic fertilizer and also cover the salary of her workers.

loans.name: Mairam's Group

texts.en:
Every businessman aims to have a sustainable and flourishing activity that will be useful to him and to society. Introducing new food products at an affordable price is very important for a grocery store. This creditor Mairam does her best to provide good customer service and healthy products. 
 
Mairam A., 37, is the treasurer of this group. She’s a business lady who runs a small grocery store that she opened 4 years ago by her house. She doesn’t have any employees because she can manage all services herself. She works hard to provide for her family. Three of her children go to school and the youngest is 2 years old. Mairam says it’s a convenient business, because she can stay close to home and take care of her daughter. 

Mairam’s husband is a tractor driver in a local farm. She has to constantly invest 12 000 soms in the goods circulation of her shop. A monthly income of 5 000 soms helps her to keep business stability and a good economic welfare for her family.  Mairam hopes that Kiva’s loan will help her to furnish her shop with a wide assortment of goods and attract more customers. 

      --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of household products to sell

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en:
Wissam is a young woman from Deir Al Balah in the Gaza Strip. She is married and has two daughters. Wissam's husband sells ornamental birds and fish. Wissam's husband Ahmad started the store two years ago, and now that he has a good number of customers, he wants to increase his sales.

Wissam took a loan from FATEN so that Ahmad could buy more fish and birds as well as their feed and other accessories. Wissam's husband Ahmad appears in the picture here as Wissam is a conservative woman.

loans.use: Purchasing ornamental birds and fish and feed for them

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes K. has been selling ladies’ wear, pampers and other items at Takoradi near Effiakuma Estate for four years. Educated up to senior high school, she is married to a mechanic, and they have five children. 
Her income helps pay for the children’s school fees and household utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more wares for resale in order to grow her business. She hopes to reinvest her additional profit.

loans.use: To buy more wares for resale.

loans.name: Violeta Group

texts.es:
Paola forma parte del Banco comunal “Violeta” conformado por 21 emprendedores, que se desempeñan en los rubros de arteS.ía y manualidades, pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillán.
Paola quién en la foto se encuentra de pie en la primera fila y tercera del lado izquierdo, viste polera negra, además tiene lentes de sol sobre su cabello. Ella realiza todo tipo de arteS.ía y manualidades, específicamente soft (confección de muñecos con algodón y pantys), cartonaje (cosas hechas con cartón), confección de bolsas de tela. Ella trabaja en su casa confeccionando diversas manualidades, todas las tardes. Y las temporadas de más alta demanda son durante los meses de; mayo (día de la madre), septiembre (Fiesta costumbrista chilena) y diciembre (navidad). En estas temporadas Paola se instala con un local en una feria artesanal. El horario laboral es de 10ºº de la mañana a 9ºº de la noche.
Con éste préstamo comprará insumos para sus manualidades, entre éstos telas, blondas y silicona.
El sueño de Paola es tener un local establecido. Es por esto su motivación de seguir en la confección y venta de manualidades ya que pretende mejorar sus ingresos. 
Ella vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 18 y 7 años de edad. Su madre que vive en la ciudad de Santiago, le ayuda en la compra de insumos a precios más convenientes y se los envía a la ciudad de Chillán por encomienda. 
Ella está muy agradecida de Fondo Esperanza le gusta mucho participar de las reuniones, ya que son muy amenas, es por esto que además es delegada del Banco comunal. En cuanto al financiamiento que recibe por medio de Fondo Esperanza, éste será un gran aporte para su negocio, ya que con éste podrá invertir y aumentar sus ingresos.
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
Paola is a member of the Communal Bank “Violeta”, which consists of 21 entrepreneurs who work in arts and crafts. They live in the city of Chilán.

In the photograph, Paola is standing in the second row, third from the left and wearing a black shirt and with a pair of sunglasses in her hair. She produces all types of arts and crafts, especially soft cotton dolls, objects made from cardboard, and cloth bags. Paola works from home, making all types of handicrafts every afternoon. The months in which she has the most demand are May (Mother’s Day), September (traditional Chilean festivals), and December (Christmas). During these times, Paola sets up a stand at the craft fair. Her work schedule is from 10am to 9pm. With this loan she will buy supplies for her handicrafts such as fabrics, lace, and silicone. Paola dreams of having an established shop. For this reason, she is motivated to continue producing and selling her handicrafts so that she can improve her earnings.

Paola lives with her husband and two children, ages 18 and 7. Her mother lives in the city of Santiago and helps her with purchasing supplies at affordable prices. The products are then shipped to her by parcel to the city of Chillán. Paola is very grateful to Fondo Esperanza because she enjoys participating in the meetings because they are very entertaining. For this reason, she has been appointed to be a delegate for her Communal Bank. The funding she has received through Fondo Esperanza has been a great help to her business, since it enables her to invest and increase her income.

Chillán is a community in the central district of southern Chile. Its name means “Window of the Sun” in the Mapudungun language, which is spoken by the Maupuche indigenous people. Chillán is also known as the “Cradle of the Nation” and the “Land of Artists” because many well-known figures in Chile’s history were born there, such as the famous pianist Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: To purchase craft supplies such as fabrics, lace, and silicone.

loans.name: Cruz Maria

texts.es:
La señora Cruz es habitantante de un lugar llamado Tierra Blanca el cual es mas conocido como la novia del sol, ya que ademas de ser una region ganadera es uno de los lugares dnde hace mas calor del estado de Veracruz. Doña cruz tiene la edad de 34 años, estudio la secundaria y esta casada con el señor Eduardo con el cual tiene 2 hijos, una mujer de nombre suzet de 5 años que asiste al preescolar y un niño de nombre Edward de 7 años que asiste a la primaria


ella nos platica desde hace mas de dos años inicio con su propio negocio de venta de colchas, hielitos, chicharones, naranjas conjeladas y  verduras de inicio puso un cartel en la puerta de su casa pero ahora que ya hiso clientes llegan solitos a comprar.

ella necesita este credito para inertirlo en la compra de jitomates, cebolla, chiles, zanahorias, chayotes, papas, naranjas, bolsas, endulsantes saborizantes, chicharones, crema, queso, frutas y colchas para su posterior venta.

ella nos platica que ha estado ahorrando y  espera las ganacian poder iniciar a construir un pequeño local en el cual vendera sus productos. 

ella se encuentra agradecida con la fundacion ya que con estos prestamos ha podido seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y crecer poco a poco
texts.en:
Sra. Cruz is a resident of a place called Tierra Blanca, which is also known as “The Bride of the Sun”. In addition to being a livestock region, it is one of the warmest places in the State of Veracruz. Doña Cruz is 34 years old and has a high school education. She is married to Sr. Eduardo and has two children, a five year old daughter named Suzet who is in preschool and a seven year old son named Edward who is an elementary school student.

Doña Cruz says that she started her own business more than two years ago. She sells quilts, popsicles, pork skins, oranges, frozen foods, and vegetables. Cruz started out by hanging a sign on the door of her house and now she has customers who come to shop.

She needs this loan to invest in the purchase of tomatoes, onions, chili peppers, carrots, chayote, potatoes, oranges, bags, sweeteners, flavorings, pork skins, cream, cheese, fruit, and quilts for eventual resale.

Doña Cruz says that she has been saving and hopes to start building a small shop where she can sell her products. She says she is grateful to Fundación Realidad for these loans which have helped her continue investing her business and keep growing.

loans.use: To purchase fruits, vegetables, quilts, pork skins, and ingredients for making popsicles.

loans.name: Peregrina

texts.en:
Peregrina is 49 years old, married and has one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.
Peregrina has a food production business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 14,000 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to buy ingredients for her food production business. Peregrina has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Maritess

texts.en:
Maritess is 47 years old. She is married and has 8 children.

She earns her living with her hog raising business in the Philippines. Maritess is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her hog-raising business.

Maritess has been in the hog-raising business for 10 years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane and rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream which is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase feeds and vitamins for her hog raising business.

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Maria Del Socorro y su esposo el señor Hilario tienen ya más de 40 años dedicándose a la reparación de carros.
Están solicitando un préstamo ya que al local le hace falta el techo de enfrente y comprar herramienta pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario y no quieren descapitalizar el ingreso del negocio ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para ellos. 
  Desean que el lugar donde trabajan este en mejores condiciones y así ellos puedan contratar a otra persona para que les ayude en le negocio. 
Pagaran el crédito con el  ingreso que obtiene del negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Del Socorro and her husband Hilario have been repairing cars for more than 40 years now.

They are asking for a loan because their shop needs a roof in front, and they need to buy tools, but they do not have the money. They don't want to take it out of the business's earnings because that is their only source of income.

They want the place where they work to be in better condition so they can hire someone to help them with the business. They will pay off the loan with the income they earn from the business.

loans.use: to put a metal roof on her workshop and to buy merchandise

loans.name: Cimi

texts.es: Cimi, de 46 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Alipio de 55 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Elizabeth de 16 y Jireh de 12 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calida de vida. Cimi toda su vida ha trabajado mucho para salir adelante, los 12 años que tiene trabajando en la confección de ropa, le han dado los recursos necesarios para sacar adelante a su familia, ella es muy talentosa con la maquina de coser, es por eso que las instituciones se disputan la contratación de sus servicios. A ella lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cumplir con los pedidos, puesto que sabe que su reputación esta en juego, pero considera que lo más difícil son las amanecidas que muchas veces tiene que darse para cumplir con los pedidos, aun así sabe que ese es su trabajo y que tiene que cumplirlo, anhela ponerle una marca a sus confecciones y hacerla conocida en el mercado. Por tal razón pide de su colaboración a cada uno de ustedes para que pueda concretar sus objetivos. Este será su décimo segundo crédito con MFP, se siente muy feliz de haberlo obtenido y esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es muy querida por la alegría que pone entre las socias. Con los mil doscientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevos materiales para la confección de ropa, así tendrá más productos para vender.
texts.en:
Cimi is 46 years old.  She is a very kind and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, 55 year-old Alipio, and her two beloved children: 16 year-old Elizabeth and 12 year-old Jireh, who she would like to provide with a better quality of life.

Cimi has worked hard her whole life in order to get ahead.  She has been making clothes for 12 years and her work has provided her with the money she needs to get her family ahead in life.  She is very talented with a sewing machine and, for this reason, institutions fight to hire her services.  What Cimi most enjoys about her work is filling her orders since she knows that her reputation is at stake.  She considers the most difficult part of her work to be the long nights that she has to work in order to fill her orders.  However, even so, she knows that this is her work and that she must get it done.  Cimi would like to add a brand name to her clothes and become well known in the market.  She is requesting the collaboration of each and every one of you so that she can achieve her goals.

This will be Cimi's twelfth loan from MFP.  She feels very happy to have obtained her loan and is ready to make all her repayments on time.  She is a very well-liked member of her community bank because of the happiness that she brings to the group.  She will use the 1,200 Peruvian soles that she has requested to buy new materials for making clothes.  In this way, she will have more products to sell.

loans.use: to buy materials so that she can continue making clothes

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a "carinderia" (small eatery) business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy kitchen utensils for her "carinderia".

Mary Grace has been in this business for six years. She earns more income from pig fattening.

Mary Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of her loans from NWTF.  She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy kitchen utensils for her "carinderia" (eatery).

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Agée de 29ans, Afi est revendeuse de pagnes, sacs dame et des foulards. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Lomé et revend au même lieu. Elle a démarré en 2004 et sollicite ce montant pour renforcer son activité. Son mari est conducteur et ils ont 02 enfants.
texts.en: 29 years old, Afi is a reseller of pagne (traditional cloth), women's purses, and scarves. She stocks up at the market in Lome and resells at the same place. She started in 2004 and is asking for this loan to strengthen her business.  Her husband is a chauffeur and they have 2 children.

loans.use: To buy pagne (traditional cloth), bags, and scarves.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha nos cuenta que nació en la comunidad del Tambo Real (provincia de Anta, departamento Cusco, Perú), tiene 34 años de edad y es casada y tiene dos hijos. Actualmente, Martha vive en la misma comunidad donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. Martha se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer el mantenimiento de los galpones osea limpiar y arreglar los malogrados. 

Martha es una persona trabajadora y responsable que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal “Solidaridad de Tambo Real” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
A native of Tambo Real (a community located in the Anta province, Cusco department), Martha is 34 years old, she is married and has two children. Martha currently lives in the same community where she was born, and here she engages in her economy activities. She breeds small animals such as “cuyes” (“cuy” is Quechua for Guinea pig). She has been engaging in this activity for various years now, and things are going very well thanks to the determination she works with. The loan she is requesting in this occasion will be used to pay for maintenance of her sheds, or rather to clean and fix the broken ones.

Martha is a responsible and hardworking woman, and thanks to these qualities she has been invited to join “Solidaridad de Tambo Real” (Tambo Real Solidarity), a communal bank of Asociación Arariwa, by its fellow members.

loans.use: To pay for maintenance of her sheds.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen, 52, is married with two children, aged 25 and 23. She is a farmer who owns and tills land in the town of Banga, South Cotabato. Her husband mainly manages their farm and she helps him grow rice and corn crops. Helen also sells dried fish to the people in her community.

Helen works hard to support her family. She has applied for a loan to fund their farm. She plans to purchase three sacks of seeds, three sacks of fertilizer and three quarts of herbicide. She hopes this loan will help her to grow her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase three sacks of seeds, three sacks of fertilizer and three quarts of herbicide.

loans.name: Adrian De Jesus

texts.es:
Adrián, vive con su esposa y dos hijos,  agricultor y ganadero, el negocio surgió gracias al apoyo de su papá quien siempre se ha dedicado al mismo negocio, no tiene horario establecido para atender las labores que demanda la agricultura.
Actualmente esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas como son abono y pesticidas, cuya compra le permitirá tener todo lo necesario para trabajar y obtener buena cosecha previniendola de cualquier plaga y preparandose para ofrecer a su clientela la produccion.
El objetivo de Adrián es crecer y ampliar el cultivo, obtener buenas cosechas y garantizar de esta manera la alimentacion a su familia.
texts.en:
Adrián lives with his wife and two children.  He’s a farmer and raises livestock.  The business arose thanks to his father who has always been in the same line of work.  He does not have a fixed schedule to do the chores that farming demands.

At present, he’s requesting a loan to buy farming supplies like manure and pesticide.  Their purchase will allow him to have everything needed to work and obtain a good harvest on hand keeping the crop safe from infestations and preparing himself to offer the production to his customers.

Adrián’s objective is to grow and expand his crops, to obtain good harvests and thus guarantee food for his family.

loans.use: to buy manure and pesticide.

loans.name: Olimchon

texts.ru:
Олимчон честный, добросовестный и трудолюбивый муж. У него 2 детей и он хочет вырасти их в хороших условиях жизни. Он очень старается, чтобы его дети учились в хороших школах города. Он занимается услугами таксиста более 4 года. Олимчон хочет расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свой прибыль. Ему необходимо отремонтировать свою автомашину, с этой целью Олимчон запрашивает займ в размере 1000$ США. Он хочет заранее благодарит Кива и Кива кредиторы за поддержку и милосердие. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Olimchon is an honest, conscientious and hard-working husband.  He has two children, and he wants to raise them in good conditions.  He tried hard to make sure that his children attend good schools in the city.  He is involved in providing taxi service for over four years.  Olimchon wants to expand his business and maximize his profits.  He needs to repair his car, and this is why Olimchon is requesting a loan in the sum of $1000.  He wants to thank Kiva and Kiva creditors in advance for the support and mercy.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo is 42 years old and blessed with two children. Her spouse works as a local farmer. 

Amparo raises hogs. She usually sell them to butchers who come to their village. She earns about PHP 3,500 for each pig she is able to dispose. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy feed, vitamins and medicines for her hogs to ensure good nutrition. A hog that has had good nutrition can be offered at a higher cost when it's ready for disposal. 

In the future, she would like to strengthen her pig selling business and earn enough money for house repair.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and medicines for her hogs.

loans.name: Thom

texts.en:
Thom is 56 years old and single. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City.

For nearly 20 years, Thom has run a small street-side restaurant selling meals and soups in the local community. 

Thom now intends to get a loan to repair her street-side restaurant and purchase a greater quantity and variety of food to attract more customers. She hopes that the loan will increase her income and enable her to improve her well-being.

loans.use: To repair her restaurant and purchase more food for selling.

loans.name: Rouguietou

texts.fr: Commerçante, elle vend des sacs, des chaussures et des tissus dans une marchée locale située a proximée d'une ville qui est qui est proche de la capitale du Sénegal. Elle s'active dans ce domaine depuis plus de 5 ans ou elle a une expérience avérée. Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son fonds de roulement et d'acheter des marchandises pour la revente. Ce prêt lui servira aussi d'augmenter son stock de marchandises afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui s'accroit de plus en plus durant les vacances. Elle veut aussi faire du profits pour ouvrir un magazin destiné a la vente des produits de bébés.
texts.en: Rouguietou is an experienced trader who has been selling bags, shoes and fabrics in the local market of a town near Dakar for over 5 years. This loan will increase her working capital and enable her to restock her merchandise. This will allow her to meet a growing customer demand, which is especially high during the holidays. She would like to make a decent profit from her business so that she can eventually open a shop selling baby products.

loans.use: to restock on her merchandise.

loans.name: Mehmooda's Group

texts.en:
Mehmooda works very hard along with her husband to put 3 meals on the table for her family. She is a seamstress and sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very skilled in her profession and prepares beautiful looking clothes. She is the mother of 7 children. Her 3 elder children left their education after 8th grade while others are enrolled in a local school and continuing their education. 

Her husband operates a Punjabi food restaurant. The taste of his food is very good and he has a good number of customers who come to his restaurant on a daily basis for lunch and dinner. 

Mehmooda has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy some furniture to provide better seating facilities for his clients and food making ingredients like spices, cooking oil, flour, etc. in bulk quantity. 

Mehmooda is very hopeful that an investment will help her husband in expanding his business and earning more profits.

loans.use: To buy furniture and food making ingredients for restaurant business.

loans.name: Delila

texts.es: Delila de 28 años, convive con santos de 48 años, con quien tiene 02 hermosos hijos. Juntos habitan en el distrito de Sivia, donde tienen su propia casa. El negocio al que se dedica es la venta de abarrotes, para ello cuenta con una tienda en donde expende sus productos, siendo el má concurrido de su localidad. A pesar de que Delila no tuvo estudios, ella sabe que su mejor arma es su paciencia y la cordialidad que presta a sus clientes, además los precios que ofrece está al alcance de la economía de ellos. Generalmente trabaja por cuenta propia, pero hay veces que cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo e hijos, que son quienes lo animan ha continuar con su trabajo. Lo único que la aqueja es la competencia, por ello debe buscar la mejor manera de mantener a la clientela. En un futuro próximo desea implementar mejor su tienda con productos novedosos. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Ella esta contenta con su banco comunal, por que son buenos emprendedores. Con los 1.500 soles que solicita, comprará nuevos productos para implementar su tienda.
texts.en:
Delila, 28, lives with Santos, 48, with whom she has two beautiful children.  They live together in the district of Sivia, where they have their own house.

Her work is selling groceries, for which she has a store where she sells her products, it being the most popular in the town.  Despite not having an education, Delila knows that her best weapon is her patience and the cordiality she shows her customers.  In addition, the prices she offers are within the reach of their budgets.

Generally she works on her own, but sometimes she has the help of her husband and children, which encourages her to continue with her work.  The only thing that bothers her is competition.  This is why she needs to look for the best way to keep her customers.

In the near future she wants to set up her store better with innovative products.  This will be her first loan with MFP, and she is committed to being punctual with her payments.

She is happy with her communal bank because they are good entrepreneurs.

With the loan of 1,500 PEN that she is requesting, she will buy new products to set up her store.

loans.use: to buy products to set up her store.

loans.name: Nayef

texts.en:
Nayef is a 33-year-old man who got married a few months ago. He lives in A. Mafraq.

Nayef opened his own clothes store five years ago and expanded it through the years to become what it is now. He sells casuA. and formA. men's clothes. Now he has applied for a loan to bring in more products to the store, mainly the winter collection since we are now knocking on winter’s door. With the loan, he will be prepared for the upcoming Eid (Muslin pilgrimage) and holiday seasons.

loans.use: To purchase more products for his clothing store

loans.name: Santos Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Santos Margarita  es casada, tiene 53 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educación primaria, se dedica a comercio, a la venta de ropa típica para damas, inició este negocio gracias al apoyo de una de sus amistades, y hasta el momento lleva 3 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería consistente en en cortes, suéteres, güipíles, fajas, etc. Espera en el futuro ver su negocio prospero.
texts.en:
Santos Margarita is married, is 53 years old, and she finished the 6 years of primary school. She works in sales of traditional clothing for women. She started this business thanks to the support of one of her friends. She has 3 years of experience. 

She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise that consists of skirts, sweaters, embroidered blouses, cloth belts, etc. She expects to see her business prosper in the future.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing merchandise

loans.name: Baktykan

texts.ru: Бактыкан  - 38 лет, вместе с мужем  воспитывает троих детей. В поисках источника финансирования, в 2002 году  Бактыкан начала свой бизнес в перепродаже фруктов и овощей на местном базаре.  Стартовав с суммой в 5,000 сом (KGS), Бактыкан приложила все усилия для развития торговли и на сегодняшний день получает прибыль в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц.  Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бактыкан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на расширение ассортимента товаров.  Доходы она планирует вложить в  расширение торгового места.
texts.en: Baktykan is 38 years old, and, together with her husband, she is raising three children.  In search of financial help, Baktykan started her own business of reselling fruits and vegetables at the local market in 2002.  Having started with an initial sum of 5,000 som (KGS), she put all of her efforts toward developing the sales and earns a monthly profit of 15,000 som (KGS) today.  In order to further grow her business, Baktykan requested a loan in the sum of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to expand her product selection.  She plans to invest the earnings into expanding her retail space.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of products

loans.name: Auscencio

texts.es:
Auscencio tiene 49 años de edad el estudio hasta el tercer año de primaria ya que sus papas no le pudieron seguir apoyando ya que eran mas hermanos y no tenían los recursos suficientes para comprarle los útiles escolares, don Auscencio se dedica al cultivo y venta de aguacate desde hace 12 años, el esta pidiendo su crédito a la Financiera para invertir en su huerto, ya que tiene  planeado comprar otras plantas de aguacate y fertilizante orgánico para nutrir el suelo y no dañar la tierra. Dice que cuando es temporada de cosecha sale a vender el fruto a una central de abastos que se encuentra cerca de su localidad y tambien vende en diferentes poblaciones ya que tiene clientes que el le surte de fruto. Platica que vende por cubeta los aguacates por que dice que así le saca mas ganancia. 

Don Auscencio esta casado con la señora Petra ella se dedica hacer servilletas bordadas y tienen 3 hijos de nombres Sandra de 17 años la cual estudia la secundaria, Guadalupe de 6 años la cual desgraciadamente que al nacer le lastimaron la cadera y tiene que pagar terapias para que la niña pueda caminar y Alejandra de 3 años. La meta que tiene para su huerto es sembrar mas plantas y darles cuidado para obtener así un mejor fruto, también cuidarlo que las arañas no se coman la flor, y meterle un buen fertilizante y un buen insecticida. El esta muy contento y agradecido con las personas que hacen posible los créditos por que sus negocios crecen y puede el darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Auscencio is 49 years old and only attended three years of primary school.  His parents could not continue supporting him as he had other siblings and they could not afford to pay the school tuition.  Auscencio has been cultivating and selling avocados for 12 years.  He is requesting the loan from Financiera to invest in his orchard as he plans to purchase more avocado plants and organic fertilizers to nourish the ground while protecting the soil.  He says that when harvest time comes, he sells his fruit to a supply center near his town and also sells his fruit in various towns since he has customers whom he provides with fruit. He says that he sells the avocados by the bucket because it is more profitable.  

Auscencio is married to Petra who makes embroidered napkins and they have three children. Sandra is 17 years old and attends secondary school, Guadalupe is 6 years, and Alejandra is 3 years old. Unfortunately, Guadalupe hurt her hip at birth and he has to pay for therapy so that the child can walk. His goal is to plant more plants in his orchard. He hopes to obtain better fruit by caring for them and applying good fertilizer as well as good insecticide to ensure that the spiders don’t eat the flowers.  He is very happy and is grateful to the people who make the loans possible because his business is growing and he is able to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to cultivate and sell avocados.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 20,000 to renovate her house.  With the loan, she wants to purchase sand, cement and colorful paint to renovate her house. 

She dreams of expand her business to meet her customer's demands.  In the future she hopes to earn more profit.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and color paints to renovate the house.

loans.name: Rer

texts.en: Rer, age 28, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband is a taxi driver who drives tourists to tourism sites. Rer is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to drive to work. In the future, she would like to run a food store, build a new house and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to drive to work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bags of cashew seeds.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is married and has two children.  She is 44 years old and resides at Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Lilian owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting bananas for sale.  She has been in this business for ten years.  Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work.  She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. 

In 2008, Lilian joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation.  In the future, Lilian wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Djekadi Group

texts.fr:
Djekadi est un regroupement de femmes de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans, sont  mariées et ont  en moyenne 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels les vêtements,  les chaussures,  le bois de chauffe, les produits cosmétiques, etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. 
Bébé  est un membre du groupe Djekadi qui vend les vêtements de toutes sortes et des chaussures. Elle est assise à  l’extrême bout en face de ses marchandises. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, deux colis de vêtements et 1 colis de chaussures.  Elle se procure  de ses  produits au marché de Koutiala et à Bamako. Elle vend ses articles en détail et au comptant à une clientèle diverse et variée. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Djekadi comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 77.500FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Bébé compte réaliser 87.500FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnel et augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
Djekadi is a group of women from Koutiala who know each other well. They all live in large, traditional families with their husbands, children, and relatives. They are 33 years old on average, are married, and have an average of four children. 

This group of women sells various items such as clothes, shoes, firewood, cosmetics, etc. To increase the size of their businesses, the group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. 

Bébé is a member of Djekadi who sells all kinds of clothing and shoes. In the photo, she is seated on the far end next to her merchandise. She plans to use her loan to buy two packages of clothing and one package of shoes. She obtains her products at the Koutialia and Bamako markets, and sells them on a retail basis for cash to a diverse and varied clientele.  

While the other members of Djekadi expect to make an average profit of 77,500 francs CFA each during this loan cycle, Bébé expects to make 87,500 francs CFA. 

In addition to loan repayment, they use a portion of their income for personal expenses and to grow their businesses.

loans.use: to buy sundry items for resale

loans.name: Mame Abdou Aziz Sy Group

texts.fr: Le groupe de crédit qui porte le nom d'un grand marabout décédé: Mame Abdou Aziz Sy, est un groupe de cinq personnes qui regroupe aussi bien des commerçants que des éleveurs. La présidente, la dame Maimouna Bouna, âgée de 32 ans, fait de l’élevage depuis cinq ans maintenant. Elle en est à son 1èr crédit et désire acheter des poussins pour faire de l’élevage. Elles n’a pas de charges. Avec le crédit, elle pourra diversifier ses produits et services. Maimouna travaille pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: The credit group which bears the name of a great deceased marabout: Mame Abdou Aziz Sy, is a group of five people which regroups shopkeepers as well as breeders. The president, the woman Maimouna Bouna, 32 years old, has been breeding for five years now. She is on her first loan and wants to buy chicks to breed. She has no dependents. With the loan, she will be able to diversify her products and services. Maimouna works to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy chicks to breed and resell.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Ama est une femme mariée âgée de 47 ans résidante à Adidogomé. Avec deux enfants à charge, Ama est une revendeuse des tubercules d’ignames qu’elle s’approvisionne six fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile et en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Ama désire ce prêt pour commander des calebasses de tubercules d’ignames. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera suite à une bonne revente, Ama compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et celui de ses enfants puis à leur épanouissement.

loans.use: Acheter 02 calebasses d'ignames.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
Elmira was born in Salyan region Khaladj village. She is married, has 3 children. She is cattle-breeder. 
You can see in the picture woman, who likes cattles. She enjoys looking after the calves.
This 58-year-old woman likes this calf more than other calves.
Having borrowed a loan of $400, she bought 10 pedigree lambs. Then she decided to borrow a loan of $600 to buy 3 pedigree calves. 
Now she needs a loan of $1000 to buy 4 pedigree calves.
She has been engaged in this business for 12 years.

loans.use: To buy 4 pedigree calves

loans.name: Lonaix

texts.en:
Lonaix T. is the mother of three young children in a small community outside Trou-du-Nord, one of Haiti´s largest cities in the northeastern part of the country. Her business is selling household items in town. This loan will provide Lonaix with money to purchase supplies such as craft accessories, baskets, flowers, etc. She runs a successful business with the limited amount of materials she currently has, but needs this loan to support her children to provide them with basic necessities that are hard to come by in their semi-rural hometown.

NOTE: Lonaix T. and nine other micro-entrepreneurs are part of the Les Solidaires group - part of a Bank of Hope designed by Esperanza to create a social network and accountability system. Lonaix and every other member in her group will receive an equal share of this $1,200 loan to develop their own businesses to support their families. They also provide ongoing advice for each other and help one another make payments on their loans. This group-lending method has proven to be a highly effective way to ensure loan repayment and community support.

loans.use: Purchase craft accessories, baskets and garment material

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Jorge has four years experience in his business of selling sandals as a traveling salesman. Since he was very small, 12 years old, he decided to become more independent of his family. He began to work only to support himself. He recieved the help of a friend, who loaned him the money in order for him to start working. He has had good success. He works every day of the week from 8am until 3pm.

Jorge wishes to invest the loan in the purchase of merchandise on wholesale. With this purchase he can make higher earnings. He hopes to make enough money to begin to travel to other areas to sell his products.

Jorge is separated. He is 57 years old and has one son who is 9, who goes to school. His son spends his mornings with his grandmother and his afternoons with Jorge, doing his homework. His wish is to give his son a better education. He also has a room to rent and wishes to make repairs in it so that the people who rent it can live without inconveniences.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Jorge tiene una experiencia de 4 años con su negocio de venta de sandalias de manera ambulante. Desde muy pequeño a la edad de 12 años decide independizarse de su familia. Comienza a trabajar solo para mantenerse. Recibe la ayuda de un amigo el cual le presta dinero para que tenga capital de trabajo. Le ha ido muy bien. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 8 a.m. hasta las 3 p.m.

Jorge desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de mercadería al por mayor. Con lo que obtendría mayor ganancia. Espera poder tener mayor capital para comenzar a viajar a otras partes para vender sus productos

Jorge es separado. Tiene 57 años y un hijo de 9. El cual estudia. Por las mañanas pasa con su abuela. Por las tardes Jorge se encarga de enseñarles las tareas. Su deseo es poder darle una buena educación a su hijo. Y también el posee un cuarto de arriendo y desea arreglarlo para que las personas que se lo alquilan vivan sin inconvenientes.

loans.use: Buy his products wholesale

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Born in 1957, Alice N. is married and is a mother of five children. Her ill health caused her husband to sell some of their valuable properties and even exhausted all their money on medications. After that there was need for capital to start off a business that would be able to sustain the family. She then sought the help of GHAPE, became a member in 2002, and was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline. Since then, she has successfully invested, managed and repaid loans of about $600 with which she raised money to pay apprentice fees for her children, buy medications and pay school fees.

Given a loan of $800, she plans to sell fish, egusi and cultivate vegetables. Egusi is a rich source of protein and oil and is used as a thickener of soups and to make pudding. With the profit, she plans to increase her business and continue to pay school fees for her children.

She will repay the loan in 24 months and the first installment of repayment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase fish, egusi, vegetable seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more spare parts to repair broken electronics and resell them.

loans.name: Brígida

texts.es:
12 years ago Brígida and Eleuterio, natives of Cojata, decided to come together and form their own family. As a result of their love for each other, their two children were born. With their children they parted from the land where they were born, seeking a better future. Now they live in the city of Juliaca, the place where Eleuterio offers his services to the general population as a bicycle taxi driver, his only form of work. With this job he physically exerts himself in order to sustain his family. Meanwhile Brígida dedicates herself to the sale of dress garments, a business that she has been learning little by little. Now she has accumulated the experience and desires to expand and increase the quantity of her merchandise. It is for this reason that she asks for a loan that she will invest in her garment business. At this time this hard working and enthusiastic couple awaits your quick and generous response.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer.

Hace 12 años Brígida y Eleuterio naturales de la comunidad de Cojata, decidieron unirse y formar su familia, fruto de su amor nacieron dos niños y con ellos en brazos partieron de la tierra que los vió nacer, en busca de un mejor porvenir.Actualmente radican en la ciudad de Juliaca, lugar en el que Eleuterio, ofrece servicio de movilidad a la población en su única herramienta de trabajo, su triciclo, para obtener a base de mucho esfuerzo físico el sustento familiar; en tanto Brígida se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, negocio que poco a poco fue aprendiendo y que ahora con la experiencia ya adquirida desea ampliar e incrementar la cantidad de su mercadería. Es por esa razón que solicita un préstamo de dinero que invertirá en su negocio de ventas prendas de vestir.Esta emprendedora y entusiasta pareja en estos momentos espera tu pronta y favorable respuesta.

loans.use: The purchase of a greater quantity and variety of garments to offer to the general public

loans.name: Savun's Group

texts.en:
These two families live in a small village along the Mekong River about twenty kilometers north of Phnom Penh. They are requesting this, their first group loan from Maxima, to buy two small diesel-powered water pumps for irrigation.

Mrs. C. Savun (age 48 – right in photo) and her husband (age 44) have been married since 1978. They have ten children, five of whom still live at home. Of those, three still study in school. As a child, she attended school for only three years and, like many Khmers (Cambodians), she focused her life on working to survive. Savun has been weaving grass mats since she was a young girl. She and her family also grow some of the grasses and straw they use for weaving.

Mrs. S. Sakhorn (age 55) and her husband (age 60) have been married since 1970. They had eleven children but two died. Six still live at home with their parents and only the youngest boy remains in school. Like Savun, Sakhorn has been weaving since she was young. Neither Sakhorn nor her husband ever attended school.

Both weavers also buy some weaving materials such as reeds from villages across the nearby Mekong River. They sell everything they produce to people in their and nearby villages. A mat, typically used as a sleeping pad, will last for two to four years and costs about (US) $9.00.

loans.use: To buy diesel irrigation pumps for growing grass and straw

loans.name: Kireku F Group

texts.en:
Racheal is 28 years old and divorced with five cildren. She has a canteen busines. She wants to construct her own business premises with the extra business profits. Shamim has a brick-laying business while Josephine sells raw food in the market.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
In the district of Cupi some 40 kilometers from the city of Ayaviri, we find Andrea’s restaurant, one of the most frequented dining establishments in this humble town. This restaurant has been in business for a year, and in that short time, it has managed to gain popularity thanks to the delicious stews that Andrea prepares in her wood-fired oven, which gives her dishes a special flavor. Andrea and her husband Eduardo, who works as an electrician, are trying to save enough money so that they can buy a small plot of land and construct their house. They plan to offer this dwelling to their children, and fill this sweet space with love and joy. In order to crystallize their wishes, she is requesting a loan that she plans to invest in the purchase of cooking utensils and in the expansion of her small restaurant. Your generous support will allow for the attainment of this charming couple’s dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

En el distrito de Cupi a 40 Km de la ciudad de Ayaviri encontramos el restaurante de doña Andrea, uno de los más concurridos establecimientos de comida que existe en este humilde pueblito, este restaurante ya tiene un año de funcionamiento y en este corto tiempo logró obtener gran popularidad gracias a los deliciosos potajes que prepara doña Andrea en su fogoncito de leña que le da un especial sabor a cada una de sus comidas.Andrea y su esposo Eduardo quien trabaja como electricista tratan de ahorrar los suficiente para comprar un terrenito y construir su casita, morada que desean ofrecer a los hijos que tienen planeado tener para llenar de amor y alegría su dulce espacio.Para cristalizar sus deseos hace la solicitud de un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de utensilios de cocina y para ampliar su pequeño restaurante.Vuestro generoso aporte permitirá cristalizar los deseos de esta encantadora pareja.

loans.use: Purchase of cooking utensils and expansion of restaurant

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora R. M. runs a business making top quality furniture in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali. She has the help of all of her family. She loves designing custom pieces and giving her customers exactly what they want. Nora is 47 years old, happily married, and has 4 children. She is a busy, hard working woman and a leader in her community. She is happy she can send all of her children to university and proud of all of her accomplishments.

A member of the community bank Genesis, Nora is requesting a loan of s/1200 to repay over 6 months. Nora will use the loan to buy more high quality wood such as Peruvian Cedar.

loans.use: To buy high quality wood

loans.name: Kimsoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Kimsoeun S. and her husband were married in 2000 and have four children, two sons and two daughters. The family lives on an Island on Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Kimsoeun has been a silk weaver for eight years. It’s skill she learned from her husband. She sells her finished products to a middleman in her village, who sells them in Phnom Penh. For the past four years, her husband has made a living raising pigs.

Mrs. Kimsoeun is requesting a loan $1,000 to buy silk for weaving and to repair her house.

loans.use: To buy silk for weaving and to repair her house.

loans.name: Faranisisi

texts.en:
Faranisisi N., 38, is married with 5 children. She has 4 years of experience in the barbeque business. She sells to the general public 5 days per week. Her husband is a taxi driver.

Faranisisi has had 4 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to now be 350 Tala (about $US145). SPBD loans are Faranisisi’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase iron roofing, timber, and nails to build a shelter for her business.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. H. Thi Nguyen, 35 years old, and her husband, Ngoc Van Truong, own and run a general store. They carry a large variety of goods in their store; the customers are primarily people in and around the town. Mrs. Nguyen is a clever, hardworking, and business-minded woman, so the retail business is a good fit for her talents. She is frequently able to predict the market’s demands in each time period, so the task of investing in certain goods is constant changing. Participating in the Fund has expanded these investments, which fulfilled the family’s goals. She has 2 children who are still in school. In this round of funding the family is requesting 9,000,000 VND to buy more stock. Their monthly income is 4,000,000 VND on average.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Huyền 35 tuổi cùng chồng anh Trương văn Ngọc, gia đình anh chị có cửa hàng bán tạp hóa, các mặt hàng của gia đình anh chị rất phong phú, khách hàng của gia đình anh chị chủ yếu là các xã vùng lân cận và người dân quanh vùng, với bản chất là người phụ nữ nhanh nhẹn, năng động, biết tính toán nên việc kinh doanh hàng tạp hóa là rất phù hợp với khả năng của chị, chị thường năm bắt được nhu cầu thị trường vào từng thời điểm, nên việc đâu tư vào một số mặt hàng cũng luôn thay đổi, tham gia vào Quỹ vay vốn mở rộng các mặt hàng đó chính là nguyện vọng của gia đình chị, chi có 2 con đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000đ để mua hàng. Thu nhập bình quân 4.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Buy more stock

loans.name: Alimamy B.'s Group

texts.en:
This group consists of: (from right to left): Alimamy B. K., Sinneh C., Alie K. and George H..

Alimamy was born in Makeni. He is now 38, married with 4 children. Alimamy is currently engaged in building a house, and will use his loan to complete the building process. Though he is an army officer, his monthly salary cannot buy him the materials he needs.

Sinneh, will use the loan to help him increase his current business. He skilfully combines his military work with petty-trading within the barracks. Sinneh is married with 2 children. He is 38 and was born in 4 Mile.
