Alie was born in Mile 91. He is 34, married with 3 children. He will give his loan to his wife who sells a variety of items like pastes, bars of soap, cigarettes, matches etc. This will help her expand her business.

George H., 34, will use his loan to develop his farm. 

These soldiers are requesting a loan of Le 3,500,000.00 in total. The loan will be repaid out of their monthly military salaries.

loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Mrs Felipa has works making and selling tortillas for the last 15 years. During that time she has also installed a mill, and has rented out a room in her home. Mrs Felipa would like to build her room rental business, which is why she has decided to invest in purchasing beams and galvanized metal sheets to renew the roof of the rooms. Mrs Felipa is married, and her husband works as a security guard. They have an 18 year old son who is preparing to attend the university. For this reason Mrs Felipa needs to seek out new sources of income that will allow her to support her son in his university studies.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Felipa desde hace 15 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas. Con el tiempo también puso un molino, y empezó a alquilar una habitación en su vivienda. Doña Felipa desea fortalecerse en el negocio de los alquileres de cuarto, es por eso que desea invertir en ellos, el uso del préstamo será para la compra de perlines y zinc para cambiarles el techo a las habitaciones. Doña Felipa es casada, su esposo es guarda de seguridad, tiene un hijo de 18 años de edad, quien ahora se prepara para entrar a la universidad, es por eso que Doña Felipa tiene que buscar nuevas fuentes de ingresos que le permitan apoyar a su hijo en los estudios universitarios

loans.use: Purchase of beams and galvanized metal sheets to re-roof rental rooms.

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es:
La Sra. Maricela está solicitando un préstamo para la elaboración de la barda y un portón a la casa ya que no está segura.

Maricela trabaja en una fábrica en el aria de elaboración de artículos de electrónica (Sonidos, televisiones, computadoras y etcétera) esté es su ingreso ella vive solo su familia está en Veracruz.

Es por eso que la Sra. Maricela solicito un préstamo de $850.00 dlls. Para comprar el materia para la elaboración de la barda y colocación de un portón y así su casa esté mas segura cunado ella este trabajando.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maricela is asking for a loan to build a fence and gate around her house, because at the moment it is not secure. Maricela works in a factory that makes electronics (music players, televisions, computers, etc.). Maricela lives alone, and her family is in Veracruz. Maricela is asking for a loan of $850 Diz to buy the materials to complete the fence and gate, so that her house will be secure while she is at work.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and installation of a fence and gate

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen de 49 años es madre de 6 hijos, de los cuales 3 de ellos ya se independizaron, quedando los 3 menores que están en el colegio.  Desde hace varios años, se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano, diariamente le pide a Dios que sus hijos sean felices y sobre todo, hombres de bien. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo Francisco quien trabaja como maestro albañil.  Carmen tiene un propósito, que es poner su tienda de ropa de primera, sobre todo de buena calidad, ya que cuenta con una gran gama de clientes dentro y fuera de su zona, para ello le es necesario un capital para cumplir su objetivo. Con tu ayuda harás posible que se cumpla en muy corto tiempo el objetivo de Carmen.
texts.en:
Carmen is 49 years old and a mother of 6 children of whom three are school-aged and still live at home and three are already living independently. For a few years, Carmen has worked selling used clothes and prays daily that God will make sure that her children are happy, and above all, good people. Carmen counts on the support of her husband Francisco who works as a master carpenter. Carmen's goal is to stock her store with high quality products since she already has a large base of clients that know her (both within and outside of her city) and it is for this reason that she needs more capital. Your help will allow Carmen to meet her goals in a very short time.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kahn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of higher quality clothing for sale in a small store.

loans.name: Badenya (Fraternité) Group

texts.fr:
Les 9 membres (5 mariées, 3 célibataires et une veuve) du groupe Badenya ont en moyenne 29 ans, 2 enfants et vivent à majorité dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier Bamanan kin de Kirango Markala de la préfecture de Ségou(quatrième région économique du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de cousinage dans le quartier et font toutes la même activité à savoir l’achat et la vente de pagnes wax (tissus très prisés en Afrique), fancy et de la friperie. En plus de vêtement elles font de temps à autre la vente du bois de chauffe.
Dans le souci d’augmenter la taille de leur commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel elles son troisième cycle après avoir correctement remboursés les deux précédents prêts.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 40 pièces de pagnes wax et fancy et 5 colis de friperie communément appelé «YOUGOU YOUGOU ». Elles s’approvisionnent en pagnes et en vêtements à Bamako (capitale du Mali) et à Ségou auprès des grossistes. Les produits sont vendus dans la foire hebdomadaire de Diamarabougou Markala et au marché journalier de Kirango Markala à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant à crédit et en détail.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen et mensuel de 30.000FCFAqui sera utilisé pour acheter les fournitures scolaires des enfants.
texts.en:
The nine members (five married, three single, and one widow) of the Badenya group are on average 29 years old, have two children, and live mostly in traditional extended families in the Bamanan kin neighborhood of Kirango Markala of Ségou prefecture (the fourth economic region of Mali). The women know each other through family and neighborhood connections and are involved in the same business activity, selling fancy pagnes wax (colorful textiles used to make clothes that are very sought after in Africa), as well as second-hand clothes. In addition to clothing, they also sometimes sell firewood. In hopes of increasing the size of their business, the group members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and they are now on their third loan cycle after having properly repaid the two previous loans. The women plan to use this loan to buy 40 bolts of fancy pagne wax fabric and five parcels of second-hand clothing, commonly known as "Yougou Yougou." They will buy their stock of fabric and clothing in Bamako (the capital of Mali) and Ségou from wholesalers. Their products are sold in the weekly market at Diamarabougou Markala and the daily market at Kirango Markala to a clientele made up of men and women buying on cash, credit, and retail. The women each plan to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA which will be used to buy school supplies for their children.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of textiles and second-hand clothing

loans.name: Ruslana

texts.en:
Ruslana is married and has one daughter. She owns a kiosk at the central market in Ivano-Frankivsk city. She sells  clothing for babies and children.  

Ruslana has been in this business for 10 years. She started her business after her daughter was born and the family needed more money. First, she worked for someone else selling clothing, but then her friend suggested that she start working for herself. Being a hard-working and determined person Ruslana has made this business a success. Now she plans to increase her business and open a second kiosk. This business is the only source of income for the family.

Rusland would like to get a loan for $875 to purchase children jackets, hats and other clothing. The additional inventory will help her to increase the variety of goods and serve to her clients even better. The income she earns would help her to pay for her daughter's school and fix up their house so they can have better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase children's jackets, hats and other clothing for sale

loans.name: Zulema Genoveva

texts.es:
La señora Zulema es socia del Banco Comunal “Wiñay” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. 
Con su primer préstamo de S/. 300 compró ropa y productos de belleza para venderlos en su domicilio. Tiene casi 5 años trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que aumentó sus ganancias desde que empezó con su negocio. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,600, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará más ropa y productos de belleza para venderlos en su casa. 
Zulema desea continuar trabajando para apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Zulema is a member if the communal bank “Wiñay”, located in the district, province and region of Puno. She is 46 years old, and married with three children. With her first loan for 300 Peruvian soles Zulema bought clothing and beauty products in order to sell them from her home. She has been working with the communal bank for 5 years and reports that she has increased her earnings since she started her business. With this loan for 1,600 Peruvian soles, which will be repayed in 4 installments, Zulema will buy more clothing and beauty products to sell from her home. Zulema's wish is to continuing working to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing and beauty products

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
El señor Domingo R. R. es casado, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos, ellos tienen 8 años de vivir en su hogar, el señor Domingo R. trabaja como chofer transfer desde hace 3 años, siendo este trabajo su principal fuente de ingresos los cuales son de utilidad para mantener a su familia.   
El señor Domingo R. está solicitando un préstamo para poner vitropiso en su casa, para que de esta manera su hogar esté en buenas condiciones para que él y su familia puedan vivir cómodamente.
texts.en:
Domingo R. R. is married and he lives with his wife and two children. They have been living in their current home for the past 8 years. Domingo R. has been working as a transport driver for the past 3 years, this being the primary source of income to support his family.

Domingo R. is requesting a loan to install a tile floor in his home, so that in this way they will be able to have a home that is in good condition and that they may live comfortably.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install tile flooring.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La señora Graciela es socia del Banco Comunal “03 de Mayo”, en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 53 años de edad, de estado civil divorciada, tiene 02 hijos y posee estudios de cuarto de primaria (incompleta). 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 03 años; ella se dedica a la artesanía en bayeta (bordados); su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual adquirió materiales para su negocio (lana y bayeta) 
Con este  préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que esta comprometida a pagar en 5 cuotas mensuales; podrá adquirir materiales para su negocio (bayeta y lana), lo que le servirá para hacer mas tejidos y poder venderlos en los lugares turísticos de Puno e Ilave. Su anhelo es ver a sus hijos profesionales, por ello viene invirtiendo en su educación.
texts.en:
Graciela is an associate of the Banco Comunal “03 de Mayo” (the 3rd of may,” in the key district, Provincia de El Collao, in the state of Puno. She is 53 years old, divorced, and has 2 children. She is educated until the fourth grade of primary school. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for three years. Graciela is works as an embroidery artisan. Her first loan was of 300 new soles, which she used to acquire materials for her business, cloth and wool. With this loan of 500 new soles, which is set up to be paid in 5 monthly quotas, she will be able to acquire more wool and cloth for her business, which will serve to make more fabrics, and enable her to sell them in tourist locations of Puno and the district. Her longing is to see her children become professionals, and so she continues to invest in their education.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To acquire supplies for her business (cloth and wool) so that she may sell in tourist areas of Puno.

loans.name: Akouvi Delali

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier d’adidogomé , elle a pour activité le commerce de charbons de bois en gros et en detail, actuellement son stock est presque fini c’est pour ça qu’elle demande un crédit pour s’approvisionner par l’achat des sacs de charbons de bois. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman lives in the Adidogomé neighborhood, and her business consists in wholesaling and retailing charcoal. At this time, she's almost out of stock, this is why she's seeking a loan in order to purchase sacks of charcoal. She's married and the mother of 4 children.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena tiene 57 años, es soltera vive con sus 6 hijos; Yobana de 34, Franco de 32, Pilar de 28, Ivan de 26, Luis de 24 y Blanca de 21 años en su casa propia. Se dedica a vender productos de belleza, y gracias a su buen trabajo la nombraron jefa de zona, del lugar en el que vive, ahora debe fomentar las ventas de sus demás compañeras, visitándolas constantemente. Además, vender sus propios productos, terminando muy cansada al final de día, pero aún así es muy feliz con su trabajo, ya que como ella misma dice, si dejara de trabajar se enfermaría. Es por eso que quiere crecer y ser cada vez mejor en lo que hace, felizmente las ventas son buenas y eso le recuerda cuando comenzó vendiéndo sus productos a sus hijos y ahora tiene muchos pedidos de sus amigas. Elena quiere seguir progresando y espera seguir escalando en su trabajo, pero también sabe que para ello hace falta mucha dedicación y más trabajo, por ello quiere volver a incursionar en el negocio de venta de ropa que realizó hace muchos años atrás y lo cual le de mayores ingresos. Ella ha tenido varios préstamos con Microfinanzas Prisma, gustándole mucho su banco comunal porque todas son buenas amigas y son puntuales en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más productos de belleza y además ropa para vender.
texts.en:
57-year old Elena is a single mother with six children: Yobana aged 34, Franco aged 32, Pilar aged 28, Ivan aged 26, Luis aged 24, and Blanca aged 21. They live together in their own house. She earns her living by selling beauty products, and because of her dedication she has been named area supervisor in the community where she lives. Now she has the job of encouraging her colleagues to increase their sales by visiting them regularly. All this in addition to her own sales leaves her very tired by the end of the day. However, she is still very happy doing this work—as she herself says, if she stopped working she would become ill. It is for this reason she wants to expand the business and continue improving in what she does. Fortunately business is good, and that makes her remember what it was like when she started out…selling products to her children. Now she gets many orders from her friends. Elena wants to continue this progress and get further promotions, but she also knows that it will take a lot of dedication and more work. So she wants to get back into the business of selling clothes which she used to do many years ago and which gave her a better income. She has had several loans with Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma, and really likes the community bank because the members are good friends and punctual in their repayments. With the loan she will buy more beauty products and also clothes to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Kwabena

texts.en: Kwabena O. is forty years old. He is married and has five kids. He lives with his family in their own house at Oda, a farming community in eastern Ghana, where most of the inhabitants are farmers. Kwabena has been a photographer for the past nine years. Photography has been his major occupation and the main source of income for his family. He owns a photography shop where his clients pose for their photographs. He also works at parties and concerts, where he takes photographs and videos of his clients. He would use the loan to buy tools and materials--a camera, flash bulbs, film, a video camera, etc--to expand the services he offers. Expanded services would generate more income and improve his family's standard of living. He is a member of the “Mawuli” Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each other's loans and provide support and assistance in handling their repayment.

loans.use: To buy a camera, film, flash bulbs, and a video camera

loans.name: Kudirat

texts.en: Kudirat, 35 years old and married with four children, is a tailor who makes lovely designs for her customers.  She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sew more clothes for her customers. Kudirat thanks Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials.

loans.name: Huor's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is being requested by three borrowers, all of whom live in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. The group leader, Mrs. C. T., age 43, makes a living selling all kinds of groceries from home. She sells items like cooked ingredients, soft drinks, sweet cakes, and canned foods. She is able to earn income of $5 a day in order to provide for her entire family's living expenses. A source of additional revenue comes from her husband who is a military policeman. The couple now has five single children, all of whom are school age. Recently, C. T. sold all her items to her villagers and so she has applied for a loan from Kiva in order to purchase many kinds of grocery inventory to sell. The other two borrowers who have jointed the loan are:
Mrs. D. is a fritter seller, who is requesting a loan to buy necessary ingredients in order to make cake to sell. 
Mrs. Y. is a widow, who sells different kinds of soft drinks and is applying for a loan to accrue a greater quantity of drinks to sell.

loans.use: To purchase many kinds of grocery inventory to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing maize

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia tiene 59 años, está a cargo de su hija y de su nieta a quienes trata de brindarles las mejores condiciones de vida. Hace varios años trabajó en diversas actividades siendo la venta de cosméticos una de las más recientes y con la cual viene solventando sus gastos. Por ello, trata de dedicarse a su negocio de la mejor manera, en todo tiempo del día, dentro y fuera de su casa puesto que sus clientas siempre la visitan para adquirir algunos productos que tiene en stock. Asimismo sale a visitar a algunos clientes llevando los catálogos para que realicen sus pedidos, lo cual le toma gran parte del día debido a las distancias que tiene que recorrer, pero lo más cansado es realizar las cobranzas, las cuales son indispensables para que siga invirtiendo en su negocio. Con el tiempo, Alicia espera incrementar la cantidad de productos que tiene en stock y trabajar con varias líneas de belleza, además desea tener la capacidad de implementar un bazar donde pueda ofrecer estos productos. Con Microfinanzas PRISMA ya tiene 24 préstamos y dentro de su banco comunal ha sabido aprovechar las oportunidades de desarrollo, junto a sus compañeras trabajan arduamente para que sigan adelante como grupo. Los 3200 que ahora solicita le servirán para la compra de productos de belleza por docenas y aprovechar las ofertas de los catálogos.
texts.en:
Alicia is 59 years old. She is responsible for her daughter and granddaughter, whom she tries to offer the most comfortable life she can. She has various sorts of work over the years; most recently, she has done cosmetics sales, which helps her cover her expenses. She tries to do her best at her work, at all hours of the day and in and out of her house, since her clients always visit her to obtain the products she has in stock. She also goes out to take catalogs to some clients so they can make their orders, which takes up a good portion of the day since she has to travel long distances. But her most tiring task is to collect payments for invoices, which is essential so she can continue to invest in her business. In time, Alicia hopes to increase the quantity of products she stocks and work with a number of brands of beauty products. She also hopes to be able to set up a little store in which to sell her products. She has already had 24 loans with Microfinanzas PRISMA, and her communal bank has helped her take advantage of opportunities for growth. She and her companions work hard to move ahead as a group. The 3200 soles she is now requesting will help her buy wholesale beauty products and take advantage of catalog specials.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her stock

loans.name: Aura Yesenia

texts.es: Aura Yesenia, es soltera, a pesar que no tiene hijos apoya a su mama con los gastos del hogar, trabaja como maestra de educacion primaria en Santo Tomas desde hace 7 años, esta solicitando su 1er credito a la institucion de AFODENIC para cambiarle el techo a su casa que esta dañado y con el invierno se le moja su casa, ademas desea poner la puerta de su dormitorio y si el dinero ajusta cambiar el piso de la sala que esta dañado.  Sueña con poder ir mejorando su casa y asi poder tener mejores condiciones de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Aura Yesenia is single with no children and helps her mother with the household expenses. She has been a elementary school teacher in Santo Tomas for seven years. She is requesting her first loan with AFODENIC to replace her roof, which is damaged and leaks during the winter. In addition, she would like to put up a door for her bedroom and if there is money left, replace the floor in the room that had damage from the roof. She dreams of being able to improver her house to have better living conditions for herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replace roof and floor and install bedroom door

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is a member of the Chapakazi borrower group in Msamvu, Mororgoro. She is a 34-year-old woman, is married, and is the mother of two children. Her children are aged 13 and 7 years. She also cares for two other dependents.

Three years ago Jamila  started her own shop selling commodities like rice and sugar. She works twelve hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 500,000 Tanzania Shillings.

This is Jamila’s second loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 400,000 Tsh in order to buy more wheat, rice and sugar. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, she hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more wheat, rice and sugar to sell

loans.name: Tasuthekeh Group

texts.en:
These are the members of the Tasuthekeh group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. These entrepreneurs have benefited from previous loans from Kiva partner SMT. With these loans, they were able to expand their businesses and improve both sales and profit. Having repaid their previous loans successfully, they are requesting a new loan of 1,000,000 SLL each to further strengthen their businesses. Consequently, they will be able to better support themselves and their school-going children.

Sullay K. (pictured second from left) is the leader of this group. Sullay is 42 years old, and a widow with five children. Three of her children are now in secondary school and two are in primary school. Sullay sells ready-to-wear clothes and has been in this business for over 20 years. With this loan, she will be able to travel as far as neighboring Guinea to buy clothes at a cheaper rate, and retail them in Magburaka town.

loans.use: To purchase clothes at a cheaper rate in neighboring Guinea

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
This old, small wooden house located in the rural area of Pursat Province belongs to Mrs. Kong S., 48, a local farmer. She is married to Mob Toy, 52, and they have six children. Two of their children are married and live independently, while the other four are single, do not have long in school and work on the farm. Her husband is a poultry raiser.

In the past, Kong S. always hired a neighbor’s buffalo at high fees in order to allow her to do the hard physical labor of plowing a field. She now hopes to own a water buffalo by using a loan from Kiva’s partner HKL. The loan will provide her with an extra asset.

loans.use: To buy a water buffalo

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth P. is from the village of Camp Phillips, Bukidnon. She is 48 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Elizabeth owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling seafood products including fish and shrimp as well as dried fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Elizabeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her 4th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Tseien-Ish

texts.en: B. is 25 years old and lives with his wife and four year old son in the Zavkhan province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. B. operates a cell phone and cell phone part retail business in his town. The cell phone industry in Mongolia has exploded in recent years as many people rely on their cell phones as their only means of communication with people in other parts of the country since both land lines and internet access can still be prohibitively expensive. B. began his business in 2006 and because of his strong customer service skills and stable business operation, he has become very successful. He hopes to soon expand his business further and open his own small shop where he can continue growing his enterprise. B. is requesting a 3,500,000 tugrug (~2460 USD) loan in order to purchase new cell phones and cell phone parts for his business.

loans.use: To purchase new cell phones and cell phone parts for his business

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel has been a tricycle driver and operator in their town for almost two years and his daily income is PHP20.00.  With his desire to maintain his tricycle for the welfare of his customers, he is now asking for a loan of PHP10,000.00 that he needs for the repair and maintenance of his motorcycle.  He is also engaged in fish vending and sells fish three times a week.  

He is married to Annie, a full-time housewife and they have two children: Joanna May who is 8 years old and in grade 2; and Ariane Joy who is 2 years old. They live in the village of San Isidro, Cauayan City, Isabela.

loans.use: For the repair and maintenace of his motorcyle

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe R. is from Ozamiz City. She is 47 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Fe owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for twenty-five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Fe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Fe is now requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her fourth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients needed for her snack-vending business

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гулнора Хурамова проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст 47 лет. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Муж находится в России на заработках. Сама Гулнора более 10 лет занимается сельским хозяйством, она в основном выращивает овощи и пшеницу. Кредит просит для покупки семян и удобрений, чтобы посеить новый урожай.
texts.en:
Gulnora H. lives in the Shahrituz district. She is 47 years old, married and has 5 children. Her husband is working in Russia. Gulnora has been involved in agriculture for over 10 years; she mainly grows vegetables and wheat. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of seeds and fertilizer needed for the new sowing.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy J. is currently in the business of selling used clothes in the market and is requesting a loan to buy a new supply of clothing to sell.  Joy is 30 years old and married to an engineer. She has three children and they all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a boutique.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to buy a new supply of clothing to sell

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca B. is from the village of Alibagu,Ilagan, Isabela. She is 43 years old, married, and has children.

Francisca owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling fish in the local community. She earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month with these activities.

In 2008, Francisca joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her third loan taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 


About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
La señora Aurora es socia del Banco Comunal “Manuela Ramos” desD. hace 3 años, vive en el distrito D. Santa Rosa, provincia D. El Collao y departamento D. Puno, tiene 60 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 05 hijos, todos independientes. Ella estudió primaria completa, se dedica a la compra y venta D. carne.

Aurora nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital y así comprar carne al por mayor.

Ella solicitará un nuevo crédito  D. S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar carne D. porcino, alpaca y ovino.

Su sueño para el futuro es aumentar sus ventas y  hacer crecer su negocio.

Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son las capacitaciones que imparte la promotora.
texts.en:
Sra. Aurora has been a member of the Manuela Ramos Communal Bank for the past three years. She lives in the District of Santa Rosa, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. Aurora is 60 years old, married, and has five children who are all independent. She has an elementary school education and operates a business buying and selling meat.

Aurora says her first loan was in the amount of 300 soles and used to increase her capital for buying meat in bulk. She is requesting a new loan in the amount of 3000 soles in order to buy various types of meat such as pork, alpaca, and mutton. Her dreams for the future are to increase her sales and grow her business. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the training courses provided by her loan officer.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase different meats

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Isatu S. sells African textiles (lace and cotton) and local food, such as groundnuts and garri, a couscous-like grain made from grated cassava (manioc). She is married and rents a shop at a shopping centre called Roma Market. She has spent 15 years of her life in trading (selling goods). Her husband is also a trader.

She has 15 dependants, including her three children, who are in primary school. She normally goes to Guinea to sell to sell her food and, on the way back,  she buys African textiles to sell in her shop.

Isatu is seeking a loan to cope with the high foreign exchange rate so that she can increase her inventory and meet her customer's demands. She hopes to use the proceeds of this loan to feed and pay the school fees of her children and dependents.

loans.use: To buy additional clothing material

loans.name: Tuichibek

texts.en: M. Tuichibek is 29 years old and lives with his wife and two children. For the past three years Tuichibek has been farming, planting potatoes, onions and corn which he grows to sell as well as for his own family consumption. Every day he tends to his fields. In the case of corn, Tuichibek dries it and later threshes it, puts it in sacks and stores it for future sales. The process for planting his fields is first to prepare them with organic fertilizer. Later, using his plough, he sows them and afterwards is the period when he irrigates and applies fertilizer and insecticides, if necessary. All this is to insure a good harvest. Tuichibek will invest the loan in the purchase of organic fertilizers to prepare his land to raise potatoes and other crops. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase ingredients in bulk for her cafe.

loans.name: Arnie

texts.en: Mrs. Arnie P. is from the village of Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 21 years old, married, and blessed with one child. Her primary source of income is from her business, a "sari-sari" store (small grocery), with a monthly net income of 2,500 PHP. Arnie has been a member of Paglaum Multipurpose Cooperative since 2009, and she is now on her 3rd loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her sari-sari store. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Butogota Group C, Kihihi

texts.en:
R. Justus, the one that is raising his hand in the photo, is the leader of his lending group in Kihihi. He is a hardworking and well-behaved man who is married with five children.

Justus has a business selling electronics from Butogota Central and is able to make 40,000/= as weekly profits from his three-year-old business. He says that before his current business, he used to sell tea, sugarcane and coffee to make a living.

Justus’ electronics include radios, bulbs, electrical wire, and so on. He says that he has seen his business grow to its current state and he is grateful for the loans that have made it happen. He needs a new loan to be able to stock more electronics to sell.

loans.use: To buy more electronics like switches, wire and so on

loans.name: Genie

texts.en:
Genie T. is 57 years old and determined to make sure that her family has enough food and other items to meet its daily needs. She is married to Roel T., a government employee, and they have four children. For many years now, she has made a living running her own variety store.

Genie has been a member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year.  She regularly attends weekly fellowship meetings and pays her dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times from our cooperative. She has done a good job of using the money she borrows to expand and improve her variety store.     

To ensure the continued success of her business, she is applying for a new loan of PHP 22,000. She will use this money to expand her business by buying more groceries to sell to her customers. She dreams of helping her family live well and have a settled life of its own.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups which meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is made up of 15 to 30 community partners and gather weekly to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell from her variety store.

loans.name: Nadiatou

texts.fr: Cette femme reste une jeune femme très dynamique, elle a 25 ans et est célibataire. Afin de subvenir à ses propres besoins, elle s’est lancée en 2007 dans le commerce des céréales, pour réaliser de grandes marges bénéficiaires sur ses ventes, elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays dans la ville d’atakpame. Elle fait face à une baisse de stock raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES pour la premier fois un crédit afin de s’acheter 3 sacs d’haricots, 8 sacs de maïs et assurer le transport de la marchandise.
texts.en:
This lady is a very dynamic young lady. She is 25 years old and single. With the aim of being able to provide for her own needs, she began to trade in cereals in 2007. In order to make large profit margins on her sales, she gets her supplies inland in the town of Atakpame. She is facing a decline in stock and for this reason is requesting a first loan from WAGES, in order to buy three sacks of beans, three sacks of corn and to cover the transportation costs for her merchandise.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cereals

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan F. is 49 years old and from the town of Sta. Josefa. She has six school-aged children. To make a living, Susan owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Susan has been engaged in her business for over ten years.
In 2007, Susan joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Susan is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be her eighth loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Venancia

texts.en:
Venancia T. is from the village of Tubod. She is 63 years old. Venancia is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Venancia owns & operates a hog raising business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Venancia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Venancia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Venancia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Venancia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Venancia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita T. is from the town of Poblacion, Kadingilan Bukidnon. She is 42 years old. Elenita is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Elenita owns & operates an appliance repair shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing repair services to local community members. Elenita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elenita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elenita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to provide service. Elenita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase repair equipment to improve the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Elenita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase repair equipment to improve the business

loans.name: Yi

texts.en:
The woman in the photo is Mrs. Yi N., aged 44, who lives in the Province of Kompong Tom in Cambodia, where she makes a living by raising pigs and crops. Since 2001, she has run this business with great success, and it has provided her with income to attain her standard of living.

She is married with four children who are teenagers: one is a laborer in the garment industry and the other three attend the secondary school. Her husband assists her in the business activities. Yi N. raised her pigs two months ago, but they are not very big due to the lack of food. Because she doesn’t have money, Yi N. decided to seek help from lenders through Kiva’s project, in the amount of $1,100 to purchase many sacks of pig feed to fatten her pigs.

loans.use: To purchase many sacks of pig food to fatten her pigs.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia  tiene  37 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos  en su casa propia. Se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería desde hace 11 años, actualmente posee en su establo vacas, toros y ovejas, además siembra maíz, papa y alfalfa que le sirve para alimentar a sus animales, ya que debe venderlos cuando llegan al peso exacto. Sus mayores ingresos para ella es cuando vende alfalfa, producto por el cual se ha intensificado en su siembra, de esta manera corta todas las mañanas y con la ayuda de sus hijos la ayudan a vender. Afirma que sus actividades le están generando buenas rentas, y esto es gracias a su perseverancia y ahora ve los frutos con mucha satisfacción por lo que esta planeando adquirir mas extensiones de terreno. Es su noveno crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará sacos de abono para sembrar más alfalfa en sus terrenos.
texts.en:
Silvia is 37 years old; she lives with her husband and 2 children in a house they own. She has worked in farming and livestock for 11 years. Currently, Silvia owns a stable of cows, bulls and sheep. She also farms maize, potato and alfalfa, which she uses to feed her animals until they are big enough for sale. Most of her income comes from alfalfa, so she has increased her planting. She harvests the alfalfa every morning, and sells it with the help of her children. Silvia confirms that her work is profitable, thanks to her perseverance. She now sees the fruits of her labor and is happily planning to expand her farm land. This is her 9th loan with MFP. Silvia is happy to have this financial support and she has always been responsible in her loan repayment. She is also grateful to be a part of her community group because all of its members are responsible and supportive. Silvia is grateful to those people whose funding will provide the loan capital she needs. This loan will be very useful in the development of her business. She will use it to buy sacks of fertilizer to plant more alfalfa.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more fertilizer.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
El Señor Ernesto G. P., tiene 21 años, es soltero pero tiene un hijo, es una persona muy dedicada a su trabajo desde muy joven, él se dedico a ser albañil y poco a poco empezó a ganarse el pan de cada día. Vive en la zona de Ivirgarzama en la provincia Chapare, en una localidad de clima tropical.

Actualmente el trabaja en el sindicato de moto taxis “COPACABANA” es socio activo y muy responsable en la labor que desempeña, se levanta a muy tempranas horas por la mañana para empezar su cotidiana labor, al igual que sus compañeros el goza de turnos tres veces por semana en las diferentes paradas que el sindicato les otorga para que brinden sus servicios a las personas del lugar y sus alrededores. Ivirgarzama es una zona donde las personas se transportan en motocicletas, porque no los caminos son senderos angostos donde solo este tipo de vehículos pueden acceder. Ernesto tiene que sustentar la alimentación de su pequeño hijo. Estuvo trabajando como chofer sin vehículo propio por casi un año.

El señor Ernesto G. P. se apersono a CIDRE por el comentario de sus compañeros del sindicato estando en la posibilidad de solicitar un crédito para la compra de un vehículo (motocicleta) para así poder facilitar la vida que lleva, y así poder tener más ingresos para su bienestar propio y en especial de su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Mr. Ernesto G. P. is 21 years old, single, and has a son. He has been very dedicated to his work since he was young. He works as a mason and bit by bit began to earn his daily bread every day. He lives in the zone of Ivirgarzama in the province of Chapare. in a town with a tropical climate.

He is currently working in the Copacabana motorcycle taxi company. He is a very active group member and very responsible with the work he does. He gets up very early in the morning to begin his work. In the same way as his coworkers, he enjoys three shifts per week at different taxi stops that the company assigns them in order to provide his services to the people of the community and the surrounding communities. Ivirgarzama is an area where people transport themselves via motorcycle, because the roads are wide paths only accessible to this type of vehicle. Ernesto has to provide for his young son. He was working as a driver without his own vehicle for almost a year.

Mr. Ernesto G. P. joined CIDRE upon the recommendation of one of his co-workers with the hopes of getting a loan to buy a motorcycle to help with his work and have greater income. This will help with his own well-being and especially that of his young son.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Aida's Group

texts.en:
Aida S. is from the village of Guiwanon Panalsalan Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old. Aida is the group leader of a 6 member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Guava 2.

Aida is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Aida owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Aida has been engaged in her business for over 5 years. She earns approximately 3,800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Aida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aida is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to invest in working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Aida from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to invest in working capital

loans.name: Ansorbeh Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a Kiva partner in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you the members of the “Ansorbeh” group. These are entrepreneurs with small-scale businesses who have come to SMT/Kiva to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 each in order to invest in their businesses. 

The leader of this group is Adama T. who is age forty-five and was born in a place called Songo, in northern Sierra Leone. She is married with four children. Her husband is a driver and three of her children are attending primary schools and one is in secondary school.

Adama sells rice (the country’s staple food) and palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil). With this loan, she will expand her business by buying the above mentioned items wholesale to add to her current stock.

Attached to the photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo.

loans.use: To buy rice and palm-oil wholesale

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia G. is a married woman who lives in Barangay Casay, Dalaguete, Cebu. She earns her living through her general store and pig fattening businesses. Her husband, Simplicio G., is 61 years old. They have seven children who are between 19 and 32 years old. 

Aurelia  joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 7 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Aurelia  has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 29,500 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of about $210, raising the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 8th cycle loan, she is borrowing 29,500 PHP, which she intends to use as additional working capital to buy stock for the store and vitamins for the pigs, so that she can continue to save up for the future and improve her businesses. Aurelia G. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: koukou est un homme dynamique qui est un père de famille, il est cambiste et exerce cette activité depuis plus de 5 ans. il souhaite augmenter son capital pour réaliser plus de profits sur les opérations de change.c'est pour cela qu'il sollicite du crédit de WAGES. il a deux personnes à sa charge.
texts.en:
Kokou is an energetic man, and a father with two dependents in his care. He makes a living as a broker, an activity he has been practicing for over five years. 

He is seeking a loan from WAGES to increase his working capital and bolster his profits on exchange transactions.

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: La Familia Group

texts.es:
El comité de Mujeres La Familia del barrio Villa Salvador de la ciudad de Aregua, se formo gracias a la invitación de varias de ellas de formar un nuevo grupo.
Actualmente el mismo se encuentra en el noveno ciclo del Programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya y está conformado por 18 integrantes, las cuales invierten en distintas actividades.
La señora Cristina R. es una de las integrantes y  se dedica a la venta de hierbas medicinales e invirtió el dinero en la compra de los mismos al por mayor, para el incremento de sus ventas. 
En Paraguay mucha gente consume el mate (agua caliente con hierbas medicinales, se toma en un vaso llamado guampa con yerma mate a la mañana y en ocasiones también de tarde), esta  costumbre se va heredando por generaciones y es practicada por persona adultas.
Las personas que diariamente consumen esta bebida son los clientes de la señora Cristina.
Las hierbas medicinales es un producto que tiene mucha venta y le ayuda a ella con el ingreso de su familia, y de esta manera ayuda a su familia.
texts.en:
The women’s cooperative “La Familia”, of the Villa Salvador neighborhood in the city of Aregua, was formed thanks to an invitation from several of them to form a new group.  Currently, the group finds itself in the ninth cycle in the Entrepreneurial Women’s Group Program of the Fundación Paraguaya.  The group is comprised of 18 members who carry out a variety of activities.  

Cristina R. is one of the members, and she dedicates herself to selling medicinal herbs.  She invested the money into buying these products at wholesale, in order to increase her sales.  In Paraguay, many people consume mate (hot water with medicinal herbs and yerba mate, drunk from a glass called a guampa, taken in the morning and sometimes at night).

This custom has been passed down for generations, and is practiced by adults.  The people who drink this beverage on a daily basis are Cristina’s customers.  Medicinal herbs sell very well, and help her generate income, allowing her to help her family.

loans.use: To purchase medicinal herbs.

loans.name: John Lekakeny

texts.en:
John N. is 40 years old from the Osupuko area in Kilgoris. He is married to Lillian and they have three children: 18 year old Cale, 15 year old Ruth and 2 year old Memusi.

John is a farmer and he plants maize and vegetables on his farm. He is currently in need of maize and green vegetable seeds to add to his stock. He also needs money to pay for labour charges during harvest time.  He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a friend who is also a client of KADET. His farm is in Osupuko village near Osupuko dispensary in Kilgoris and here the demand for maize is very high.

His desire is to produce more maize that can maximize profits that will enable him take better care of his family's needs and be able to pay school fees without struggling.

loans.use: Buy maize seeds to add to his stock.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more fresh fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Hun

texts.en: Mrs. Hun V., 43, and her husband Mr. Heang Sin, 45, live along national road number one, about thirty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1991 and have six children — two sons and four daughters. Unfortunately, three of them died. Two are garment factory workers and another one attends school. Her husband is a fisherman. Hun sells fish that her husband catches and also buys some fish from other fisherman to sell in her village. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchasing fishing materials and a boat for her husband’s business.

loans.use: To purchasing fishing materials and boat for her husband’s business.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua S. is a widow and has three children. Ekua sells kenkey and banku in Takoradi.  She has been doing this for six years. Ekua uses her income to see to the welfare of her home.  Ekua will use the loan to buy more maize to cook banku for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to invest in her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy maize to make banku for sale

loans.name: Peterson

texts.en:
Peterson O. is 68 years old and married with eight children who are all adults. He is a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for 40 years and employs one farmhand. His mixed farm produces maize, beans, tea, milk and sugarcane, which are all sold locally. Farming is his only source of income.

He has requested  a loan of 45000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will be invested into the family's other businesses. He would like to expand his dairy farming in the future by acquiring five more dairy cows and investing more in horticultural crops.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Alma Rosa

texts.es: Alma Rosa I. L. se dedica a la venta de ropa usada desde hace 8 años, donde tiene diversidad de colores y tallas a un bajo precio. La señora comenta que ya hace unos años una de sus hijas falleció por lo que tuvo que hacerse cargo de sus nietos, es por ello que trabaja muy duro para ofrecerles lo que su hija por la situación no pudo hacer.
texts.en: Alma Rosa I. L. has been selling used clothes for 8 years.  She offers her clothes in a range of colors and sizes, at a low price.  She tells us that a few years ago one of her daughters died and this meant that she had to take care of her grandchildren.  For this reason, Alma works very hard so that she can offer them what her daughter wasn't able to because of the situation.

loans.use: For her business

loans.name: Gulmira's Group

texts.en:
Gulmira A., 47, is a leader of this group. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a head of “aiyl okmotu”, which in Kyrgyz means a village. He is responsible for all the activities of the village, its security and the development of business. That makes Gulmira feel responsible too. 

Gulmira is a teacher of Russian language and literature in local high school. Unfortunately, a teachers’ salary is just a little bit above the minimum wage level. Because it’s far from enough to make a living, most teachers look for a second job or start a small business. Gulmira saves most of her salary to pay the tuition of her two college aged children.  Additionally to her work in school, Gulmira also breeds livestock to resell. Her business was started 20 years ago with the purchase of a young calf for 5000 soms. Gulmira raised the calf and resold it, for a generated profit she bought another one. Following this strategy, Gulmira has accomplished a lot, and considerably increased the number of her cattle. Now she’s built a paddock for cattle and provides good living conditions for the cattle. The purpose of the loan is to buy additional livestock and resell them at a good price. The anticipated profit will be spent on making major repairs at her house.

        --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). 

MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase livestock.

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en:
Vorn M., 32, resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. M. is a silk weaver, earning an income of $3.30 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $15 on food and $34 on the other necessary expenses. 

M. is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase more raw silk to expand her current business. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more raw silk to expand the business

loans.name: Brenda Esmeralda

texts.es:
Brenda tiene 23 años de edad, esta joven vive en Puerto el Triunfo, departamento de Usulután, junto a su esposo, su hija de 2 años de edad y también su abuela, Brenda se dedica a la venta de meriendas, trabaja todos los días de la semana, vende tortillas, enchiladas, pasteles desde hace 8 años, comenzando muy pequeña con el negocio.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar productos de cocina, los cuales le hacen falta como aceite, maíz y leña, al comprar dichos productos, mejorara su inventario, proveyéndole lo necesario al momento que surja la demanda de alimentos.
Brenda, aspira un negocio amplio, rentable y con clientes satisfechos por su buen servicio, también en su familia quiere darles lo necesario, que su hijo crezca sano y en un futuro poder iniciar la escuela.
texts.en:
Brenda, 23, lives in Puerto El Triunfo, Usulután department with her husband, her 2-year-old daughter and her grandmother.  Brenda sells lunches every day of the week.  She has sold tortillas, enchiladas and cakes for 8 years having started with the business while still very young.

She is asking for a loan to buy cooking supplies she needs like:  oil, corn and firewood.  Buying said items will improve her inventory providing her with what she needs to meet demand for her meals when it arises.

Brenda hopes for a large, profitable business with customers satisfied thanks to the good service.  She also wants to provide what’s necessary for her family, that her child grows up healthy and be able to start school in the future.

loans.use: To buy materials like oil, corn and firewood.

loans.name: Magaly Aurora

texts.es: Magaly tiene 39 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo. Vive en casa propia en la parte rural del distrito de Pacora en Lambayeque. Desde hace más de 10 años, se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores. Cría los animales en un terreno cerca de su domicilio y cuando estos alcancen un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Cuenta con una clientela ya establecida en la zona. Aprendió esta actividad de su padre, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales y alimentos balanceados. Desea obtener un mejor peso y tamaño de sus animales para venderlos a un mejor precio. Con esta inversión, podrá incrementar sus ingresos y seguir solventando sus gastos familiares. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 800 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en: Magaly is 39 years old, is single and has one son.  She lives in her own house in the rural area of Pacora District in Lambayeque. For more than 10 years she has made her living raising and selling small animals.  She raises the animals on a plot of land near her home.  When the animals reach are sufficiently developed, she offers them for sale to the general public and to businessmen who tend to visit the area where she lives.  Magaly has an established customer base in the area.  She learned her business from her father, which is to say that she knows her line of work perfectly.  She hopes to expand her business with the purchase of more animals and more feed.  She wants her animals to get to a better weight and size to be able to sell them for a better price.  With the investment, she will be able to increase her earnings and continue meeting her household expenses.  That is why she believed it would be advisable to request a loan of 800 PEN ($300 USD) from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to purchase more animals and animal feed.

loans.name: Colibri Group

texts.es:
La Señora Teresita es miembro del grupo Colibri y es habitantante de un lugar llamado Tierra Blanca el cual es mas conocido como la novia del sol, ya que ademas de ser una region ganadera es uno de los lugares donde hace mas calor del estado de VeraC.. Doña Teresita tiene la edad de 45 años, estudio la carrera tecnica de secretaria la cual ejercio hasta que sus hijos nacieron.

Ella nos platica que hace un poco mas de 23 años con el apoyo de su esposo decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio y abrio una pequeña papeleria a la cual llamo Papeleria Junior.

Ella nos dijo"como le dijo a mi esposo mientras existan las escuelas siempre tendremos venta, por eso a mi siempre me gusta tener surtido aunque sea un poquito de todo para que los chamacos(estudiantes- niños) siempre encuentren lo que buscan"
 
Doña teresita  necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de lapiz, lapiceros, hojas blancas y de colores, resistol, tijeras, cartilinas, papel bond, plastilina, unicel, fomy, cuadernos, libretas, laminas y biografias para resurtir su tienda.

ella nos dijo que espera con esta inversion poder aunmentar sus ganancias para poder agrandar su nagocio.

Doña vianey es otro miembro del grupo colibri, ella tiene 40 años, solo asistio a la secundaria y esta casa, ella tiene dos hijas las cuales practican danza y voleibol. 

Ella nos platica que hace mas de dos años decidio iniciar con su propio negocio de venta de pasteles, play y flan. Ella vende algunas veces por pedido y en otras ocasiones vende casa por casa, nos dice que lo que le ayuda a tener mucha venta es que tiene muchos amigos.

ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de huevos, mantequilla, leche, moldes, gas, arina, chantilli, fruta y colorantes para la preparacion de sus pasteles y posteriormente venderlos. nos dice que le gustaria tener su propia pasteleria en un local en el centro de Tierra blanca pero tambien nos dicer que debe 
trabajar duro y ahorrar mucho para poder lograr tener su pasteleria

ella se encuentra muy contenta con este prestamo ya que le ayudara a que su negocio prospere.

Los demas personas que integran este grupo son:

Maria Luisa H. D.– venta de agus de garrafón
Irma C. Gracia – venta de cosmetico
Maria Adriana Gutierrez H.- venta de artesanias
Brenda Rosario H. C.-taller mecanico
Favi Jazmin Z. Pinmentel- venta de telefonos
Susana S. D.- venta de ropa interior
Nadia Alejandra A. P.- venta de topperWare
Ariadna Esperanza V. R.- taller de costura
Maria del Rocio P. G.- estetica
texts.en:
Teresita is a member of the “Colibrí” group and she lives in a place called Tierra Blanca, which is best known as the “Beloved of the Sun” because, in addition to being a cattle region, it is one of the hottest places in VeraC.. Teresita is 45 years old. She studied to be a secretary, which was her career until her children were born.

She tells us that a little more than 23 years ago, with the support of her husband, she decided to start her own business. She opened a small stationary store, which she called Papelería Junior. She says “Like I told my husband, as long as there are schools, we will always be able to sell. That’s why I always like to have a good amount of stock even if it’s only a little bit of each thing, so that students and children will always find what they are looking for.”

Teresita needs this loan to buy pencils, pencil cases, paper in white and other colors, glue, scissors, paper board, bond paper, modeling clay, polystyrene, foam, notebooks, spiral notebooks, laminates, and biographies, to re-stock her store.

Vianey is another member of the “Colibrí” group. She is 40 years old. She only attended junior high, and she is married. She has two daughters, both of whom practice dance and volley ball. 

She tells us that more than ten years ago, she decided to start her own business selling cakes, bread, and flan. She sometimes sells by previous order, and sometimes she sells door to door. She explains that what helps her have good sales is having many friends. 

She needs this loan to buy eggs, butter, milk, baking tins, cooking gas, flour, whipped cream, fruits, and food colorings for the preparation of her cakes. She is very happy with this loan because it will help her business to prosper.

The other members of this group are: 
Maria Luisa H. D. – bottled water sales
Irma C. Gracia – cosmetics sales
Maria Adriana Gutierrez H. - crafts sales
Brenda Rosario H. C. - mechanic shop
Favi Jazmin Z. Pinmentel - telephone sales
Susana S. D.- intimate clothing sales
Nadia Alejandra A. P. - Tupperware sales
Ariadna Esperanza V. R. - sewing shop
Maria del Rocio P. G. - cosmotology

loans.use: to buy paper, pencil cases, underwear and cell phones.

loans.name: Asel's Group

texts.en:
Asel S. is the treasurer of this group. She is 35 years-old and married to a shepherd. Together with her husband, she is bringing up a daughter and a son; both children are at school. Asel works as a head teacher in the local school. Her husband breeds sheep and gets money for that, from 2000 to 7000 soms per month.  With money received from the loan, Asel plans to purchase goats for breeding. She can earn good money as well selling the wool. In the future, she wants to expand this kind of business and improve the family’s living condition.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers, as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase goats

loans.name: C4822 Abishyizehamwe Group

texts.en:
Sifa, a 28-year-old married mother of three children ranging in age from 5 to 12 years old, is the president of a group called “Abishyizehamwe.” Sifa has been selling bananas for five years, working from 6 am until 9:30 pm everyday.

Sifa has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase more bananas, beans, sweet potatoes, Irish potatoes, etc. in order to increase her profits. She will save a portion of those profits and reinvest the rest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more food to sell such as bananas, beans, sweet potatoes, Irish potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Andriy

texts.en:
Andriy is married with 3 children. He lives in Ivano-Frankivsk. Andriy offers transportation services in the territory of Ukraine. He started this business 2 and a half years ago. Andriy works 12-14 hours a day to make sure his family has everything they need. Presently, Andriy receives about 9,000 Grivnyas of gross income. His net profit amounts to 6,000 Grivnyas. 

Andriy is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to repay the car loan he took to purchase a newer vehicle for his business. Andriy’s business is the main source of income for the family. One day, Andriy hopes to purchase a newer car that will work on compressed gas.

loans.use: to repay his car loan

loans.name: Eustacio

texts.es:
Eustacio tiene 56 años esta casado, posee casa propia, vive con su esposa a 8 km de la ciudad de Paraguari.
Eustacio se dedica a la producción y ventas de ladrillos y también a la agricultura desde hace más de 25 años con la ayuda de sus 8 hijos, de los cuales 4 son mujeres, una de ellas ya está casada y las demás trabajan como empleadas domésticas en la ciudad de Paraguarí, 2 de los varones son de profesión policía, los demás varones trabajan por cuenta propia; gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres pudieron salir adelante. 
Eustacio pretende utilizar el crédito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de ladrillos en mayores cantidades, como arena y reparación de la mezcladora, de modo que pueda obtener una mayor productividad y ganancias.
texts.en:
Eustacio is 56 years old. He is married and owns his own home. He lives with his wife, 8 km from the city of  Paraguari.
Eustacio has made and sold bricks and farmed for more than 25 years, with the help of his 8 children. Four of them are daughters, and one of them is already married. The rest work as domestic help in the city of  Paraguarí. Two of his sons are police officers, and the rest are self employed. Thanks to the hard work of their parents, they were able to get ahead.  
 
Eustacio intends on using the loan to buy raw materials to make bricks in larger quantities, as well as to repair a mixer. In this way, he can have higher production and more earnings.

loans.use: to buy raw materials (sand) and to repair a mixer.

loans.name: Renelda

texts.en:
