Renelda is 38 years old and lives in Tamil, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 2 children.

Renelda has a business selling fish in the local community. She earns about PHP 7,000 each month doing this type of work. Renelda has requested a loan to buy fish in her own and in nearby neighborhoods.

Renelda has been a member of PMPC for 1 month. In the future, she would like to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fish

location.town: Liloy-Tamil, Jose Dalman Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba sells polo (a local dish) and sugar cane at Elmina. She is married and has three children. Her partner is a farmer. She has been in this trade for six years. She supports her husband to provide her family's basic needs. Her loan will be used to buy more ingredients to prepare polo for sale. She hopes to reinvest the new profits back into the business.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to prepare polo (a local dish) for sale.

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en:
Ismail, a 35-year-old resident of the town of Makindye in the Kampala central region of Uganda, is married and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past six years Ismail has operated a business selling charcoal, and he also has rental houses.

To help expand his business, Ismail has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more charcoal for resale by which he hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, Ismail hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Eladia

texts.en:
Eladia is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 1 child. 

Eladia has a shop that sells snacks, breads & noodles.  She has had this business for 3 years.  She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy additional stocks of noodles to sell.

Eladia has been a member of HSPFI since 2008.  In the future, Eladia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of noodles to sell

loans.name: Manuel Isaac

texts.es:
Manuel, vive con su esposa y una hija, es casado y propietario de una farmacia donde ofrece todo tipo de medicamentos, este negocio lo heredó de su abuela, no tiene horario fijo para atender a sus clientes y gracias a Dios ha sido un negocio rentable.
El esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de diferentes tipos de medicamentos como antibioticos, analgesicos, vitaminas, en diferentes presentaciones inyecciones, jarabes, tabletas, esta compra le ayudara a tener mayor variedad de medicamentos para ofrecer a su clientela.
El objetivo de Manuel es diversificar los productos en su farmacia, logrando fortalecerla y mejorando el servicio al cliente así como también sus ingresos para la familia.
texts.en:
Manuel lives with his wife and daughter.  He’s married and owns a pharmacy where he sells all types of medicine.  He inherited the business from his grandmother.  He does not have a fixed schedule to tend to customers and thanks be to God, it’s been a profitable business.

He is asking for a loan to buy different types of medicine like antibiotics, analgesics and vitamins in various presentations like injections, syrups and tablets.  This purchase will help him have a larger variety of medicine to offer customers.

Manuel’s objective is to diversity his pharmacy stock managing to strengthen it and improve customer service as well as family income.

loans.use: to buy medicines.

loans.name: Esnarda

texts.en:
This is Esnarda, 64, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. A widow, she manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Esnarda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this, she is also selling home-cooked meals to her neighbors and retails herbal/organic products. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 40,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Esnarda hopes her business grows in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.en:
Bibiana is an optimist who believes that patience is bitter but its fruits are sweet. She is 42, married, and blessed with four children. With God's guidance and her hard work and patience, she has been able to send them all to school. Bibiana works hard to help her husband maintain their farm. The couple owns a two hectare field that they have been cultivating for 20 years, planting and harvesting rice to sell to traders in the village.  Last harvest season, Bibiana earned about 50,000 PHP. Her profits were just enough to cover tuition fees and allowances for her children along with providing for daily groceries and utilities. 

Bibiana is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for land cultivation. She needs to prepare her farmland thoroughly to gain more profit from the next harvest season. Bibiana hopes someday to provide a better life for her family by producing abundant harvests.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and cultivate her land

loans.name: Mikheil

texts.en:
Mikheil is 36 years old farmer from the village Kveda Sazano, Imereti Region. He is married and lives with his family: wife – Tamila, 6 year old daughter, 3 year old son, 78 year old mother (retired) and 39 year old sister. The latter has health problems and gets relevant monthly pension from the state. Mikheil’s children go to school. Tamila is a housewife. 

Mikheil is leading the agricultural business of the family. They own 2 cows and sell dairy products on Zestaponi (nearby town) market. Also the family gets income from sales of grapes and nuts harvested on a family owned 1.5 hectare plot of land, where 150 nut trees and 1500 vine trees are grown. Total average monthly income of the family is 500 Laris, including the pensions of Mikheil’s mother and sister. 

Mikheil requested credit for expansion of the dairy farm. He plans to purchase an additional milk cow to produce and sell 50% more cheese and thus increase the income of the family. Increase in income will allow Mikheil’s family to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Speciose

texts.en:
Speciose is 36 years old and is married with five children aged between 5 and 14 years old. She also takes care of two relatives. Her business is well-organized and is well known as a shop that sells various shoes, such as those for seniors and children. Her business hours are from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m. every day and she currently employs two persons to help her. 

Speciose has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her business by buying more senior's and children's shoes. Any profits will be reinvested in her business and saved for her future. Speciose hopes also to buy three motorcycles to help her in the future with her profits.

loans.use: To purchase more senior's and children's shoes to sell.

loans.name: Farkhod

texts.ru: Фарход умный и решительный  молодой человек. Он уже 5 лет  занимается  куплей и продажей мужской одежды и обуви. Фарход живет вместе с родителями, отец помогает ему в бизнесе. Он приобретает товар на центральном рынке и продает на местном рынке. Фарход, чтобы привлечь клиента, старается хорошо обслужить их. Для развития бизнеса он хочет приобрести новые товары, впереди зима и потребность в  одежде и обуви возрастает. Фарходу  для покупки качественной одежды и обуви запрашивает  займ в размере 1700$США и надеется на вашу помощь и понимание
texts.en: Farkhod is a smart and decisive young person.  He has been involved in buying and selling men's clothing and shoes for five years.  Farkhod lives together with his parents, and his father helps him with the business.  Farkhod buys the merchandise at the central market and sells it at the local market.  In order to attract more customers, he tries to serve them well.  He wants to buy new merchandise in anticipation of the onset of winter and increased demand for clothing and shoes.  Farkhod is requesting a loan in the sum of $1700 to buy quality clothing and shoes and hopes to receive your help and understanding.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise for the winter season

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MANOS JUNTAS DE RUMICHACA ALTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.Nilda; ella tiene 44 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de verduras, ella vende verduras como zanahorias, tomates, pepinos entre otras verduras, la socia lleva las verduras a diferentes lugares como en el distrito de Calca, la socia también se dedica a vender chicha que es una bebida a base de maíz, ella vende la chicha en su casa en el distrito de Urubamba. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras al por mayor y para comprar maíz para preparar chicha.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member is part of the Manos Juntas de Rumichaca Alta Communal Bank, which is located in the Urubamba district of the province by the same name, department of Cusco.

She is Ms. Nilda, a 44-year-old married mother of 4. She alternates her daily chores with her vegetable business. She sells vegetables like carrots, tomatoes, and cucumbers, among other produce. She takes her vegetables throughout the district of Calca. She also sells chicha, a maize beverage, from her home in the district of Urubamba. The member is requesting a loan in order to purchase vegetables wholesale and to purchase maize to prepare the chicha drink.

Ms. Nilda is happy about the loan, and she commits to repaying it back on time.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables wholesale and to purchase maize to prepare the chicha drink.

loans.name: Ruth Julieta

texts.es:
Ruth sigue participando en el banco comunal “Inti Pakareq” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Ruth sigue dedicándose confección de ropa en maquina de tejer.

Ruth con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho. 

Ruth requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de costura como por ejemplo hilos, telas y otras cosas más. 

Ruth se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Ruth continues to participate in the “Inti Pakareq” communal bank, affiliated with the Microfinance Unit of the Arariwa Association in the city of Cusco. Ruth is still dedicated to making clothing with a sewing machine.

Things went very well with Ruth's last loan and she was able to obtain good benefits. With this motive in mind, she desires another loan that will help her a great deal. Ruth needs the loan to buy sewing materials including thread, cloth, and many other items.

Ruth is very grateful for the opportunity offered through this medium and in addition, she promises to comply with her schedule of payments.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies like thread, fabric and many other things.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
La Señora Ana es socia del banco comunal Sociedad 12 de Abril, vive por un hermoso sector de la ciudad de Cuenca,  a esta ciudad la hace hermosa su mezcla pintoresca entre lo colonial y lo moderno, sus lugares con abundante naturaleza, su gente quienes son de un corazón cálido y mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Ana tiene 48 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 26, 25 y 16 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos son casados e independientes y su ultima hija está estudiando en una colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo le ayuda en el negocio familiar, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad siendo el sacrificio del trabajo conyugal.

La Señora. Ana se dedica al comercio ya que cuanta con una tienda en un mercado de la ciudad donde vende variedad de productos como aceite, vinagre, granos secos y otros productos de primera necesidad, labora en el negocio hace 26 años y trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 10 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad, granos secos, legumbres, etc. para crecer más en su tienda.

Su sueño es no tener deudas.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana is a member of the Communal Bank “Sociedad 12 de Abril” (April 12th Society). She lives in a beautiful area of the city of Cuenca. The beauty of this picturesque city is a result of blending the colonial with the modern. There is abundant natural beauty. The people possess warm hearts and have been able to maintain the culture and traditions of their ancestors.

Doña Ana is 48 years old, married, and has three children (ages 26, 25, and 16). Her first two children are married and live independently, while her youngest daughter attends high school in the city. Her husband helps with the family business. Ana and her family own the house that they live in as a result of the sacrifices her husband made through his work.

Sra. Ana is a merchant and has a shop at the city market. She sells a variety of products such as oil, vinegar, dried grains, and other basic necessities. Ana has been in this business for 26 years and works Sunday through Sunday from 7am to 6pm. She has been with her Communal Bank for 10 years and her new loan will be invested in the purchase of basic necessities, dried grains, legumes, and other products so that her business can grow even more. Her dream is to not be in debt.

loans.use: to buy basic necessities, dried grains, legumes, and other products.

loans.name: Nasira's Group

texts.en:
Nasira lives with her husband and 5 children in a small house. Three of her children are studying while other 2 are very young and haven’t started their education yet. 
She is a housewife and performs her household tasks by staying at home. Due to her supportive nature, her family has good respect for her. 
Her husband is very hardworking person and prepares snacks of great taste that sells for good price among his clients. Nasira provides full support in preparing snacks for him to sell. He then put those snacks (called Papad in local language) on his bicycle and sells by visiting different streets of the city. 
Nasira has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the further improvement of her husband’s business. With the loan investment, he will buy ingredients such as spices, gram flour and cooking oil in larger quantity to be able to prepare better quality snacks that will help him increasing his sales and profits. 
Note: “In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nasira.”

loans.use: To buy gram flour, spices, cooking oil for snacks making & selling business

loans.name: Linda Elvis

texts.es:
Linda de 34 años, empezó con su pequeña escuela desde hace 6 años atrás y con su esfuerzo y la ayuda de Dios ya casi termina de obtener la documentación de la escuela para tener mas niños. 

Los horarios de clases son de 7 de la mañana hasta las 1 de la tarde, y de ahí en adelante preparan los horarios de clases. Gracias a Dios no ha tenido ningún problema.  Esta felizmente unida a su esposo que es albañil, y tienen 3 hijos de 10, 6 y 3 años.

Tienes muchas aspiraciones de seguir con la escuela por eso quiere terminar de arreglarla comprando con el prestamo cemento, bloques y pintura. Su meta es poder hacer la escuela más grande  para así poder educar a más niños.
texts.en:
Linda, 34, started her small school six years ago and through her hard work and God’s help she has almost finished obtaining the documentation needed for the school to admit more children.

Class hours are from 7 in the morning until 1 in the afternoon and from then on they prepare the class schedules. By the grace of God, there have been no problems. Linda is happily married to her husband, who is a bricklayer, and they have three children, who are 10, 6 and 3 years old.

She aspires to continue on with the school and therefore wants to finish fixing it up by using the loan to buy cement, blocks and paint. Her goal is to be able to build a larger school so that she can educate more children.

loans.use: to buy cement, blocks and paint.

loans.name: Vinani

texts.en:
Vinani is taking another Kiva loan of KES 10,000 to boost her business.  She anticipates an increase in demand during the festive season. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase more maize flour, wheat flour and sugar for resale.  She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Bum's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village in the Tbaung Khmum district, Bum is 37 years old and has two children who are still in primary school. She started farming rice and planting cassava 18 years ago to earn a living. Sometimes, she works for others for extra income. She earns $3 U.S. dollars per day from her current business and saves  $1 U.S. dollar daily after expenses. 

This is her group’s second loan with VisionFund. Leading a group of three female members, she is requesting a loan to rent a plot of farmland for her cassava business. She hopes this loan will enable her to extend her farmland in order to grow more cassava and earn a larger income to make her living better and to keep her children in school until graduation.

loans.use: To rent a plot of farmland for her cassava business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Noemi Yanira

texts.es:
Noemí, quiere continuar empleando y fortaleciendo el negocio, ella quiere mejorar siempre el servicio a los clientes para mantener su preferencia, en esta ocasión comprará maíz, aceite, leña, para que su producción sea mejor y mantener una situación estable con los clientes.
Ella considera que su situación económica familiar ha sido mejor por el apoyo de los préstamos, ya que las inversiones han sido buenas.
texts.en:
Noemí wants to continue operating and strengthening the business.  She always wants to improve customer service in order to keep her customers.

This time she will buy corn, oil, and firewood so that her production will improve and so that her clientele situation is stable.  

She believes that her family’s financial situation has been better because of the support of the loans.  The investments have been good.

loans.use: to buy corn, oil, and firewood.

loans.name: Bich

texts.en:
Ms. Bich is 37 years old with 2 children who are attending secondary school. Bich is an elementary nurse. After working hours, Bich creates extra money buy raising pigs for meat.

Joining in our credit program in 2004, she has used loans effectively in raising pigs. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 9,810,000 Vietnamese dong to buy food for pigs.

loans.use: to buy food for pigs

loans.name: St. Mary's Malongwe School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Steven. He is the Head teacher of St. Mary’s Primary School Lugazi, a mixed school in the Urban area of Lugazi in Buikwe with 500 students. St. Mary’s Primary School Lugazi has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

St. Mary’s Primary School Lugazi will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Steven ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Bikakhanim

texts.en:
This 40-year-old young woman is married, has 2 children, lives in Salyan region, Yenikand village.
She has been selling milk.
In the beginning of her busines , she borrowed a loan of $200 and bought a milch-cow.
For the second time he borrowed a loan of $500 and bought 2 pedigree cows and 100 compressed clover.
Now she needs a loan of $1000 to buy 4 pedigree cows.
She has been engaged in this business for  years.

loans.use: To buy 4 pedigree cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Cultivate rice

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Mrs. Ny N. is 33 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia.  N. and her husband run a business where they purchase cabinets from furniture-makers, then sell these cabinets to people throughout the province of Kampong Cham.  They are able to make about $7 per day from this business activity.  The couple has three children, all of whom are students.  N. and her husband hope to use this loan in order to expand their business by purchasing more cabinets to sell.  Additionally, they hope that they will have leftover money from the loan to repair their house to protect it from leaking during the rainy season.  In the future, N.'s husband hopes to use his skills to work as a mechanic and open a shop from the family's home.

loans.use: To purchase more cabinets to sell for her business

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.en:
Francisco is an artisan shoemaker specializing in men's shoes of medium quality. He has no family and lives alone in the Ferropetrol neighborhood of El Alto.

He is requesting this loan to purchase raw materials - leather, lining materials and inplants - to meet the increased demand he has seen since 2004.

This will be his 5th loan with IMPRO; his excellent payment history qualifies him to receive this loan, which will allow him to expand his shoe production and increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Francisco es artesano y elabora calzados de varón de mediana calidad. Vive solo y no tiene familia. Su casa esta localizada en la Zona Ferropetrol de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito que solicita será para comprar materia prima: cuero, forros y plantillas, y así satisfacer la demanda que de acuerdo a sus indicaciones se ha ido incrementando en el transcurso de estos años, desde el año 2004.

Es el quinto crédito con Impro; el buen comportamiento de pago de los cuatro créditos anteriores le faculta para acceder a otro préstamo para que mejoren sus ingresos e incrementar la producción de sus calzados.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es:
Modesto is a 26 year old young man who dedicates himself to the transport of passengers. Currently, he owns 5 motorcycles that he rents out to third parties who themselves work as motorcycle taxis. Modesto operates one motorcycle taxi himself. There is a lot of competition in the city of Montero in the province of Santa Cruz de la Sierra but in spite of this, there is high demand from passengers who utilize the motorcycle as a means of transport due to its practicality and speed in driving through challenging terrain. The loan requested will be used to purchase an additional motorcycle since demand for this service is increasing. The purchase price is dependant on where and from whom he purchases the motorcycle. This is Modesto’s sixth loan request and he has always demonstrated great responsibility with his loan payments.

Translated from Spanish by Christian García , Kiva Volunteer.

Modesto es una persona joven de 26 años de edad que se dedica al transporte de pasajeros. Actualmente cuenta con 5 motos las cuales las alquila a terceras personas para que las mismas puedan trabajar como moto taxis, una de las motos es manejada por él. Modesto es joven pero tiene mucha experiencia en este rubro. La competencia es bastante elevada pero pese a ello, en la ciudad de Montero del Departamento de Santa Cruz de la Sierra, hay bastante demanda de pasajeros que utilizan la moto como medio de transporte, debido a su practicidad y velocidad para llegar a difentes lugares. La presente solicitud es para adquirir una moto más, ya que la demanda de este servicio es bastante creciente, el precio de la misma depende de quién y en que estado compre. La presente solicitud es la sexta en nuestra institución y en todo este tiempo Modesto demostró ser una persona responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.

loans.use:
Motorcycle purchase

Compra de una moto

loans.name: Zenobia

texts.en:
For nearly 20 years, Zenobia has been buying and selling a specific type traditional dress worn by the women in the region of Ayacucho, Perú. As one walks down a street in Ayacucho, it is very common to see the women wearing beautiful, brightly colored and intricately embroidered skirts. This skirt is called a “centro” and the slips that are worn underneath to add fullness are called “fustanes.” Zenobia has capitalized on the long standing popularity of these beautiful skirts and sells them to many clients in the area.

To obtain her supply of skirts, Zenobia travels to the nearby city of Huancayo, where the skirts are mass produced. These she brings to her stand in one of the markets just outside the city of Ayacucho to sell. Because the skirts are so finely detailed and of such high quality, they are very expensive. One skirt, she explains, sells for 400 Nuevo Soles, or about $130 USD. This is so prohibitively expensive for the majority of Zenobia’s, that many buy an outfit on credit or even pay her in food products, such as cereals instead of the Peruvian Nuevo Sol.

Zenobia explains that when she joined her village bank some 10 years earlier, she only had enough capital to request a loan of $50, an amount that doesn’t even come close to the purchase of a single skirt. Today, however, after much hard work and diligence, Zenobia is able to request a loan of $500. This growth, Zenobia explains, would not have been possible without the help from her village bank. Not only has it provided her with ample economic opportunities, it has also taught her how to be a confident female leader. All this has made the support of her 5 children and husband much easier. With the $500 she is requesting, Zenobia will be able to buy more skirts in Huancayo to sell in Ayacucho. She says she is constantly working toward her ultimate goal of opening her own store in downtown Ayacucho.

loans.use: To buy more skirts to sell.

loans.name: Marie Ayawa

texts.fr:
Born in Lomé on 15 September 1947, Mrs. Marie Ayawa K. is a widow and has five (5) children in her care. Brought down by paralysis (hemiparesis) of the right side of her body, she is a dedicated woman and sells food products (gari, sugar, peanuts, ice water, oil, etc.) on the side of the road in her area with her small means. For this project, Mrs. Marie is asking for a loan of $600 in order to increase her capacity and to expand to selling other preserved goods and food pastes. This will give her financial support and a second chance to improve her living conditions and especially her services for a better return.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née à Lomé le 15 septembre 1947, Madame K. Marie Ayawa est veuve et a cinq (5) enfants à sa charge. Terrassée par la paralysie (hémiplégie) de la partie droite de son corps, elle est une femme dévouée et vend au bord de la route dans son quartier les produits alimentaires (gari, sucre, arachide, eau glacée, huile etc.) par son petit moyens. Par ce projet, Madame Marie sollicite un prêt de $600 afin d’augmenter sa capacité et associé la vente d’autre produits de conservation et pâtes alimentaires. Ce qui lui donnera un soutien financier et un second souffle pour l’amélioration des conditions de vie et surtout ses prestations pour un bon rendement.

loans.use: To buy and sell food products

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en: Saleh is a 35 year old married man. He lives in south Lebanon, in the region of Tyre. Saleh has 4 childre and is a paving specialist. Saleh is a very reputable and respectable man. This is the first time Saleh is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. He needs to buy material for his business in order to generate enough revenue to conduct repairs on his home.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Doña Dolores is a widow with four children who are dependent on her. She has a refreshment stand and an ice cream parlor where she works every day and on the weekends and she also sells a beef dish. Through these activities she maintains her house and her kids. Every morning, she starts to prepare her refreshments and icre creams that are of high demand by her clients . In the middle of the week, she begins to prepare to sell her beef dish, which take 2 days to prepare.

All of her children support her business, since with her advancing her age, she needs the help. She administers and attends her business. She needs to buy supplies to prepare her refreshments and prepare her beef dish. Every week she buys materials for the dish, whose prices may rise and that will affect her ability to buy them. Many times the prices for the same amount of materials vary.

This story has been translated from Spanish to English by Nikita Ramchandani, KiVA Volunteer.

Doña Dolores es viuda, tiene 4 hijos quienes dependen de ella, tiene una refresquería y heladería la cual atiende todos los días y los fines de semana, también vende nacatamales, con esta actividad esta madre mantiene su casa y a sus hijos. Cada mañana empieza a elaborar sus refrescos y helados, los cuales tiene una buena aceptación y demanda por sus clientes, a mediados de la semana empieza a preparar los nacatamales lo cual le llevan 2 días para hacerlos. Todos sus hijos la apoyan en el negocio, ya que por su avanzada edad necesita de ayuda, ella administra y atiende su negocio. La señora necesita comprar insumos para elaborar sus refrescos y preparar sus nacatamales, ya que cada semana compra la materia prima que requiere en cada producto que elabora y las alzas en los precios de los productos le están afectando a la hora de adquirir sus insumos, ya que muchas veces no ajusta para comprar las mismas cantidades con las que siempre trabaja.

loans.use: To buy fruit, vegetables, pork and a sack of sugar.

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es:
Silvia Elena, a young woman at 36 years old, lives in Villa Reconciliacion with her husband, who is also a merchant, and their 2 young kids, who are 5 and 1. They both used to be workers, but when their 1st child was born they decided to start their own business together, so they resigned and with the money they had they started a small shop in their house, as this allowed them to be near their son, and now both their kids. The family unit is very important for them, as are looking after and educating their kids personally. They have had the shop for 4 years and they sell all kinds of foodstuffs and basic household goods. They now have the chance of enlarging their small business, and they would like a loan to do this. With the money they will buy materials such as cement, iron, wood etc. Once done, they would better be able to offer more products. This marriage fights every day to improve the business, and therefore provide better opportunities to their kids.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

SILVIA ELENA, joven mujer de 36 años de edad, habita en Villa Reconciliación con su esposo que junto a ella es comerciante, y sus 2 pequeños hijos de 5 y 1 año de edad. Ambos trabajaban como operarios en una Zona Franca, al nacer su primer hijo decidieron montar un negocio juntos por lo que renunciaron y con el dinero de su liquidación montaron un pulpería en su casa lo que les permitiría estar cerca de su hijo y ahora de sus dos hijos ya que para ellos es importante la unión familiar, cuidar y educar personalmente a sus hijos. Tienen 4 años de tener su Pulpería en la cual venden todo producto de alimento y aseo personal básico en toda casa, ahora con posibilidades de ampliar su pequeño negocio solicitan un préstamo para ampliar el local del negocio, con este préstamo comprará el material como es cemento, hierro, madera etc. Una vez ampliado podrán ofrecer mayores productos de ventas. Este matrimonio lucha cada día por mejorar su negocio y así brindar mejores oportunidades a sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy building materials to enlarge her business/Comprar materiales de construcción para ampliar su negocio

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is 40 years old and married, with three children. She and her husband also take care of four other children.

Salma owns a small food vending store, which she started in 2004. Every day she works from 7am to 9pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $230 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food inventory, such as bananas, rice and potatoes.

loans.use: To buy more food stock for her business.

loans.name: Holbegim

texts.en:
The loving mother of two adult sons, H. Holbegim is 57 years old and married to a taxi driver. In order to increase the family income, for the last three years Holbegim has been selling vegetables and fruits such as tomatoes, cucumbers, potatoes, apricots, apples, and strawberries in the local market. Holbegim’s workday begins at 5:00 a.m. when she buys produce from the local farmers in order to sell it in the market. Her elder son helps her with the business.

Now Holbegim is planning to pay for the higher education expenses of her younger son and to arrange the marriage of her elder son. For this reason she is planning to purchase an increased range of fresh fruits and vegetables to sell, as now it is the season and her goods are in great demand. For this purpose she requests a $500 loan for a 6 month term. Your support will really help Holbegim and her sons..

loans.use: To increase the range of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Zuhra

texts.ru:
Zuhra H. lives in Abdurahmon Jomi. She lives with her family. She has 5 children. She works in animal husbandry. She has several milk cows for milk, which she sells wholesale. But maintaining so many cows is hard since the price of feed has increased. Therefore, Zuhra wants to take out a loan to stock up on feed. It will allow her to produce quality, high-fat milk and to keep old clients. Perhaps she can even attract new clients. She will be able to pay off the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Хасанова Зухра проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Проживает со своей семьей. Имеет 5 детей. Занимается животноводством. Имеет несколько дойных коров , молоко , которых продает оптом. Но содержать такое количество коров тяжело так как цены на корм возросли. Поэтому в данный момент Зухра хочет получить кредит и запастись кормом. Это позволит ей получать качественное и жирное молоко и сохранить старых клиентов . а может даже привлечь новых клиентов. Погасить кредит она сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Buying animal feed

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth E. is a fishmonger. She is married, but her husband's income as a fisherman is not sufficient for Elizabeth and her 5 children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

Elizabeth is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina es madre soltera, vive con sus dos hijos Mariana de 12 años y Owen de 5. Alejandrina dejó su natal Patambuco, para buscarse un mejor porvenir en la ciudad de Juliaca, donde reside hace un año con sus dos pequeños hijos, para solventar sus gastos se dedica al negocio de la venta de ropa durante todo el día, de forma ambulatoria.Le gusta vender ropa ya que es un trabajo que le permite ser independiente, la desventaja es que a veces, por falta de presupuesto, no puede adquirir las cantidades de ropa que el público demanda. Alejandrina se esfuerza día a día con el único propósito de sacar adelante y ver profesionales a sus dos menores hijos.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Alejandrina is a single mother who lives with her two sons Mariana, 12, and Owen, 5. Alejandrina left her home, Patambuco, to look for a better future in the city of Juliaca where she has lived for over a year with her two young children. In order to pay for their expenses she sells clothing all day in the informal market. She likes selling clothes because it is a job that allows her to be independent; the disadvantage is that sometimes, due to her lack of capital, she is not able to acquire the amount of clothing that the public demands. Alejandrina works ever day for the sole purpose of giving her children a better life and allowing them to become professionals.

loans.use: Increase the amount of clothing she sells in order to increase her profits.

loans.name: Magda

texts.es:
La señora  Magna, socia del BC “Picota”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Picota. Se dedica a la venta de gelatinas y gaseosas, y por las noches vende juanes y anticuchos. El negocio está ubicado en su domicilio en el Jr. Fernando Belaunde Terry, lugar donde atiende a los clientes, los cuales son los vecinos y transeúntes que visitan su distrito.   

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará gelatina en gran cantidad, gaseosas de diferentes marcas tamaños y sabores, arroz, aceite y otros productos que necesita para la preparación de los juanes y anticuchos como pollos, aceitunas, huevos, etc. y que los clientes encuentren lo que les guste, ya que uno de sus secretos para mantener a los clientes es atender sus gustos.

Magna tiene 62 años de edad y vive con su esposo. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, quien desea seguir creciendo en el negocio. Su meta es contar con un local para aperturar un restaurante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Magda, member of the “Picota” Community Bank, lives in the region of San Martín, province and district of Picota. She dedicates herself to the sale of J-ELLO and soft drinks. At night she also sells tamales and kebabs . Her business is situated in her home at Jr. Fernando Belaunde Terry, where she attends her clients, many of whom are neighbors or passers-by visiting her district. With this loan of S/. 1,000, which she will repay in 6 installments, she hopes to buy large quantities of J-ELLO, different brands, sizes, and flavors of soda, rice, oil, and other ingredients necessary to make the tamales and kebabs such as chicken, olives, eggs, and so forth. As one of her business secrets is catering to her clients’ particular tastes, variety is essential to her business. Mrs. Magda is 62 years of age and lives with her husband. She considers herself a very hardworking and responsible woman, who wishes to keep expanding her business. Her ultimate goal is to own a local to open a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing large quantities of J-ELLO, sodas, rice, oil, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Con Proposito Group

texts.en: "Mujeres con Proposito" is a group of 15 women looking to receive their first loans. All members of this group are living in extreme poverty, and decided to try and do something about it. This loan they receive is going to go towards starting their own small businesses which they hope to grow. Romona is the chosen group representative, and she was chosen by this group because they felt she was ready for this role, and is a person of great diligence and leadership. She is the mother of four children, and sees this as a chance to provide for those children. She plans on opening a small clothing store and someday dreams of having a large store and her own vehicle. On behalf of Romona, the group, and Esperanza International------ Thank you for your support!!!

loans.use: These women would like to improve their families' lives by starting their own small businesses.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica es socia de Banco Comunal Mar del Plata.
Angélica es conviviente, tiene 50 años y 5 hijos de 26, 24, 22, 20, y 14 años, solo el último de sus hijos está en el colegio. Sus  demás hijos  trabajan.
Angélica tiene su negocio  desde hace 20 años, ella vende golosinas como ambulante frente a una botica..     
Angélica necesita un préstamo de 400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de golosinas.  
Angélica sueña con tener asesoramiento  para poner un negocio grande quisiera  una tienda.
texts.en:
Angelica is a member of the Mar del Plata community bank. She's 50 years old, partnered and has 5 children who are 26, 24, 22, 20 and 14 years old. Her youngest child is still in school and the rest work. Angelica has operated her business for 20 years. She works as a street vendor selling candy across from a pharmacy. She needs a 400-soles loan, money that she'll invest in merchandise for resale. She would ultimately like to set up a larger business with her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Betty Gloria

texts.es:
La señora Betty Gloria tiene 53 años de edad, pertenece al Grupo Solidario Manuel Seoane y vive en Mz 2  lote 2 de Winchanzao,  distrito de La Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió hasta el segundo año de secundaria y no lo concluyó porque se casó a los 16 años. Actualmente tiene 8 hijos, de los cuales fallecieron 2 niñas gemelas. Todos sus hijos viven independientemente.
Su negocio consiste en la venta ambulante de útiles de limpieza. Con su primer crédito de S/. 200 que canceló en 4 meses invirtió en la compra de desinfectantes y escobas.
Con este crédito de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en mercadería.
Betty sueña con ser mayorista de productos de limpieza.
texts.en:
Betty Gloria is fifty-three years old, belongs to Manuel Seoane Support Group and lives in Mz 2 lot 2 of Winchanzao, district of La Esperanza, in the province of Trujillo, apartment La Libertad, Peru. She studied until her sophomore year of high school and did not finish because she got married at the age of sixteen. Now she has had eight children, two of which were twin girls who passed away. All her children live independently. Her business is in the traveling sale of cleaning products. With her first loan of S/. 200, which she repaid in four months, she invested in purchasing disinfectants and brooms. With this loan of S/. 500, which will be repaid in four installments, she will invest in merchandise. Betty dreams of being a wholesaler of cleaning products.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Carmen, socia del Banco Comunal “El Alto Mayo”, vive en el Departamento de San Martín, provincia y distrito de Rioja. Se dedica a la  venta de ropa para damas caballeros y niños. Su negocio está ubicado en un puesto que tiene en el mercado central de la ciudad.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará ropa para damas como polos, blusas, pantalones, ropa para niños y niñas para atender los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes quienes son la razón de su negocio, además quiere aprovechar las fiestas de fin de año.


Carmen tiene 38 años de edad, vive con sus 02 hijos y con su esposo quien le apoya en sus proyectos. Su meta es seguir con su negocio, mantenerlo bien surtido para fidelizar a su clientela y capturar nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
Carmen, a member of the "El Alto Mayo" Communal Bank, lives in the department of San Martin, province and district of Rioja. She sells clothing for women, men and children. Her business is located at a stand she has in the city's central market. With this loan for S/. 3,000, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy women's clothing such as t-shirts, blouses and pants, and clothing for boys and girls, so that she can take care of her customers' requests, since they are the reason for the business, and she also wants to take advantage of the year-end holidays. Carmen is 38 years old and lives with her 2 children and her husband, who are supportive of her projects. Her goal is to keep the business going and well-stocked so that she maintains her clients' loyalty and gets new clients.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase women's clothing, such as t-shirts, blouses and pants, and clothing for boys and girls.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
El Señor de Nombre José Antonio González tiene la edad de 40 años, su estado civil es casado, Don José tiene 2 hijos sus edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor de 16 años cursa el 3 año de secundaria y su otro hijo de 11 años cursa el 5 grado de primaria, su compañera de vida labora no vive con el actualmente ya que trabaja fuera del país en busca de mejor vida para sus hijos y su familia, los propósitos de Don José son de incrementar su negocio y darles estabilidad a sus hijos en los estudios ya que debido a la situación del país algunas familias se ven obligados a sacar a sus hijos de estudiar por no tener suficiente dinero sus sueños son de establecer otro negocio que le servirá de apoyo para que sus hijos sepan administrar el negocio y el día de mañana no presenten dificultades para enfrentar las situaciones duras de la vida en sus sueños esta que su esposa regrese a Nicaragua con el fin de que encuentre trabajo aquí y pueda cuidar de sus hijos y estar con su familia y logra la calidad de vida que tanto deseaban.

La actividad  económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 16 años, Don José inicio esta por su familia ya que al principio la pulpería estaba a cargo de su esposa y ella empezó con capital propio y decide comprar productos como: huevos, golosinas, arroz, aceite y refrescos naturales su esposo siempre la apoyo en la administración de la pulpería pero ella necesitaba mas ingresos para su familia por lo que decide viajar al exterior en busca de trabajo y es su esposo quien asume el cargo de la administración de la pulpería y es así como trata de sacar adelante a su familia al principio no tenia muchos conocimientos de cómo manejar el negocio por lo que al comienzo fue difícil ya que tenia que realizar las compras tenia que hacerse cargo de sus hijos y además tenia que ocuparse de su casa pero con el tiempo logro hacerse cargo de todas estas cosas y fue así que obtuvo su negocio por lo que ahora pide un financiamiento destinado de capital de trabajo ya que tiene que realizar las compras de granos básicos, golosinas cosméticos y ropa además desea invertir en los útiles escolares ya que se acerca la temporada y quiere ofrecerle a sus clientes la variedad de productos.
texts.en:
José Antonio González is 40 years old and married. José has two children: his older son is 16 and in his third year of high school and his younger son is 11 and in Grade 5. His partner does not live with him for now because she works far from their country trying to make a better life for her children and her family. José's goal is to improve his business and create stability for his sons in their studies: because of the situation in the country, some families are removing their children from school due to a lack of money. His dream is to start another business which will help him, so that his sons can learn to manage the business and that in the future they will brave the hard times in life. He dreams that his wife will return to Nicaragua, that she can finally find work here and care for their children, be with her family and achieve the quality of life which they want so very much. José has been selling groceries from his home for the past 16 years. He started the business for his family; the grocery store was initially his wife's responsibility. She started it with her own money and decided to buy products such as eggs, sweets, rice, oil and juices. Her husband always supported her in managing the grocery store but she needed to make more income for her family and therefore decided to travel and look for work outside the country. Thus, her husband took over the grocery store and has been trying to support his family with the business. Initially it was difficult becaues he did not know much about managing the business - he had to learn to buy the goods - as well as care for his sons and do the household chores. With time, he learned to do all these things. He is now asking for a loan to use as working capital as he needs to buy staple goods, sweets, cosmetics and clothes. He also wants to invest in school supplies as school will be starting soon and he would like to offer his clients a choice of products.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.es: Antonieta  tiene 58 años y vive con su esposo en su propia casa. VenD. artesanías a base a lana, las elabora en su casa todos los días y utiliza el telar, que es el principal instrumento D. trabajo que tiene para producir grandes cantidades, ya que ella es abastecedora D. estos productos artesanales, una vez que termina D. elaborar sus productos las reparte en las principales ferias turísticas y comerciales D. su zona. A un inicio realizaba sola estos productos, pero actualmente sus hijos y algunas personas que contrató realizan este trabajo para cubrir la creciente demanda D. sus productos, lo cual es un indicador  D. que su negocio tiene un futuro promisorio. Es la primera vez que Antonieta está solicitando un préstamo en MFP, ella fue invitada a formar parte D. su banco comunal por ser  una mujer  empresaria y trabajadora, la cual es garantía  para las integrantes D. su  grupo. El dinero que solicita es para comprar los materiales necesarios para la elaboración D. sus artículos, comprará lana D. oveja y también yute, el paquete D. cada uno se estima en 500 soles por lo que comprará uno D. cada tipo.
texts.en:
Antonieta is 58 and lives with her husband in their own house. She sells handcrafts maD. of wool, which she weaves on a daily basis on a loom, her main item of equipment, which enables her to produce large amounts; she is a major supplier of handcrafts, which she delivers to the tourist markets and stores in the area.

She initially produced the handcrafts alone but, because of growing demand (an indication of a promising future for her business), her children and some hired employees are also involved.

This is Antonieta's first loan application to MFP; she was invited to join the community bank because she is hard-working enterprising women, which is a guarantee for the members of her group.

The loan is to buy new raw materials, namely wool and jute, which are estimated to cost 500 sol per bale, so she will buy one bale of each.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials to make handcrafts

loans.name: Abdurahmon

texts.en:
Abdurahmon is married and the father of 3 children. He is a farmer. Together with his wife (pictured) they grow potatoes, tomatoes, and cucumbers, work with which he is hopeful of making progress and providing what is necessary for his family that needs it. For that reason he wants to invest in his production, expand his crop fields and improve the quality of his products.

Abdurahmon knows that if he takes care of his land and works diligently he will reap excellent products that will have a better reception in the marketplace. The request Abdurahmon makes is to purchase the seeds and fertilizer necessary for his land. Support this hardworking father so his effort is worthwhile!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Him

texts.en:
Him K. lives in Prey Dork Pong village, in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice.

Her husband, Non Voeun (right in photo), is a construction worker.

Him is requesting a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve their living.

She is 53 years old and the mother of four children. Two are employed in a garment factory. Another stays at home to do housework. The youngest attends a local school.

loans.use: Requesting a loan to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Mamadou Saliou

texts.fr:
Mamadou Saliou D. tient un commerce de détail au quartier Château d'Eau de Ziguinchor; Ce pére de famille de tois enfants sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son commerce et augmenter ses bénéfices.
Il a jusqu'ici travailler sur fonds propres et souhaite prendre un envol.
texts.en:
Mamadou Saliou D. runs a retail shop in the Château d'Eau neighborhood in Ziguinchor. This father of three is seeking a loan to bolster his business and increase his profits. He's been relying on his own funding until now, and wishes to take off.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for his business

loans.name: Keleya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe  Keleya  sont toutes mariées dans des familles  monogames avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et  3 enfants. Elles habitent à Sanoubougou I un des  quartiers de la ville de Sikasso  3ème région administrative de la république du Mali.
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de pagnes, de produits de beauté et de  savons. 
Elles sont à leur  cinquième   collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but  de  satisfaire le besoin de leur  clientèle et augmenter leur profit. Tous les prêts précédents se sont   bien dénoués. 
Elles comptent acheter , 50 pièces de pagnes, 30 cartons de produits de beauté et 30 cartons de savons.  Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso, Bamako et dans les villages environnants. 
Les marchandises sont vendues au grand marché de Sikasso ville  sur place et  de façon ambulante au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour aider les maris et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités et le remboursement du prêt.
Les femmes du groupe Keleya  ambitionnent de devenir des commerçantes grossistes.
texts.en:
The four women of the group Keleya are all married in monogamous families and average 39 years of age and 3 children each. They live in Sanoubougou I, a district of Sikasso City (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali) and do a diversity of work, including selling pagnes (colorful West African cloth), beauty products, and soaps. They are on their fifth collaboration with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of satisfying the needs of their customers and to increase their profit. All the preceding loans have been settled.

The group members intend to buy 50 bolts of pagnes, 30 boxes of beauty products, and 30 boxes of soap. Supplies are gotten at the grand marketplace of Sikasso City, in Bamako, and in surrounding villages. The merchandise is sold on credit at the retail level to customers composed generally of women at the grand market of Sikasso City, locally, and door-to-door.

The group members each envision realizing an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA. A portion of the profits will be used to help their husbands, and the other portion will be invested in business and used to repay the loan. Their ambition is to become wholesale merchants.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Shila

texts.en:
Mrs. Shila M. lives in Thecho. Thecho is located in Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this area are engaged in agricultural farming. 
Mrs. M. lives in a joint family with her father-in-law, husband and three children. Her older son is studying in grade 12 and her younger son is studying in grade 8. Her daughter works in her own cosmetic shop.
Both Mrs. and Mr. M. are engaged in their own small restaurant. They opened their restaurant two years ago. They sell different types of food items in her shop. Especially they sell Newari food in her shop because the demand for Newari food is increasing. They also sell tea and coffee in her hotel. Now Mrs. M. is requesting an Rs 10000.00 loan to expand her business to purchase necessary food material for her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Reina De La Paz Group

texts.es: El grupo “Reina de la Paz” es un grupo nuevo que esta integrado de catorce  personas,  de las cuales 4 son hombres y 10 mujeres todos ellos se dedican a diferentes actividades como la venta de comida, gas, ropa, elaboración de pan, servicio de transporte público y a la educación de niños en escuelas. El nivel competitivo es alto pero las socias saben como salir adelante con la venta de sus productos, pero requieren de un apoyo económico para las épocas bajas en las cuales se requiere cambiar de productos o aumentar la mercadería es por esta razón que requieren del financiamiento. A pesar que el grupo es nuevo cuenta con la experiencia de grupos solidarios debido a anteriores financiamientos en instituciones similares a al fundación Agrocapital quien les brinda un apoyo para agrandar sus negocios y a mejora la calida de vida de sus familias.
texts.en:
The "Reina de la Paz" group is a new group composed of fourteen people, of whom four are men and ten are women. All the members do different things to make a living, such as selling food, gas, or clothes, baking bread, providing public transport and educating children in schools. There is a high level of competition, but the members of the group know how to stay afloat with the sales of their products. However, they need economic support for the low periods during which they need to change products or increase their merchandise, and for this reason they require financing. Despite the fact that the group is newly formed, they have experience of support groups of this kind due to previous financing from instiutions similar to the Agrocapital foundation, who offer support to grow their businesses and improve the quality of life of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Keaveney, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es: El señor Marcos Antonio F. P., tiene la edad de 38 años, habita en el barrio Santa Rosa, ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa, la cual trabaja y le apoya con las actividades del hogar, ellos tienen a su cargo cuatro hijos, todos estudiantes, los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida, don Marcos desde hace 10 años se dedica a los trabajos de ebanista, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , el inicio esta actividad con sus propios esfuerzos , los planes hacia un futuro para su taller es poder ampliar el área donde laboran. Con el préstamo va a comprar materiales de construcción y herramientas para trabajar y poder cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Da las gracias Afodenic por el apoyo que le da mediante dos créditos y plazos para hacer la mejoras para su negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Marcos Antonio F. P. is 38 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Santa Rosa, located in the town of Ticuantepe, with his wife, who works and helps him with the household activities. They have four children, all of whom are students. Their plans for the future are to improve their lives. For 10 years, Mr. Marcos has been a cabinet-maker. The biggest difficulty that he has faced is a lack of financing. He began this activity through his own effort. In the future, he plans to increase the workspace in his workshop. With this loan, he is going to buy construction materials and work tools, so that he will be able to meet the demand of his clients. He thanks Afodenic for the support that they gave him by means of two loans and payments that allowed him to improve his business.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood and tools to make his products

loans.name: Maria Lucinda

texts.es:
La señora Lucinda es socia del Banco Comunal Nuevo Amanecer, un grupo que consiste de 13 socias que viven en la comunidad de Zhidmad, aproximadamente 30 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca, en el sur de Ecuador. Las principales actividades en la zona son la agricultura y la ganadería.

La señora viene de condiciones muy humildes y tiene pocos recursos. No sabe leer ni escribir, pero siempre ha sido muy cumplida y responsable con sus pagos en su banco comunal. Tiene 47 años, es divorciada, y tiene una hija, la cual le acompaña a sus reuniones de banco comunal. Su hija está casada y tiene un hijo pequeño de un año, pero su esposo está trabajando en el extranjero, entonces ella vive con su madre. Lucinda cría animales en su casa: tiene 20 cuyes, 25 pollos, y una vaca pequeña. Vende sus animales a negociantes para su carne. Toda su vida ha criado animales. 

Lucinda está pidiendo un préstamo para poder hacer su último pago de un terreno que se está comprando. Piensa usar el terreno para la siembra de papas y maíz.  Ella ya lleva más de 5 años trabajando con su banco comunal, y dice que le gusta porque es un apoyo que le ha ayudado a invertir en sus animales. Piensa seguir con su banco comunal en el futuro.
texts.en:
Lucinda is a member of the Nuevo Amanecer Community Bank. The group consists of 13 members who live in the Zhidmad community, which is approximately 30 minutes outside of the city of Cuenca in the south of Ecuador. Farming and agriculture are the primary activities in the area. She comes from very humble conditions and has few resources. She does not know how to read or write. But, she has always been responsible about making her payments in her community bank. She is 47, divorced, and she has one daughter. Her daughter goes with her to her community bank’s meetings. Her daughter is married and has a small, one year old son. Her son-in-law is working in another country, so her daughter lives with her. Lucinda raises animals at her house. She has 20 guinea pigs, 25 chickens, and one small cow. She sells her animals for their meat to merchants. She has raised animals all of her life. Lucinda is asking for a loan to be able to make her last payment on a piece of land she is buying. She will use the land to plant potatoes and corn. She has been working with her community bank for five years. She likes it because it is a support that has helped her invest in her animals. She thinks she will continue with her community bank in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for land she is buying to be able to plant potatoes and corn

loans.name: Samira

texts.en: Samira (her husband is pictured) was born in 1986. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan Fuzuli region, now settled in Alkhanli village. This family has been in the cattle breeding business for five years. Now they need a loan of 2000 AZN to buy four calves to improve their cattle breeding business.

loans.use: To buy four calves

loans.name: Henry Armando

texts.es:
Henry tiene 40 años de edad, es casado, y vive con su esposa y sus dos menores hijos de 15 y de 2 años en el anexo Ciudad de Dios, que se ubica en la carretera Chiclayo – San José, a 10 minutos de la ciudad.

Tiene un pequeño puesto en los exteriores del Mercado Modelo de la ciudad de Chiclayo en el que vende sandalias desde hace tres años, las compra en la frontera con Ecuador para luego vendérselas a sus clientes a 10 nuevos soles; anteriormente se dedicaba al comercio de frutas en ese mismo puesto pero, como dicho negocio no le resultaba rentable, decidió incursionar en el negocio de venta de sandalias.

Su actividad es la única que brinda a su familia los recursos económicos diarios, por lo que mantener su puesto y a su clientela resulta crucial para él, todos los dias trabaja con valentía y optimismo y su esfuerzo, poco a poco, esta dando resultados.

Henry desea brindarle a su hijo mayor un mejor futuro, el ya esta terminando su educación secundaria y su mas grande anhelo es poder brindarle algun tipo de educación superior, debido a ello el desea invertir en la compra de más mercadería (sandalias) para ofrecer a sus clientes, por lo cual está solicitando a nuestra Institución un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles, que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

El lleva ya mas de tres años trabajando con nosotros y ha demostrado ser responsable y puntual en sus pagos por lo que es considerado como un cliente excelente.
texts.en:
Henry is 40 years old, is married and lives with his wife and two children of ages 15 and 2. They live in the suburb of Ciudad de Dios, which is located on the road to Chiclayo – San José, ten minutes away from the city (Chiclayo).

He has a small booth in the Modelo Market in the city of Chiclayo, where he’s been selling sandals for three years. He buys the sandals at the border with Eduador and sells them to his customers for 10 nuevos soles. Previously, he used to sell fruits in the same booth, but it wasn’t profitable. He decided to switch to sell sandals instead.

His business is the only income his family counts on for their daily needs, which makes it crucial for him to keep his business going. Every day he goes into work with a lot of courage and optimism, and his efforts are slowly paying off.

Henry wants to give his older son a better future. He is about to finish high school and Henry would like for him to get a higher education. To accomplish this, Henry would like to purchase more sandals for resale. He is requesting a loan of $700 (2000 nuevos soles) to help him reach his objective.

Henry has been working with Edpyme (micro-finance institution) for over three years. He has proven to be responsible and timely with his payments, which makes him an excellent client.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wholesale sandals for resale

loans.name: Sreypov

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreypov C. lives with her husband, Mr. Pich Pin and her children on an Island of the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. Her husband is a hairdresser.

Sreypov is a silk weaver and she sells her finished products to a middleman in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. She doesn’t have enough capital to purchase raw materials (silk, cotton thread), so she is requesting a loan of US$300 to make the purchases.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for continuing her weaving business and buy cow and ox to raise.

loans.name: Nestly

texts.en:
Nestly is 21 years old and she is already married.  She and her husband Arnold were gifted with a one year old son named Prince Lhary.  

Nestly is engaged in food vending business.  In the morning she sells sells vegetables which she usually purchased in Cauayan public market. In the afternoon, she will then sell different snacks like halo-halo (is a popular Filipino dessert that is a mixture of shaved ice and milk to which are added various boiled sweet beans and fruits, and served cold in a tall glass or bowl).  Aside from this she also sells barbecue stick. As a young parent, she will do everything to become a responsible mother to her eldest child and future children. Life will be difficult without her cooperation and initiative to start a business. She just hope that her business will not be affected by calamities and other factors that could possibly affect her business growth. 

Nestly is asking for financial support from KIVA lenders. She is requesting to avail a loan of PHP4, 000 to be use as her additional capital and to maintain her business.  She hopes to avail the said loan because she believes that it will make her business become progressive. And she wanted the loan to gain income by investing it to her business. She really hopes that her loan will be approved.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Vaida

texts.en:
Vaida J. is 28 years old and married with a husband who is a businessman. She has 3 children who go to school.  She is currently in the business of selling various items in her shop and is requesting a loan to purchase bags of salt and sugar to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, Vaida hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase bags of salt and sugar to sell

loans.name: Marjun

texts.en:
Marjun S. is from the village of Esperanza, Kinoguitan, Misamis Oriental. He is 22 years old, is married, and has one infant child.

Marjun owns and operates a business providing passenger transport services (motorcycle transport) to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Marjun joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials use for the repair and maintenance of his motorcycle. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family’s income. 


About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: repair and maintenance of motorcycle

loans.name: Uk

texts.en: Uk S., 36, is a village woman living in Siem Reap Province. She is a local crop farmer, growing rice, vegetables, and some fruit on her own farmland. To help meet the family's daily expense needs, her husband uses his own motorcycle to provide a taxi service and is earning approximately $5 a day. Uk S. has two school-aged kids. Recently, Uk S.'s husband can't earn much income because his old taxi has broken down and he can not pick up his passengers. To solve the problem, Uk S. applied for a loan to buy a new motorcycle which will enable for her husband to continue providing his service.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle which will enable her husband to continue his taxi service

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice J. is from the village of Talahiron, Kibawe Bukidnon. She is 40 years old, married, and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Alice owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community. Alice has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Alice joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alice has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Alice is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Alice from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase shop items in bulk

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: A. Hasan was born in 1983. He is single and lives in the Fuzuli region. Hasan earns income operating his own auto repair business, which he started 3 years ago. Now, he needs a loan of AZN 2,000 to buy spare auto parts to expand his business.

loans.use: Purchase of spare auto parts

loans.name: Lux Estela

texts.es:
la señora Lux Estela L. M. tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive en casa de la mama, tiene una hija que depende de ella y la tiene estudiando.
Lux tiene un negocio de pulperia que tiene 10 años, ahi vende maiz, arroz, frijoles, harina de maiz, manteca, aceite y varios productos de consumo popular.
Lux esta solicitando el credito para surtir su negocio, desea tener mayor inventario de productos ya que en el lugar en donde tiene su negocio solo llegan una vez por semana los vendedores y ahorita no tiene mucho capital para comprarles mercaderia, por tal razon esta solicitando el credito...
Su deseo es que dios reine en los corazones de todos los habitantes de Honduras.
texts.en:
Ms. Lux Estela L. M. is 43 years old, is a single mother and lives in her mother’s house. She has a daughter who depends on her, who is studying. Lux has a grocery store business that she’s had for 10 years. There she sells corn, rice, beans, corn flour, butter, oil and other popular consumer products. Lux is requesting a loan in order to stock her business. She wishes to have a greater inventory of products in the place where she has her business. The venders only come once a week and right now she doesn’t have much capital to buy merchandise. For this reason, she is requesting the loan... Her wish is that God reigns in the hearts of all of the inhabitants of Honduras

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soap, razors, toilet paper, tooth paste, powdered soap, sugar, rice, beans, tortillas, margarine, butter, oil, eggs, bread, cookies, churros, soft drinks, canned juices, dairy products

loans.name: Jocelyn's Group

texts.en:
Jocelyn M. is from the village of Solinog Clamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old. Jocelyn is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Jocelyn is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising pigs to sell. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $230 a month from this activity.

In 2010, Jocelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Jocelyn is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.
